text: We were in Pittsburgh for a special occasion and decided to try Meat and Potatoes. We had a reservation and we were seated right away. I loved the atmosphere. It was pleasantly full but not crowded. No tvs at the bar which made for a lovely ambience. Our reservation was for later in the evening so the restaurant seemed to clear out with the theatre crowd. Our waiter was great, attentive without being overbearing, knew the wine list backwards and forwards and was lovely. We got the fried chicken livers and Cobb salad and then the steak for two with a chocolate dessert. All of it tasted delicious - well seasoned and generous portions on the sides. The only very minor drawback is the two top tables are very close to each other and it feels a bit like you are dining with the couple next to you. I would definitely recommend to friends who visit Pittsburgh.

This place is fantastic. Been here twice now and have tried most of the apps and small plates. So I'll just say the curried mussels are crazy good. We lap up the broth until there is nothing left. Huge portion too. The pork belly tacos are smoked wings are the newest favs fir me. Atmosphere is great too. Always lively and not too many jerks present. Go go go yo!!!

Service was poor (no silverware when my food arrived, begging for coffee/water refills...) and ambiance was dreadful. Sunday brunch and there's a middle-aged, top buttons undone, "DJ" pumping out crap from the corner of the room. Saturday night, sure, I'll expect bad dance music and deal with it but Sunday Brunch!? I asked an employee if the music could be turned down since the bass was so out of control I needed ear plugs but the volume remained the same. Cool bloody mary bar concept but it was messy, you can't make your own rim because the alcohol's already in your glass, and it always seems a little unsanitary...My food was decent but this place is trying too hard and is not good enough for a return.

Went here for a nice dinner before a show. The bartender decided he knew girls better than we knew ourselves and insisted on making us fruity martinis rather than the dry martini we requested. Finally he agreed, and he made the two worst martinis ever. When we didn't drink them and ordered wine, he made fun of us for not liking our drinks.  He was the most annoying bartender I've ever experienced. Then our Red wine came in HOT milk glasses.  It was gross.  And the food? Mediocre is too generous of a description.

A really neat dining experience, esp. when ordering the giant rib eye on the bone.  It was cooked to perfection, tasted awesome and the muscles with tomatoe were the perfect appetizer.  We couldn't quit sopping up the sauce with garlic toast and I enjoyed my dining experience, very much, here!

Meat & Potatoes is one of the best examples of what the Pittsburgh food scene is up to! I love this restaurant and would definitely recommend it to anyone. It is constantly topping the charts as one of Pittsburgh's best places to eat and is great for lunch, brunch, cocktails or dinner.  I have been here on multiple occasions (including work-related lunches) and have not been disappointed.    The Meat & Potatoes for Two might be my favorite thing on their dinner menu. It is a beautiful, mouthwatering, bone-in 34 oz Ribeye, cooked to your liking (medium-rare for me) served with bone marrow gratin and steak fries... Amazing! I substituted poutine for the steak fries (for an additional charge).   I also think they have one of the best burgers in the city (their lamb burger is my go-to burger in the 'Burgh). Their Monday night late night menu features a nice variety of burgers and snacks to help kick-start your week.  Starting Oct. 6th they will begin POUTINE MONDAYS Nightcap ...  Stay current with seasonal menu pages and check out their website or Facebook page for details.  All in all their servers are super friendly and knowledgeable and the bartenders are very skilled and creative.   Not only is the food delicious but I also love the atmosphere- the dim lighting sets the tone for a perfect date night! I recommend pulling up a seat at the bar and letting the bartender take care of you. Their full menu is served at the bar so this is also a great option if you are coming in last minute without a reservation.    I love the food, love what they are up to and will definitely keep coming back for more (hopefully you will too). Enjoy!

My favorite bunch spot with yummy offerings and of course the bloody mary bar. I have never had anything that I didn't like here, even taking some picky eaters with me at times. I highly recommend this trendy Pittsburgh spot.

We've been to Meat and Potatoes many times, and we've never been disappointed. This brunch visit was no different, with amazing service from Crystal for a party of 18 - no small feat. The specialty cocktails (this time with vodka, proseco and fruit juice) are always a treat, and they have a small but impressive craft beer list. The food is the real star, though. The short rib hash is among the best dishes I've ever eaten, and the eggs in purgatory and banana French toast got rave reviews from friends. Absolutely a must stop for brunch or dinner.
Went to the restaurant for my birthday  dinner  before a show. It was the best  dinner  my best friend and I have had in a long time.  The service is outstanding.

My wife loves bone marrow, so that drew us here, but the menu is full of awesome tastes and the 33 oz bone in rib eye for two was magnificent!  Rachel, our server, was superb and the wine selection was perfect.  When in Pittsburgh a again, we will be back!!
The worst service ever. We didn't stay to eat because the hostess was so rude.

Incredible meal and a great value in an interesting setting. I had the marrow and steak, both were amazing. Bring an appetite if you order the pork, it's huge! Decent wine selection, good cocktail list.

my friends and i had been on the road for a few days and, no offense to anyone, but the food culture in the midwest is bizarre. that's why meat and potatoes was a pretty life affirming meal. flavors were done right. our dining area looked like it was probably the manager's office recently and the food was a tad pricey, but after eating at casa nueva in Athens, OH this place was like an oasis in the Sahara Desert.
Great place for just about any dish, best to reserve a table as it gets very busy

As soon as I entered the restaurant I immediately felt like I was "fancy pub" better known as a gastropub. The chairs ( I agree with Rachel C.) were fantastically comfortable and the ambiance of the restaurant was just outstanding.   The food was absolutely delicious, at first we ordered the "grilled bread" with goat cheese butter and rhubarb, and although I'm not a fan of rhubarb my friend thought it was delicious and wanted to take it home. I thoroughly enjoyed the goat cheese butter and toast!   My main meal was the roast chicken and potato's with gravy, and yes it was heavenly. I made sure to eat every last bite even if I was full.   The waitstaff was also very kind and friendly and was always making sure we were ok. Even a manager came at the end just to double check.   All in all a great experience!
The chicken and waffles were DRY. I like the idea of having an entire chicken served on top of a waffle, but the breading was flavorless and one of the pieces was pink on the inside.

In Pittsburgh for one night looking for a place near my hotel and found this place.   I was blown away.  I had a local brew with the chicken livers to start,  I've never had chicken livers like this.  They were light and so delicious with out any of the typical liver aftertaste served with a great sauce with a nice spicy kick.   My entre was the wagyu steak, very nicely done.   So much on their menu to explore I will be back.   Reasonable prices too....large appetizer of livers was only $7.

This place was amazing! Their whole menu is spectacular so you won't be disappointed. My favorites were the brussels sprouts and the spaghetti squash as starters and then the duck as my main entree. I can see why this place has over 1200 reviews!

Restaurant came recommended by hotel staff.  First impression was positive.  Comfy seating for patrons while they wait for their table.  Staff was friendly, and the service was good.  The menu was eclectic.    I took the waiter's recommendation for appetizer, selecting the tartare.  This was a great choice!  Main course was wagyu flat iron.  Entree was prepared well with unique flavors (kolrabi and pickled veggies).  Didn't blow me away though.   Apps/Dinner/drinks for two was ~120 with tip.   Above average, but not sure it warrants a return trip for out-of-towners.

I love their cocktails!! I'm usually very picky on cocktails because not every bartenders know what there are doing.  I like drinks that are strong and taste good (like I'm not paying for soda).  Besides drinks that are excellent, foods are very good too, especially on Monday late night special, juicy Lucy, fantastic!! Only $5, must try!

I went for Industry Night on a Monday. I guess it's an all poutine menu for that weekly. It was interesting and the service was steller! The food was kind of meh but I mean... It's fries. I wasn't expecting much.  I did go back for bone marrow! It was great.

The food is very good. Will visit again when have enough time. Will try the steak that for 2 people, it needs one and half hour to cook, didn't have enough time last night. The only bad thing is that the table is too close near each other, i wanna sit not between two many people, because thats birthday dinner, but still, they don't have any available.

Food was good, not great.  My wife got the pot roast and that was pretty good.  Service was terrible.  Our server was slow, disappeared for long periods, and never refilled our drinks.  We had saved room for desert because there was a raspberry bread pudding that looked really good, but by the time our server reappeared, they were out of it... So we just paid and left.  The people next to us had similar issues and their server forgot the bread for their marrow and by the time he checked on them, they were done with their meal so told him not to bother.  It also seems like they are trying a little too hard to be cool and trendy.  I am sure being located in the cultural district that is expected, but it feels forced and over done.  Overall, I would say it was pretty average. There are plenty of better places to eat in Pittsburgh.
It was sooo wonderful!!!  Salad/ Brussels sprouts / Pot Roast.  Exceptional!!!

This place is my absolute favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh!! I tell everyone I know who travels to the 'burgh to make reservations in advance. I could easily gush about everything on their menu and their specialty drinks, but one of my favorite things is the bloody mary bar on a Sunday morning. Can't wait for my next trip back :)

Most of the restaurants in Pittsburgh offer the regular fare, so I went thinking that this could be an exception. Yes, the ambiance is cool, good place to people watch but the price you pay for the experience is too much.  I went in with 5 of my co workers. The waiter Abby, felt like she was doing us a favor serving us. The first thing any good waiter would do is to try and give an overview of the restaurant (kind of food etc) and tell us about the specials. None of that happened. In fact I had to point out and ask her if there were any specials. She simply told us that the specials were on the board behind us and expected us to read through! Such was the snootiness. I put up with it, as I didn't want to cause a scene. She took the orders and it was 35 minutes before the food showed up!! Never bothered to explain why it took so much time and never kept us updated.  Pretty bad experience. Compared to certain classy restaurants like Six Penn and Habitat in Pittsburgh, this place is more pretense and less class. Food was ok, but if  you don't feel welcome, what good is the best food? Go there if you want to drop a wad of cash and ruin your evening

The atmosphere was great. Good misic, lighting, and the barteners were really friendly.  We ordered a few small plates and split them between the four of us.  Drinks are reasonably priced and made really well.  Will definitely go back next time I visit Pittsburgh.

If you are going to a show, this could not be more convenient.   Not to mention that the meals (fish, beaf, chicken, and duck) are awesome.   If you need reservations for a group or special occasion ask for Matthew who is unbelievably effective and accommodating.  Best restaurant in the cultural district. .. hands down.

We were visiting Pittsburgh and came here based on an online article "25 Best Restaurants in Pittsburgh 2012" and the concierge at our hotel. I liked that they did not have a run of the mill menu. I ordered the duck (pastrami coated, served with saurkraut pierogies, dandelion greens, on the side.) They had no kids menu but my son ordered the Kobe corn dog with wasabi aioli and flat bread with short ribs, blue cheese, cheddar, arugula, and horseradish.  The food we ordered was tasty. The duck was cooked right and the flavor combinations were enjoyable. I recommend reservations. They were fully booked and we ended up ordering to go and ate at the hotel. The crowd was mostly young adults to middle age. No children (except for mine). The hostess and staff were friendly considering how busy they were when we came. The cost was a little bit on the high side but not outrageous. If I am ever back in Pittsburgh, I will definitely come back.
Food is awesome when I'm downtown and I feel like eating I make this a stop all the time there's a lot to do in this area I love the cultural district

Easily one of the better burgers I've ever eaten. I had the pub burger.  It was topped with pastrami pork belly, "special sauce, " and a sunny-side up egg.  Delicious.  My wife had salmon, which she thought was very well prepared.  Fries could use a second frying for more crispness.  Really enjoyed the  Brussels sprouts app.  One of the better Manhattans you'll find.
Best meal I've had in a long time. Bone marrow, tartare, and the ribeye for two. Service was great, food was too. I can't wait to go back.
One of the top restaurants in the city.  The food and drinks are top notch.  The seating in the bar area is a bit odd.  But, you forget about it when the food comes.

Ate here on Sunday May 12th with a friend. Food was not good. I'm open to variations on a Caesar Salad but this one did not work. Brussels sprouts were overcooked and overdressed. My friend had their  baked chicken and it was bland. We both thought that there was little talent in the kitchen.   Also, we each ordered a glass of wine and these were served in water glasses. That may work in an Italian place with lots of ambiance and where the wine is not expensive, but here it just came off as cheap. Wine at these prices should be served in wine glasses.

The food was excellent!  My girlfriend and I stopped in for brunch prior to a Steelers game and were not disappointed!  I had the Chicken & Waffles, which were absolutely delicious.  I loved the spiciness in the skin of the fried chicken.  The Jalapeno Cheddar waffles balanced very nicely with the Bourbon, Bacon Syrup on top!

I ate here for the first time last Friday, so 2 days ago.  Pros:  - Food.  Decent fare with some rather interesting items.  I enjoyed my beef tartare and my mussels.  However, Point (and Park) Brugge's mussels are leagues better.  Nothing wrong with these ones though.  - Beer.  They have some nice choices in terms of quality, although it seemed like the number of choices was a bit limited.    Cons: - Service.  The first person I encountered was an incredibly rude hostess.  If you're the girl with the very curly, red hair and you're reading this, get out of the service industry.  It obviously doesn't suit you.  She ignored me, then was rude to me, then told me it'd be a 45 minute wait, then ignored me again.  On the other hand, the other hostess was congenial.  She was able to seat us right away.  Our server was also nice as was our food runner.  Nevertheless, the hostess is the first person you see and helps set the tone for the whole experience and my started off poorly.  - Food.  While my food was fine, my friends' was not.  They each got a sandwich that consisted of a breaded pork cutlet, ham, bacon and topped with a fried egg.  The problem is that the cook put a copious amount of salt on top of the egg.  Let's go over this.  You have a sandwich with ham and bacon and you're dousing it in salt?  No.  - Decor/theme.  I know almost everyone on here enjoys the look/feel of this place, but I feel it is just all over the place.  In some ways they make it feel like a western style saloon.  But then they have the servers in mechanics' uniforms.  Additionally, mason jars are being done to death.    Verdict: A decent enough place, and I wouldn't mind going back, but I'd rather go to other new places or ones I consider better before returning.  Not a bad choice if you need a place to eat before/after going to one of the theaters.
Get the Berry alcohol drink. I cannot remember exact name. Very tasty. Didn't try the food. Great service.
Went on a work trip and was able to grab a seat at the bar. The drinks were amazing and the hanger steak special was on point. I would go back for another meal as soon as possible.

Sunday brunch is exceptional, but be sure to have a reservation. We shared the fried taters. They are unbelievable good and was a generous portion for four people to share. I ordered the Bruschetta, which is a must for mushroom lovers. My husband had the chicken and waffles. The portion is huge and was absolutely delicious.  The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because I'm not a huge fan of their dinner.

Great dinner. I had the Devils on Horseback and Pork Pappardelle. My lovely had the Beet Salad and Spring Chicken. We shared a Strawberry Cheesecake in a jar. Great service. Highly recommend. Book early. We'll go back, no doubt.

I love the bar here. The bartenders are all amazing, incredibly helpful, friendly, and knowledgable. They can make you amazing drinks, and can give some great recommendations too. It can be pricey for the cocktails, but they are worth it. The craft beer selection is cheap if you're into that, too.  The brunch is fab, and the $5 bloody mary bar, including house-infused shots, is one of my favourite things in the universe. Just saying.  This place can get hectic, and there can be quite a wait. The food is pricey, but portions are generally pretty generous. The snacks are great and cheap to compliment a night at the bar.  Lots of out-of-town businessmen and even celebrities regular here. It is generally a 30+ bar crowd.  You're not allowed to sit at a table and just order drinks. It doesn't matter that drinks are mostly $10+ and it doesn't matter that there are lots of open tables. I found that very rude and off-putting when I was refused a table on a Monday night because I didn't want to order food at 11pm.

The meal was delicious but our service was lacking. Our server never once checked on us until time for the bill. We had to ask to find our server to get a cocktail.  For the price service should be better.

Was very much looking forward to dining at M&P after recently seeing it on I believe it was The Food Network. Happened to be in town for the Trans Siberian Orchestra concert (wonderful experience) so thought to give it a try. Reservations were for 5:30, arrived at evening opening and was seated almost immediately when they opened at 5. Provided menu and service items by a nicely interactive wait staff member. We already knew what we wanted so was able to order fairly quickly. We started with fried pickles, and for the main course ordered the $75 steak for two along with rosemary potatoes and roasted cauliflower. The waitress did warn that the size of the meat would take 45 minutes to cook which we understood and still would have plenty of time to make it to the concert. The pickles arrived very rapidly. They were okay, thickly breaded and thick cut pickles but flavor was a bit lacking (primanti brothers and Buffalo Wild Wings both do fried pickles much better). And now the wait...  Meat was horribly under cooked.  Instead of medium as ordered it arrived blue rare at best.  It was so full of myoglobin it was like it was just sliced off the animal.  After getting the waitresses attention, they offered to take it back to finish cooking, this took another 15 or so minutes and now the potatoes were cold, sadly as they were great before that.  The amount of blood and gore with the first presentation pretty much destroyed our appetites.  The waitress had the manager comp the sides.  With this experience, I can't and won't recommend the restaurant, if you do brave it, don't order this meal unless you have vampiric appetites.
Sunday Bloody Mary bar is incredible! Try the bacon vodka as a base, its delicious!

I've been here multiple times. The first was for a bachelor/ette party. We booked the party room in the back and had excellent service. The menu was limited because we were a private party, but everyone found something they liked. The reason I LOVE this restaurant though is brunch. Sunday brunch is about as good as it gets in my world, and M&P's is the best. The Bloody Mary bar is phenomenal with every possible addition you can think of from standard veggies, to mozz cheese, to horseradish. They also infuse the vodka's themselves. Go to brunch!

Had meat and potatoes for two a 45oz ribeye with chimichurri and bearnaise (don't get saucey with me...), spinach and and the best rosemary potatoes. Service is a bit disjointed with random people asking you stuff and a drink took a long time but waiter was very good. Ribeye was very good Americans usually screw up thick cuts (you need to go to Tuscany and have a bistecca fiorentina this was close to there). We ordered medium and it was medium. Too much food for being out of town (couldn't have a doggie bag). If I lived in Pittsburgh I'd be a regular!

This is one of my favorite restaurants downtown! Their dinner menu is great, I always love getting the pappardelle. They used to have Coppola Sofia Blanc de Blanc which was fun but I guess the don't have that anymore.   I have also been here a couple times for brunch, which I would recommend. They have a nice Bloody Mary bar and the short rib hash is fantastic! :)

Another 5 star... My wife and I went to Meat & Potatoes for after dinner drinks and dessert. Both were delicious. This place has a Prohibition vibe, menu and decor.   We had the fried chicken livers and brussel sprouts. Both were very good. So was our service - we sat at the bar.   Next time I'm in Pittsburgh I'll be visiting.

This was my fourth and least favorite visit, so I'm treating this as an anomoly for M&P.  We started with the Tartare (his choice) and Ahi Taquitos, followed by two specials: Lamb Belly (his) and Mahi over chowder.  We finished with a shared chocolate pot de creme.  From the cocktail menu, the Aviation and the barrel aged Manhatten were ordered.  I usually order the delicious Fried Brussels, but passed on them this time to try some new items...note to self ALWAYS get the Fried Brussels!!   The cocktails were very good, but, also very expensive...they so well made that I would order again! The Tartare was okay, but, the main flavor was salt...loved the soft boiled egg on top. The Ahi Tacquitos were overwhelmed by the dense mini corn tacoshell and the entire appetizer just tasted of corn taco...the corn taco shell tasted like like a store bought, big brand name, taco.   The Lamb Belly entree was ambitious, but, it didn't have a huge amount of flavor; the Mahi, over a thin layer of potato/sausage chowder, was a much better choice, but, still only ~4 stars due to a disconnect between the mahi and the chowder. The chocolate pot de creme is a standard, and was delicious, as usual. The service was fine, no complaints there...but the mirror behind us seemed to be a distraction to our server, as she often watched herself attend to our table.  We will be back, as the menu is so varied and the flavor combinations are always fun...we will just choose more wisely, next time!

This is one of my favorite spots. The only reason I didn't go for the full 5 stars is that even with a reservation - you might still wait. The ambiance is great. Low key vibe and awesome decor. The food is amazing. I almost always go for the mussels, which can't be beat. But we've also shared a lot of the apps and been impressed. Backroom is great for larger groups or work related entertaining as well. Fun place to go but be sure to make a reservation well in advance!

Absolutely wonderful! Went here with a friend, shared fried pickles, she got the Plain Jane burger and I got the Three Little Pigs sandwich, and everything was delicious! My sandwich had what I believe was bacon, ham, and some kind of fried pork on it with swiss and an egg over easy on huge grilled bread, and it was incredible! The fried egg really made the sandwich. The fired pickles came with some kind of spicy ranch sauce, and they were great- seasoned well, thick, and a great portion to share for two for only $5. Totally recommend!

This was my second trip to Meat & Potatoes, and again I am very impressed. For those that place so much on decor, it is appropriate and fun.  It has the gastropub and butcher shop feel. The cocktail list was outstanding!  I loved the drink special "London Fog" (had 2 of them), and the Sazerac was delicious also.  Unbelievably awesome beer list.  I'm not a fan of their wine list, but I am very picky.  Also, I do not look at this place as a wine hotspot. The food was excellently prepared.  Everything was properly seasoned, and the burger was exactly med-rare!  Finally, someone who knows how to cook to temp!  The mussels were so good we took the leftover broth home. The only thing I did not like is the way the daily specials were presented.  They are so intricate and expansive that they need to be presented in writing (not on a chalkboard on the wall, because my date couldn't see them).  Instead the server verbalized all of them and after the first 2 minutes of that spiel I gave up on following along.  Please make it more accessible. All in all, I love it, and will be back!!!

This is one of my favorite places to go in town. It can be hard to get a seat at the bar unless you arrive early. Their food is always on point, especially the brunches. The drinks are really why I come though. The bartenders are great and I've never had a bad drink here. Each time I come there is something new on their cocktail menu!

I went here for lunch with a friend, and it was a pretty nice experience.  The high rating is due to the food - it was really delicious.  The food had enough ingredients to make sandwiches etc. more upscale, without going over the top.  It's a place I can take my foodie friend to, and also my, for lack of a better word, meat-and-potatoes boyfriend.  The interior was lovely - dark brown and white coloring, a little cramped (but pleasantly so, if that's a thing), and intimate.  The dessert was a pomegranate rosewater cheesecake.  I think that's all that needs to be said.  The reason why I'm not giving it 5 stars is the price and the service.  The price is a bit higher, which I have no problem with if the experience is worth it.  Although the food was delicious, the overall experience just wasn't up to par with what we paid, in my opinion.  The service was also painfully slow for lunch.  Most restaurants open for lunch downtown move at a faster clip than dinner, since most patrons are taking a 1-hour lunch break.  Eating there took almost 2 hours.  Overall, I would still go back there in a heartbeat.  The food and atmosphere was great, if you don't mind paying a little bit more and have the time.
Not sure what the hype is all about. Food was served at room temperature and the flavors were ok. We got devil on horseback, lamb burger, and the duck main course. The service was good though.

Food was great. I had Irish eggs Benedict and bf had brisket flatbread. Absolutely delicious. And decent price. Decor in here is great too. Service was ok. Nothing outstanding.  Atmosphere- tables of 2 behind the bar are very tightly spaced. I felt like I was dining with the couples next to us. Also the bar directly behind us and in line of sight had all the dirty glasses stacked in a corner. At least 15 of then just sitting on the corner. Bar patrons seemed to take note of the unsightly stack too. More and more got added and none were picked up to be cleaned.

My husband took me here and it was an awesome atmosphere with great service! I cant wait to go back and try other dishes. We had the huge steak for two which is served on a cutting board and bone marrow. This was not something Ive experienced before but was cool. My dogs were happy with the foot long bone that steak had :)

Buckle up and brace for disappointment. This is perhaps the worst hype-to-results ratio I've encountered since the Phantom Menace.  I sat at the bar all three times, and the service was abyssal all three times. Just don't sit there. The drinks were stingy and unremarkable.  There are a lot of pretentious types here. They flock here. The steaks are subpar. And I mean sub-Sizzler. I threw mine out, and I don't throw out steak. But most of all, for the love of all that's holy, don't get the stupid bone marrow. Not unless you like the taste of unflavored gelatin spread on a cracker, in which case, knock yourself out.

In short, very disappointed with both the service and uninspired kitchen.  As a business, M&P lacks true character by trying to fulfill too much and does not hit any of the marks correctly.  If you are a person who shops via brand name itself, this will be the place for you.  If you are a person who says this chartreuse and maroon tie I'm wearing would go great with a black IPA, head elsewhere.  1. Pretentious. Having lived in Austin and Portland, you get a sense of style about a place.  This has the sense of going too over the top in many areas such as the decor and music choices.    The bartenders have "prohibition era" hats and some obligatory hipster beards while the music was a bouncy jazz song that played on repeat trying to mask the noise from the crowded place.   As others mentioned, the tables are extremely tiny geared for a lounge and go type of place.  The menu calls canned bear as "Tin" .  With all that room on the menu, should it not simply say "Not on draught" or "Bottle".  Why not "Aluminum"?  Personally, go breaking bad and just put the scientific symbol "AL13".  But as others mentioned, a PUB means beer on draught; put the bottles on another list - in fact, just put the drinks on another list.  Refer to Peche in Austin, TX for the right way on how to focus on a "theme" (in Peche's case, limited french food, Absinthe and Prohibition cocktails)  2. Basic Stewardship underwhelming in a cultural district. Sorry to say, but the staff did not seem to engage with customers more than a basic order taker.    The server did not have knowledge about the beers and could not articulate the flavors of the specials on the menu for us to care; you were left to do the addition.  e.g. Mussles + Curry + White Wine = "Oh yeah, a light spicy flavor with a salty twinge"  When asked about the wine and drink list it was a similar reaction.  3. Menu needs love The menu was fairly large and had multiple sections to work with.  There was nothing that called itself out as "I'm why they call it M&P bitch" other than the also obligatory (Amarillo Texas Styled) Big steak  Like many early gastropubs, they try focusing on the (fancy?) ingredients more than the mood they're trying to hit with the food.  Give it a condensed description and useful name.  "Flaming Firey Wings of Damnation" is a good example.  With a name like Meat and Potatoes, just lay it out there on one side in big letters of MEAT.  Show off the proteins in bold.  4. Food is uninspired.  Had the smoked wings (per other recommendations) and as a self-identified wingman, these were lightly smoked but could have come from Quaker down the block.  The sweetbread tacos were interesting as a different meat but it too lacked a palate definition.  I tried very hard to interrogate the server on other options.  Even to suggest a place with "Meat" in the name should try different styles of beef.  Refer to Victory 44 in Minneapolis, MN for the right way.  With a name like Meat and Potatoes, you expect hearty.  With a floral patterned menu and jazzy beat you get not gastropub but "new American"

The DJ began spinning a Space Odyssey remix. The doors opened promptly at 10:30, and a small riot of unreserved patrons made a barely restrained rush for the bar.   Meat and Potatoes is not quite as down-home as it sounds. Pâté and bruschetta are on the Sunday brunch menu. Michelle's Bellini was made with real strawberries, and my Bloody Mary bar was a DIY festival with six kinds of meat, probably two dozen pickled things in jars and just as many varieties of hot sauce.   And yet, if there are two kinds of good menus--inventive deliciousness and calculated deliciousness--this definitely was the latter. Maybe it was the decor: I just can't take antlers seriously in a new downtown cultural center. Maybe it was needing to decide between chicken and waffles, shrimp and grits, huevos rancheros AND stuffed French toast.   I ended up with E: None of the Above, but it was hard to know if I was eating brisket hash or a marketing gimmick.

Have been here twice, both times for brunch. Chicken & waffles were always a big among the group, as was the bloody mary bar, both of which are good reasons to go here for brunch. They also have other good Sunday brunch beverages, and a good selection of menu items for whether you want sweet or savory, or both. Monkey knuckles were also pretty good. Service was decent, and the price was fair for a downtown area. This place is definitely on my suggestion list for visitors staying in the downtown area, and would be the kind of place that I'd take my mother to, knowing she'll find something she likes.

This has become my favorite brunch spot. Kudos Pittsburgh on making it difficult for me to decide. Their bloody mary bar is an adult candy store where you can accessorize your mug of belvedere's with pickled turnips, ochra, cornichons, and at least a dozen different hot sauces.  Besides the drinks, the food is all phenomenal. Best eggs benedict. Pastami to die for. Be back soon!

Have been there for brunch several times and it's as good as it gets!    From the Bloody Mary Bar with your choice of infused vodkas to the Bellini's of the day, brunch starts off right.  Have tried most of the menu between ourselves and our friends that we keep taking there and haven't been disappointed with anything.  My/our only complaint is that the music is a too loud and makes for a difficult conversation...but guess we don't  need to talk when the food is so good!!!!!

Excellent food! We had the bone marrow appetizer, my husband had the super generous sized three pigs sandwich, while I dined on the hanger steak special. Great flavors, well cooked, good presentation, and great service. Only dock a point because our table was only inches away from the other tables on either side of us which really distracts from the experience. All we heard was the conversation taking place next to us rather than each other. Great place - just need a bit more space!

This is definitely a restaurant that truly gets it. One could be on thee Left Bank or Soho. It is that good, and without the pretentiousness. There are no mistakes on the menu.  We've tried them all for 30 years. Now we have our restaurant!

Was excited about trying this place but the concensus of the 4 people in our party, is that this restaurant was a C (on a grading scale of A-F). Food was just ok. Service was just ok. The music at brunch is too loud and when I asked for hot sauce with my brunch order, I was told to get it myself from the Bloody Mary Bar.
Great food, great atmosphere and reasonable prices relative to the quality of the food served.  I would call the food style gourmet comfort good.  I really like this place!

The service is always fantastic here and the food is to die for. This is one of those places you just keep coming back to so you can try everything! I'm a big fan of the bone marrow in particular as an appetizer. My only regret is that one time I went in for lunch and they had a "beef brisket poutine" - it was literally the best poutine I have ever had, and they haven't had it on the menu since! My kingdom for their brisket poutine! But that being said, I'm sure anything they do with brisket is amazing.

Absolutely amazing. Went to celebrate my birthday. The staff was funny and helpful, even called us a cab for the ride home. Food was fantastic, I recommend the whiskey buffalo wings and the hanger steak. Would DEFINITELY go again (already planing our next night out!)

Still to this day, my all time favorite restaurant. Even better now when I get to go since I no longer live in Pittsburgh.  First off, make a reservation! Even if you plan on going on a Tuesday night. The place is very popular (rightfully so) and also in the theater district, so on the nights there are shows, packed. If you want to go on a Saturday, I recommend making a reservation at least 3 weeks ahead of time. OR you can do what my friends and I did this past Saturday...They open at 5:00pm and the bar is first come first serve, well, we made sure to be first. We got downtown around 3:30pm and had a drink a bar close by until about 4:45pm, we walked over to M&P and waited at the door until they let us in! We got the corner of the bar, which was perfect for the 4 of us. Cecil was our bartender, which I was happy about, we had him before and he knows his stuff! Not to mention, just a great personalty-makes the experience that much more awesome! :)  My boyfriend and I shared the dry aged strip tartar--amazing. served with a  smoked soft boiled egg, capers, chili, peanuts, and grilled bread. Be sure to open the egg up so the yolk oozes all over the dish, spread a little bit of everything on the bread and there you go..a bite of heaven.  As my meal, I got the Hudson Valley Duck Breast, which I knew I was getting long before we got there. It's soo fantastic! I like mine medium rare (how I would get my steak) and yes, it eats like a filet. This time it was served a little different from the last time I had it, which was a nice surprise! (it wouldn't have been a surprise if I read the menu lol) It was served with sauerkraut pierogies, chimichurri, and warped in pastrami-my mouth is watering as I type this..also thinking of my next trip back!  The drinks they offer are fun and nothing you'll find anywhere else.  A must try! But plan ahead! Enjoy!! :)

Good place for a pretheater meal. Very crowded even at 5:30.  Make reservations. Well dressed crowd for the most part, with a big bar scene  Had the bone marrow. Three huge bones. Felt like Fred Flintstone. A very good version (very reasonably priced). Was saturated (at least fat-saturated) after that, but still managed to have the hangar steak (very good, and fortunately very lean). In my fat-induced haze couldn't remember what my wife and daughter ordered. Something healthy no doubt. They seemed to enjoy it. Had the Aviation and Sazerac cocktails which were quite nice.

My family and I thought we would try meat and potatoes on a recent trip to Pittsburgh while staying downtown. Take a page out of what not to do at a restaurant here! We stopped by and while waiting for them to see if they had a table, they asked if we were going to the game which we were not. They basically said when asked they would get us right in if we were but put us on a waiting list which was going to be 40 minutes. We went in to wait by the bar and saw five empty tables. Ashley who took our name, came in five minutes later and basically told us there were OTHER PLACES IN TOWN to eat.  What the f?..  After back and forth, she pulled one of the five empty tables out of her a$$ and miracously got us a table. Service still sucked as our waiter rich could care less about getting us drinks let alone dinner. Food was great and my only recommendation is the owner/manager should fire rich and Ashley tomorrow   These two suck holes are costing them a lot of business.

Our server could barely communicate the specials because of the loud music. My brunch was a breakfast americano. The sausage was dry and overcooked. The eggs were not done as I had asked and the bread was soaked in butter. I just ate the potato gratin and left hungry. When I went to use their restroom there was no soap in the bathroom and saw one of their servers leave without washing their hands. I would not come back here. I would leave zero stars if possible.

We happened to walk pass this place and decided to stop in for brunch.  We sat at the bar.  Let me just say, the food was great but Mai, the bartender, was excellent.  She gave us great suggestions l, was very engaging, and took great care of us.    I started writing this review before we received the check.  My husband mentioned that we're in Pittsburgh enjoying our wedding anniversary.  Mai then surprised us with a celebratory drink.  She is simply awesome!

Fantastic brunch. We really enjoyed the Bloody Mary bar! I had the huevos rancheros and my wife had the eggs Benedict - both were delicious. This was our third visit. Consistently good service every time. Highly recommend.

The food we had here was innovative and really tasty. Unfortunately our waiter seemed lost, we asked about their specials and he told us there weren't any, and then 15 minutes after ordering he told us actually they do have specials and finally read us the list. However, once the food came out we had no complaints! The atmosphere was warm and the chairs were really soft. We didn't get drinks but the menu looked interesting definately worth coming back to try.

My friend and I decided on a little preseason "tailgating" and came here for drinks and apps. As I walked in the door, I received some snobby looks from the host stand, but ignored it. The look was like "what are you doing here". Whatever. I found my friend at the bar and we caught up for a bit. It literally took them 8 minutes (I kept time) for them to acknowledge me and tell me the specials. After scanning the restaurant, I noticed some specials on their mirror from the other side of the room (no one told me about them). I ordered a peach and herbs drink (bourbon). The drink itself was good, but no real taste of peach, just bourbon. It was good, but I know I could've made a better one. My friend had a Southie she said was good.  We ordered the mussels with bread, fries and truffle aioli. Not kidding, about 1/2 my mussels were empty :( The bread was soggy and it wasn't from the broth. The fries were ok. I noticed they put all the long fries on top and left us with crumbs on the bottom. Really?   So my friend excused herself to the ladies room as I continued working to try and find a mussel with meat (the mussels were ok too, not fabulous). I'm not joking here...THREE PEOPLE asked if they could dump my empty mussel bowl...THREE PEOPLE! There were only like 4 more mussels to finish. I had to shoo them away. The guy sitting next to me even made a comment and I said this was something like a Seinfield episode (leave me to my mussels!). Lol!   FINALLY, I finished and they were so happy to take my empty mussel shells away. Wow, had you given me the attention upon my arrival, Meat and Potatoes, I might not have wrote this review.  All in all, Meat and Potatoes is like a really hot guy: yes, you're hot and nice to look at, but very shallow, snobby and conceited. Yes, their food is good, but you better pair that with outstanding service, which we did not receive. With you being in business for all this time and with other restaurants giving stellar service, you should know better by now, Meat and Potatoes-hence the 2 stars.

Condescending staff at reservation desk, rude waitress  Great mac n cheese appetizer Tuna tacos were overly salty and inedible Salmon was cooked well but the seasoning on the kimchi was odd and distracting  Very overrated restaurant Spend your money at one of Pittsburgh's better restaurants with more considerate staff

Excellent drinks and food. Service has always been friendly and professional. Very comfortable atmosphere to eat and drink. I prefer to sit at the bar. If you sit at a table, your table might be right beside the next table. The drinks are some of the best in Pittsburgh. They make their own simple syrups.  Brunch is fantastic. I love the Bloody Mary Bar.
Visited once awhile back and have been craving to go back. Food was absolutely delicious.

Wow!!! First time to Pitt...first time here, next trip to Pitt, no way I'm skipping this place! Their Bone Marrow dish...mind blowing good!!!! I had the Wagyu for dinner...great quality steak and the sauce they paired it up with was amazing and packed with flavor!!!

This is my first time in Pittsburgh to see a football game and decided to go out to Meat & Potatoes for dinner our last night. We completely dominated the food here. It was phenomenal.   Ordered the muscles with cured bacon they were very clean and delicious, I hated muscles for the longest time and tried them here and are half the plate. For the entree I ordered the Hudson Valley Duck Breast when I've never eaten duck before and I loved it. It was cooked perfectly with pastrami and chimichurri sauce.   Great combination of art food and people! Next I will trying their second restaurant, The Butcher and the Rye.

Went here with coworkers last night while visiting PGH. Great atmosphere and staff. Cheese plate and mushroom risotto is excellent. Wagyu beef is also outstanding - diverse menu but lots of familiar items that make it tough to decide! Definitely check it out if in Pittsburgh.

The food here definitely did not disappoint. Started off with the tartare, which we had never tried before. I was slightly taken aback when we were asked if we wanted bread with it, which was an extra charge. Not sure how you're supposed to eat it otherwise, but I definitely enjoyed it. I chose the salmon for my entree and it exceeded my expectations. So amazingly flavorful, I'd have to say it's the best salmon dish I've ever had. My only complaint about this place is the seating. I understand they have a small space to work with but the tables are extremely tiny and very close. It's almost awkward when another couple is seated beside you and there is essentially no table room left once the plates arrive.
This place is amazing. I had the ribeye and it was probably falls the top 3 ribeye I have ever had all over the USA. It was moist, very flavorful, service was awesome, drinks was great.
The place lives up to expectations! Great food, and the bloody mary bar is out of this world.
Steak for two was really good. Devils on horseback a rare treat. Seating a little close, or cozy if your in the mood. Haha

Took my girl here for her 21st, wrote it on the online reservation. They gave us both free glasses of Champagne. The beer I ordered tapped out when my glass was 3/4ths of the way full, they let me have it for free.  It was PGH restaurant week. Had strawberry watermelon gespatcho, pulled pork on cornbread, pork tacos with pickled cabbage and maple syrup, and a hot pecan desert. All courses were fantastic.   I like the atmosphere, steampunk/industrial/country blend, with info graphics on cuts of beef.   If your in the cultural district I'd check it out.

Excellent, just simply excellent at every visit.  I've done full mix-n-match dinners with my friends (fried pickles, seviche, tacos, flatbread) and it was delicious.  My husband adores his steaks (perfectly cut, prepared and cooked) so much that he just can't bring himself to order any other plate. Every entree I try is just as good as the last and the desserts never disappoint, if I have enough room left for them.  It's a pleasure to dine here.

Another GREAT night of dining in Pittsburgh. Believe it or not, you can do very well here without ordering red meat. Me and my 2 guests had salmon and duck entrees w/pierogies, a delicious flatbread starter with roasted mushrooms and truffle, and watermelon and Waldorf salads. Music selection was terrible, but the food made me forget it momentarily. Really "Car Wash" from the 70s in the background?

The only reason I gave this place 2 star's is because it is very trendy. .a cool place.  As the food and the service goes don't waste your time! This place will not get any more of my hard earned money. .......

We went on a Saturday night and the place was packed as always.  The seating is super tight but the food and service were fantastic.  We had a fresh tomato salad and bone marrow. I've had it other places but this is the best.  They do it really well.

This is the best place to go in Pittsburgh for brunch by far. The food is awesome I've tried basically the entire brunch menu and everything is absolutely delicious. The drinks are great. If you like Bloody Mary's they have an entire make it yourself section to the bar with anything you could ever desire to put in your drink. There is also a really fun atmosphere perfect place to start a Sunday Funday!

This is a fun place with a decent brunch.  Entrees run on average $14.  There is a really cool Bloody Mary bar and they have infused vodka.  We got there at 1:20 and they would not seat us at a table because they closed at 2, which seemed a little odd.   We are at the bar and the bartender was great.  Music is loud!!   Food was good,  not exceptional.  But it is a fun place.

Stopped in for a late dinner since the place seemed cool - and it was! Had the 3 little pigs sandwich, which was awesome.  Bartenders were great, and the service was really quick and attentive. Would go back!

Greeted promptly. Seated within minutes of our reservation time. Clean table, glassware, and utensils.  Server looked a bit haggard,  not their best effort. But friendly and efficient and knew the menu. I ask tricky questions, just to be a brat. Sometimes.  Food delivered by a different person. (Team service is a nice touch)  Apps were delicious. (specially the tartare!) Lamb Neck melted off the fork. Pappardelle pasta was savory and luscious. We didn't have dessert. I had a beer and still water. Companion had a Vieux Carre. (above average)  When we go out to eat, we pay attention and ask questions. All the questions. Our server thanked us, (it happens a lot) for participating in the success of OUR meal.  (PRO TIP: actively engage your waiter/waitress/bartender, etc.. they aren't mind readers.)  SIDENOTE: The review by the "Yelpster" who mentioned the bathroom "nightmare" intrigued us. We made a point of checking out this "HORRIBLE SITUATION."  Do not be frightened. The bathrooms are part of the theater complex and in the SHARED lobby for the restaurant. They were spotlessly clean and obviously well maintained.
Amazing food. Great beer. Can host a business dinner or a date night. Prepare your carnivorous desires and stay a while for the atmosphere.

Based on the reviews, I had 4 star expecations but walked away with 3 stars.   Started off with the fried brussels that were just o.k.  I was expecting nice green-crispy brussels but received greesy brown brussels instead.  I thought they were overcooked so I asked the waitress if the brussels are normally cooked this way and she said yes.    On to the maincourse - I ordered the Pub Burger (medium) that looked wonderful upon arrival but was cooked closer to Well and was way too salty for my liking.  My guess is that the pork belly was the main culprit for the salty burger.  Let's just say I had order envy of my wife and friends meals.  The pork dinner and chicken pot pie were tasty but the mussels (beer sauce) were just above average.  If you want good Mussels go to Pt. Brugge.    All in all a decent place but I would not rank in the top 3 in the 'Burgh as others have noted.

Went for brunch and ordered the short rib hash with horseradish hollandaise. Divine! Even better paired with a strawberry basil cocktail. My husband ordered peanut butter pancakes, which were a special that day, not normally on the menu. We will be back if we're ever back in PGH.

Do not go here, ever.  Service was rude and offensive.  Arrived 15 minutes early and we told our table wasnt ready and to have a drink at the bar. Okay, I understand that except for the fact there were 5 or 6 empty tables for 2 within eyesight of the bar.  Twenty minutes later went to the desk and, guess what, they took us to one of those empty tables!  Not only that they brought us to one of the postage sized tables jammed between two others.  When I asked for another open table slightly hammed, and open of course, nope that was reserved by somesomeone else. Give me a break.  End of story walked out, git a huge table at Ten Penny ip the street and had great meal.

Great place, loved the atmosphere. I had the chicken and waffles which were great but hard to eat with fork and knife. Also, loved the DJ. If anyone knows his name message me back, I was there 1/11 for brunch.

The food here is great! I was worried when I tried the salmon that it would be lacking compared to my husband's beef dish, but I was wrong! They seem to spend a lot of time crafting every item on their menu, regardless of the protein. The only thing we didn't like is that seating is tight. We kept apologetically jostling purses and limbs with another couple at the table next to us.

Not sure how I could have been happier. Awesome place. It was packed when I walked in on a Wednesday evening, but found a place at the bar and Molly took great care of me from the beginning. Others pitched in as soon as I needed anything. I had a veal cheek special over kale with pickled vegetables, and fried okra . It was awesome. Great teamwork, outstanding service, fresh, interesting food, good beer specials and well chosen wine list. Highly recommend! Short walk from where i was staying at the Doubletree.

Overall review (Bad, OK, Good): Food = Good; Service = Good; Ambience = Good  Being a transplant from the NYC area, this place gives off a NYC feel.  No matter what day of the week it's bustling.    Food: On my first visit, my party guest and I shared the ribeye for two.  It came with bone marrow which was okay.  I like bone marrow but the consistency of this one didn't work for me, the gratin style wasn't working for me with the marrow.  The ribeye also came with a side of fries.  Additionally, we ordered a side of fried brussel sprouts.  The sides were ordinary, nothing special.  On my second visit, I ordered the moules w/white wine and frites.  The balance of flavors was right on.  The portion size was generous.  If there was a negative - and it really technically wasn't a negative - was that they put chorizo with the moules.  Service: Attentive enough not to be overbearing; friendly.  Ambience: Very lively.  Music is a bit loud but makes for the energetic atmosphere.

Great drink menu.  Try the Manhatten.  Everything we ate was very unique, and delicious.  The pimento mac and cheese app was cooked perfect.  We also had the flat iron steak and lamb.  Flat iron is normally code speak for cheap piece of meat, but this was a one inch thick cooked perfectly meal. A negative:  your neighbor table is very close to you.

Cool trendy little spot in downtown Pittsburgh. We started with the fried brussle sprouts which were different but suprisingly good. For entrees my wife and I had the Pork chop and the chicken. The pork chop was very well prepared and definitely not recommended for someone who's not hungry as its huge. The chicken was tasteful tender and juicy. My only complaint is the round tables tend to be on the small side and can make eating slightly uncomfortable if you have more than two plates and drinks.
grab a seat at the bar, eat some great food and down some delicious drinks...great atmosphere & staff

This was my second time here.  The food is great -- I have had the steak and meatloaf sandwich; both excellent.  Fried Brussels Sprouts were quite good.  My wife had the short ribs which she loved.  The atmosphere is smart and snappy, but still friendly and inviting.  My  only criticism--the greeter did not greet or acknowledge everyone who was waiting.  Before she went "in" to take a party to a table, she should have at least minimally acknowledged the rest of the people there.  Hostesses are known by their hospitality.

Wonderful food, exquisite presentation of drinks and each plate was spectacular. The bloody Mary bar is amazing, and wonderful if you like all sorts of options! I had brunch and remember having many dishes, none of wish I recall the name of, but each was incredible well advertised and really delicious.

Overall is good but nothing special. We ordered mussel, bone marrow, Brussels, lamb neck, burgher, pasta and a kind of fish. The lamb neck and the sauce of the fish is good. It's a good place if you like new American food. You won't regret but you also won't get something out of expect, something make you say amazing.  And the dessert toffee cake is good!

Omg the shrimp and grits!! It was absolutely amazing. We also got the grilled cheese (we got it to go) and I think it would have been even better if I would have been able to eat it as soon as it was prepared, either way, it was delicious!

So we were seated directly next to Jbaby S, whose review you can read below. Not only did our experience vary wildly from what they reported, half of what they said was patently false.  Our drinks arrived promptly and were delicious - it's worth noting that the drinks here aren't your standard Jack and Ginger, and perhaps when you have to add an egg white to a mixed drink, it's going to take some time.   The food was good and came to our table quickly. Pro tip, if you wait fifteen minutes after your food is served to eat it, it will be a) cold and b) not the restaurant's fault.   The service - we had Ashlee, the same server - was attentive and friendly. The music was a normal level for a hip restaurant. If you're expecting secluded silence you won't get it, but it wasn't distracting at all.  All in all, we had a great experience from start to finish.

It's been a while since I've been to Meat & Potatoes, but I've been dreaming about going back since my first visit about a year ago. I made a Saturday night reservation too last minute and ended up in a later time slot than I would have liked (somewhere around 9 or 10 p.m.--I headed there after the symphony instead of before), but when I showed up a little early, they had no problem seating my party of two. The place has a cozy, romantic vibe; if rustic chic is a thing, that's a fitting term for the décor. I had the soft shell tacos (soft shell crab, pickled carrots, cucumber salad, mint, cilantro, Thai chili sauce; $14) and Sgt. Peppers Old Fashioned (Bulleit bourbon, black pepper, thyme, lemon, whiskey bitters; $9), both of which made the most of the many flavors involved. While I'm not much of a cocktail person, I do love a good Old Fashioned, and they did it justice. Ultimately, it was probably for the best that my reservation was nudged out of peak time, because the relaxed atmosphere and attentive-yet-casual service ended up being just the right mix for the end of an evening.
Fabulous brunch!  Some of the best, different brunch food we've ever had, along with delicious Sunday cocktails.   Tasty sausage, brisket, and eggs!
I love this place. Every single dish my friends and I tried was great. But some of them are like small portion and some of them are huge. I love the duck breast.

Considering the name I figured they would have some obvious meat and potato options on the menu and was very disappointed. Ordered the Waygu Flat Iron and portion sizes for my meal and other guests were incredibly small considering the prices. $12 Mac and cheese entree came with short ribs on it and was a larger portion than all of the entrees.   Food was extremely salty and not very flavorful.   Also, the restaurant is very small with tables so close surrounding the bar that you cannot pass somebody if you are coming or going and servers clog up the aisles. It is really more of a bar with some hgher-end, higher-prices bar/grill type items.

Went here for brunch on a long drive back to DC from the Great Lakes state. It was pretty amazing. The fried taters with truffle oil were incredible, and the corned beef hash was the perfect rib-sticking breakfast to fuel me for a long trip. My companion enjoyed the melt-in-your-mouth brisket and eggs, as well as the Bloody Mary bar. Our waitress made the second one, as we had just received our food--she seemed to know the perfect mix.  Seems like a place that gets quite busy on Sundays, so get there early or make a res. It lives up to these reviews, and the price is really perfect for the food you receive.

Been there a few times now, and the place has not let me down as of yet!  Food is great!  Mussels of the day is always on my order.  Last time I went, I had to try the Meat for Two, but the sheer quantity of the meat put me in a food coma.  Tried to finish after waking from the coma, but still could not.  Was delicious before and after I passed out.
Had the flat iron steak. It was cooked perfectly and the sauces and flavor of the steak were amazing!  Service was good even on a crowded Friday night.

I had high hopes for this place, but it's yet another crowded and overpriced downtown restaurant. The entrees are largely flavorless, so I don't know how they justify their prices. To top it off, the service is largely disinterested and makes you feel like a burden if bothered to answer menu questions.
I would recommend Meat and Potatoes to anyone looking for a great dining experience.  The food was superb and the staff was AMAZING!!!

Beware your reservations here. Front of the house has some work to do.   My sister booked the private room 6 weeks ago for combined Father's Day/birthday brunch celebration. When she didn't get confirmation, she called yesterday and was told it wasn't on file. (Reservation was taken by phone, not online.)  My sis asked if restaurant could do anything to make up for the error. Hostess said no.

A famous restaurant. Good service, very juicy and tender steak. While, the beer collection is not so good. Almost only canned beers are available (I just saw one beer tap there, which is not on the menu).

I was pretty sure that no place in the 'Burgh would supplant Park Bruges as my favorite brunch spot, but Meat & Potatoes makes it close.  I love the layout of the restaurant - outdoor seating, but indoors the center of the room is a large bar, with the tables in the periphery.  To top it off, the chairs have high backs, and are the most comfortably dining chairs I've sat in.  That sounds stupid, but it was enough for me to notice.  The food was fantastic.  There is a nice touch to start, in that they bring an oversized, fresh, blueberry muffin.   This muffin has the perfect, sugary and crunchy top.  And definitely share the short ribs hash for the table.  We ordered nearly ever brunch entree, and everyone was happy: Pub Burger, Fried Chicken and Cheddar Jalapeno Waffles, a BPBLT (a gourmet BLT with pastrami belly).  The portions are quite sizeable, so bring your appetite.  Service was equally great.  I always enjoy it when the staff are also foodies, and get excited about the menu items, have actually tried the menu and drinks, and offer educated recommendations.  I'm definitely looking forward to coming back for a dinner service.

My girlfriend and I went here after we saw a show downtown. I had heard great things about M&P and was super excited. However, I was pretty disappointed with my experience.  I got the lamb burger and my girlfriend got the duck.  The lamb burger was not good. I thought the meat was spongy and didn't taste fresh. I was pretty sad, since I was expecting to be blown away.  The duck, however, was delicious. It was very well cooked. The skin was nice and crispy and the meat was tender. The plate came in three parts on a long plate. A salad, pierogies, and the duck. The flavors from each were good on their own, but to me, they felt like three separate dishes. I didn't feel any unifying theme between them.  Perhaps it was my fault that I didn't get the steak. I think I will try again someday in the future.
Food was good & service was very attentive. However, the bartenders need to learn how to make a proper Manhattan.  Also, the upholstery on the banquette needs some serious attention.

I had the Pub Burger and it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. When I travel, I try to hit the best burger joint in each city. In Pittsburgh, that is supposed to be Winghart's. I'm going to try that tomorrow but they definitely have their work cut out for them if they want to compete with the burger at Meat & Potatoes. For some reason, this place really reminds me of the Purple Pig in Chicago.

Meat & Potatoes has really yummy food.  My wife and I tried the specialty mushroom risotto, bone marrow flat bread, mushroom flatbread and the salmon.  They were all delicious.  This restaurant reminds of me a similar restaurant in Los Angeles that Iron Chef Mario Batali owns, called Mozza.  I must say, the server kept making mistakes with our food and brought out things that we didn't order, but that wasn't a big deal.  We loved this place and can't wait to go back.

This was our second trip to Meat & Potatoes.  Both have been verey good, just short of excellent.  Service was friendly, and though the tables are very close to each other, somehow it works in this place.  Perhaps it is the overall gregarious atmosphere.  Now to the food...  We started with 3 apps: (1) The grilled bread was great as always.  Great value at $3, always perfectly toasted, with superb butter and jam.  (2) Mushroom flatbread ($12) - also great, just as good as the shortrib flatbread we had last time.  Portions are generous.  (3) Yellowtail cerviche - This was the one downside, and it was pretty far down.  It was $12, and had 6 little scrapings of yellowtail.  All I could thing of was "margins" as I was eating this - it must be 90%+.  Also, while the sauce around the scraps of yellowtail were good, there was nothing to get it up with.  I asked the waiter about it, and he offered a spoon instead of bread.  With so many other good things on the menu that are tasty and filling, I highly recommend you avoid this menu item.  My wife had a pasta (farfelle) with shortrib and pork shoulder ($18) - so excellent!  I then had a burger with pimento cheese toppings, which was outstanding - meat to bun.  Also, the fries it came with were perfect - all only $12.  Finally, we sampled 3 different drinks - their signature bourbon cocktail, and two vodka based cocktails.  All were great, and all cost $10.  There was just enough alcohol and overall flavor in them to justify the price.  Overall, Meat & Potatoes continues to please.  Other than the yellowtail app, they are avoiding overly "shi-shi-ing" themselves by providing hearty, innovative food and drink at a moderate price.

Claustrophobics should avoid this place, since there is very little space between tables. A large bar takes up the entire center of the restaurant, leaving little space for tables along the periphery. Because of the tight spacing and because this is a popular, crowded restaurant, it gets very loud. Many people like that. We, however, had been hoping for a quieter, more sedate atmosphere. On the positive side, the food was very good, though you should be aware that the portions are small and you should order accordingly. Three of us had the black bass, which made us wish we had ordered an appetizer or salad with it. One of us had a burger, which came with a side of Brussels sprouts and was more filling. The lemon berry pie was delicious, but we were a bit disappointed it had berry jam instead of actual berries. The service was quick and pleasant. Meat & Potatoes is very conveniently located to the major cultural venues, right next to the Cabaret, steps from the O'Reilly, and a short walk from the Benedum and Heinz Hall.  Although we enjoyed the food, we didn't like being crammed into a small space. In the future, this will be lower on my list of pre-show places to eat.

OBJECTIVELY GOOD FOOD BUT MEDIOCRE AT BEST: Food: 3 / 5 Service: 5 / 5 Atmosphere: 3.5 / 5 Price: 3.5 / 5 Overall: 3.75 / 5  I've been here twice now. Many of my friends have been quite often and we had a discussion about why we don't really like Meat & Potatoes.  FOOD: The consensus between my friends and me is that we always feel heavy, lethargic and weighed down after eating here. Meaning, the food here is greasier than you think and very very salty.  Because they season the meat with many other flavors and spices, you don't actually notice how salty the food is until you go through all the water and STILL feel thirsty. Since the dishes draw many nice flavors, the food is definitely objectively good but really not special. Also, they used to give HUGE portions and it was really worth the money. Now, the portions are average American portions (which as we all know are still quite big). Don't waste your money here, go to the two brother restaurants Butcher and the Rye or Tako, which are outstanding!  SERVICE: Waiters are fast, friendly, and knowledgeable.  ATMOSPHERE: It's nice inside but the tables are small and you're seated really closely to the surrounding tables which gives way to overhearing awkward conversations/not enough elbow room.  Price: Not worth the quality of food.

Great place to be on a Sunday afternoon.  Their short rib hash is delicious and their bloody mary bar is worth trying with one of their infused vodkas (e.g. bacon!).  My friend had the Irish benedict and the hubby had the huevos rancheros which they both liked.  The smoked brisket flatbread was only okay and lacked flavor.  Make sure you make reservations, this place is small but always packed for brunch.  There are different DJs that play on Sunday and when the weather is warm they have seating outside.

Went there twice before and wasn't impressed but I'm glad we tried it again. Get the macaroni and cheese appetizer. The waygu and the salmon entrees were great. I asked them to make me a drink that tastes like flowers and it was really great.

I really do love the atmosphere here. They serve you food on metal lunch trays which super cool. Although I'm a vegetarian, I still like it here. There are a few options for me on the menu for us non meat eaters, not many tho and a good wine selection.

We had the brussel sprouts appetizer and I must say I was very disappointed! It was very greasy and burnt, hardly any flavor. WOULD NOT GET AGAIN! Everything else was ok, but nothing to brag on. If I ever did return it only be to try the bone marrow.

*****Excellent restaurant***** Make reservations. It's so much more sophisticated than its name might suggest. Certainly a top notch place for any gourmand. The bone marrow and duck are absolutely fantastic.

I love this place! The food is delicious and they serve it late. The pork chop is sooo good! And delicious mussels, and the pate! They also have great brunch and the best drinks around. A bit pricey but worth it, and the bartenders are super friendly.

I wanted to take a minute to write a little something about M&P. The food was good... no it was great but that is only partially the reason why I decided to write a review.   We had a reservation at 8:30pm and waited about 30 minutes longer after that. They were so apologetic and had one of their parties prior to us run a little late. They definitely took care of us with some of their best appetizers on the house. Sometimes, you can appreciate a restaurant or business going above and beyond for their customers, which is really why I get a 5 star review. The service goes a really long way for me.    Now, on to the highlights of the meal:  The best of the starters we had was the Bone Marrow. The only way to describe it is in one word: butter. The fried pickles and  Fried Brussels I could couple together. Both were not overly breaded, which I enjoy, and still crunchy.   The entrée is what stole the show for me. I had the Duck Breast and it was probably some of the best duck I have ever had in my life.   All in all, I would definitely go back to Meat & Potatoes if I am back in Pittsburgh.

A friend from work highly recommended this gastropub. I am thankful for the open table app because making reservations was a breeze. We were seated immediately and everyone was surprised by how busy the restaurant was. The massive beer selection was written above the bar. My cousin and my dad ordered two appetizers for the table the bone marrow which was grilled bread, gremolata, and onion relish. The mussels of the day was the second appetizer. For our main course the guys ordered burgers, my mum ordered a salad, and I ordered the short rib flatbread pizza. The food and brews were excellent. We were all satiated and I  will be checking out meat and potatoes again!
Great food, almost too large of portions and great service from the young and energetic wait staff.   Get your reservation in early as the place packs full.
Love the food and Brussel sprouts but the drinks are awesome. Try some off of the prohibition list.
Phenomenal!  The Devils on Horseback made for an awesome light snack, the bone marrow was excellent but the 34 oz. ribeye stole the show.
Prohibition cocktails and Cuban sandwich over lunch. Clearly one of the best bartenders in the city. A little pricey, but worth it. Man food galore. Bring the boyfriend!

You HAVE to try the Bone Marrow. Just do it. It's one of the most nutritious tasty treats you can give yourself.   The Wagyu beef was perfectly prepared and melted in my mouth. The chefs know exactly what they're doing and the wait staff are there for you during your whole experience.  I'd recommend the Grande Absinthe to top off the evening.  Cheers.

Only had take out, but the interior is cool if you can find a place to sit. I ordered the duck and took it back to my hotel room, pretty pretty good.  Get the duck medium rare.   Nothing to dislike.  End of transcript.

Fun hipster vibe/decor.  Everything we ordered was quite salty but overall the burger and eggs benedict were tasty.  We brought our two kids under 4, which was totally doable but a bit tricky because they have no high chairs and tables are small and made of marble.  But the big booths are comfy and perfect for families or couples.  Service was quick even on busy Sunday and staff was pleasant.  Will deinitely return.

I give Meat & Potatoes 3 stars simply because of the small atmosphere and smaller tables. If possible, I'd give the food a 4 star rating alone but, you gotta take everything into consideration when dining at a restaurant!   I went to M&P with my dad before a show, we we're expecting the small date-night-like tables and quite frankly felt a little uncomfortable with how close everyone was next to us.   With that being said the food however, was delicious. Well flavored and came out beautifully presented. The servers were knowledgeable and the bus boys knew they had to clear those small tables quick!
Amazing spot!  Staff was prepared for our reservation, atmosphere was a buzz, food was spectacular. Bone marrow, mussels, and salmon main were all raved about.
Great food, unique menu, amazing steak.  Would definitely recommend.

Not sure what all they hype is about. Average service if that and GOOD food. I would return but not fight for a seat in the place. ***amending due to my lack of insight earlier and being called out for it.... the space is quite nice and trendy.  Good city spot - but there is no manager presence and they are really not focused on great service! Good to be in the theater district i guess!  Took a seat at the bar before a show! good crowd, lots of energy!  The menu is innovative, and very tavern-ish in some ways... i.e. great place to get a good drink and eat something!  just a good ol steak with a  potato is what i was expecting, sorry I was born and raised in these parts! took the name too literally..it is worth mentioning that burger (which is something i would prefer to make at home!) was good. Salad and flat bread were good. Service is where they took a hit with me; just not very customer focused - i was left to feel that i wasn't a recognizable face in the crowd -one drink in a 80 minute period???  a bartender (all of 23 maybe) was more interested in how he was holding his bar spoon and stirring than actually preparing drinks... let alone the 7 minutes to make one drink while telling a gentleman next to us that he was a master mixologist and blah blah blah blah... maybe if you had a grey hair kid you could pull that shtick off but your knowledge of bourbon and scotch (good job reading) is limited and you need to keep your ego in check!  You haven't been alive long enough to know that much!  Make my drink and ask me if i would like another before my drink is empty and its time to leave!  I guess it was forbiden that one of the 42 other people behind the bar hep us!  please note - he made good drink, but anyone can be taught to measure and stir! WAS that detailed enough team? Food Quality = GOOD (not my style of meat and potatoes)  Service = below average for the price point overall 3.5 but gave them 4!

Great place! Fast and friendly service! Food is amazing! The steak was rich and cooked perfectly and the potatoes were confit and the best I HAVE EVER HAD! Marrow bone was a tasty addition. The atmosphere is spacious yet feels cozy. Give it a try!

Excellent food and service as well, highly recommended.  I had a very positive experience and was more than pleased with my meal.  Heard good things about meat & potatoes from several friends, so I thought to give it a try this trip to Pgh.  I came as a walk in and didn't have reservations (it was a tuesday night) so I was offered to order at the bar, full menu.  I had bone marrow, a good portion served and with the toppings it was excellent.   Pot roast was the best I've had in my life.  I believe it was a chuckroast with carrots, other vegetables and whipped potatoes with a very savory sauce - I finished every last bite (which is rare, usually taking home a doggie bag.)  I have no idea what was in it, but the flavoring was amazingly tasty.  The pot roast was tender and no difficulty eating.  I finished my meal with the chocolat pot au creme, a mousse like pudding, which personally I thought was a nice finish after a bit of a heavy meal.  I had a cup of coffee to end my meal, espresso was not on the menu.    I will be back, to try the mushroom risotto, pork chops and the meat & potatoes for two - heard rave reviews about the latter.

Meat and Potatoes does not normally disappoint I have dined there often, and the food and service are always excellent. EXCEPT, tonight I tried the collards, and they were so far off the traditional that I could not eat them.  They were sweet and sticky and, not to get too technical, just plain yucky. Sorry, fellas, but I will be back.
The food here is unbelievably awesome!! Love the ambience , music and the service . Everyone here is so friendly and polite. I will definitely be back here the next time I visit Pittsburg!!
