I have been here twice and my first experience was the best! Typically, you should make a reservation before coming here because it gets filled up pretty quickly. I love coming to this restaurant because they provide a good dining experience. The service is great and the ambiance of the restaurant is wonderful as well. It has a hipster, rustic, and natural feel to it. The low lighting adds to it as well.   I was excited to order the bone marrow because we have never had it before. I have always been hesitant to try it but I am glad I ordered it from Meat & Potatoes. These huge pieces of bone marrow come out piping hot and it is served with grilled bread. It is paired with 3 toppings which consists of picked onions, capers, and sea salt. You spread the bone marrow on the bread and place your desired toppings on it and voila, a creamy and divine appetizer is ready! The initial bite will make your taste buds happy, happy, happy! It is so creamy and buttery! The pickled onions provide a nice crunch and tangy flavor to the buttery taste of the bone marrow. I highly recommend ordering this if you are up to being adventurous!   We also ordered the Short Rib Papperdelle, flatbread pizza, and Truffle Mac and Cheese. My favorite thing was by far the Short Rib Papperdelle. The creamy tomato sauce is perfect and the short rib was melt in your mouth. The papperdelle soaks up all of the sauce and tastes incredible! You could probably pass on the flatbread pizza because it wasn't that fantastic. I think they serve the truffle mac and cheese once in awhile because we did not see it on our second visit there. The truffle mac and cheese was phenomenal! It was cheesy and the flavor was heightened by the incredibly taste of truffles!   There are also plenty of cocktails that you can select from on their menu. The bar is gorgeous and you could also dine there as well. I would highly recommend coming here if you are in the downtown area of Pittsburgh!

What a great restaurant! My husband and I shared the mushroom flatbread with truffles, ricotta, and arugula. I then ordered the pasta bolognese (incredible!) and he had the sweetbread piccatta. The pasta was full of flavor and very filling, and the sweetbreads were tender and cooked perfectly.  We also enjoyed their interesting cocktail (I tried the aperol-ade, a very refreshing drink.) The atmosphere is cozy, although maybe a bit loud and crowded. I would suggest going late, on a week night, and make sure to make a reservation.  I'm so excited to go back and try something new on the menu--everything sounds so delicious!

I came here for dinner with my husband and friends of ours around 9:30pm because it was the only reservation we could land on a Saturday when looking 2 days before.   When we were seated it probably took 10 minutes before our waiter came to greet us and get us some water - and we were parched from being out on a humid day. So that wasn't a great start to our experience.   We ordered their fried taters, bone marrow, corn dog, pork belly tacos, mushroom risotto and the lamb leg. Their fried taters were well seasoned and went well with the black truffle mayo. It was my first time eating  bone marrow this way and it was very oily but I think it's naturally that way so overall it was good when eaten with the other condiments it came with. The corn dog wasn't anything special but the sauce gave it a little kick. The mushroom risotto was delicious and was probably the best dish of the night. The lamb leg dish was okay and probably wouldn't be something I would order again from here. It was very oily and a bit salty. I didn't try the tacos but the person who ate them said it may have been the best they have had. The pork belly was crispy that it melted in his mouth.   When we were done with dinner, it took a good 15-20 minutes before we were waited on again for leftover boxes, check, etc. Overall our waiter didn't check on us enough and wasn't very friendly. So in a nutshell, the food can be a hit or miss - and I would stick to popular dishes for the hit - and the service has a lot of room for improvement.

the most decadent meal i have had in years. great for very special occasions, but also passes as a casual tuesday night on mad men. cool speak-easy vibes. highly recommend the duck, its practically like steak!

Visiting from LA and took my bf here for a belated bday dinner (he is from here). The food was great! We had the artisan board, we we both agreed was probably one of the best ones we've had, and that is something we usually get other places. We also got the duck pate and the wagyu steak. Let me tell you ... The steak was cooked perfectly! I would highly recommend that. We also had a bottle of the Malbec wine and that was delicious. The service was great, Emily our waitress, was super nice and attentive. All in all great place great food. Just wish their dinning tables were bigger considering how big the dishes are.

Meat & Potatoes is one of my favorite Pittsburgh restaurants. It's exciting to see more restaurants like this opening up around the city. It's quite the hipster scene, but the atmosphere is excellent so is the decor.   I've never had a bad meal or experience here. The duck liver pate is usually something I always order. I expected it to be gamey at first, but to my pleasant surprise it was not. The are mussel are great though I've only tried their curry variation. Pro tip - ask for extra toast/bread for the pate & mussels when you get it since they toast them to order. The duck I've had only once but it was well cooked and the texture was perfect. The devils on horseback were a bit too sweet for my taste so I did not care for them much. I'm still working my way through the whole menu, but I haven't had a true complaint about any of their dishes yet.    I've had a few and they're all exceptional, but the Southie is by far one favorite cocktails here. The bartenders do what they do well and they're all very friendly and accommodating.

If you're in Pittsburgh and looking for Spme good filling food, this is where it's at! Not to mention they have a "Bloody Mary"(for those Americans) or us Canadians like to call it, "Caesars" bar with all the right fixings!   This place is awesome if you want to come before a theatre show as it's connected to one of the major theatres. Be sure to make reservations though because it gets packed!  My fiancé and I came for brunch and we are sad that we weren't able to go back for dinner because the brunch was more than satisfying and worth our every penny!   The fiance ordered the pub burger and I ordered the classic chicken and waffles. Let's start with the burger, it had a beautifully cooked fried egg to top and some yummy horseradish flavoured sauce that gave it the right zing! Of course it came with some shoe string fries on the side. Right size and good flavour, not your average burger!  My chicken and waffles was an absolute delight, my mouth waters just describing it. Firstly it was ginormous, I'm sort of embarrassed yet proud to say that I finished the whole darn thing. The chicken batter was light and crispy and the meat inside literally melted in my mouth, it was so juicy! The waffle the chicken sat on was any average eggo type waffle you find at the grocery store. This one was homemade and infused with jalapeños. It didn't stop here, my chicken and waffles came with bourbon maple bacon infused syrup that tied all of the loveliness together in one bite...  To no surprise we had no room for dessert as our second stomach failed us!   Another awesome thing about this place that I mentioned briefly before is the make your own Caesar station! You pick your alcohol base (I chose siracha tequila- yes it exists!) and you basically walk up to the bar area where they have all the garnishes you could ever think of for a Caesar, from bacon to celery to green beans to prosciutto to cabbage rolls! And there is no limit!   If I'm ever in Pittsburgh again I'll be sure to stop by here again, you should do the same!
Amazing place. Order a Sticky bun to start , you won't regret it.   Chicken and waffles and eggs were some of the best I've ever had !

I was actually REALLY surprised by this place. I always assumed it was going to be really expensive and nothing but red and fatty meats. I was really surprised at the fair prices for the quality of food. I'm not downtown much but plan on going back
Chicken and waffles upscale....bloody Mary bar unique with scrumptious add ins...take a a lovely walk afterwards and enjoy the scene!!!

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time. Overall, it was great. My only complaint is that they use too much salt! Brussel sprouts are my favorite, but their fried Brussel sprouts were way too salty even for my friend who loves salt. The flavor was wonderful, but could not eat a lot due to the salt. I had the flat iron steak for my entrée. Very tasty and tender, but chewier than a fillet. I asked them to go easy on the salt on this which they did! However, the potatoes, mushrooms were again over salted. My husband had the pasta Pappardelle. I have had this at other places and enjoyed it more. He had the same reaction. It was good, but not fantastic. Another friend had the pot roast. He was disappointed with the size and said it was not warm enough. I would recommend it to friends. Service was great. Everyone should try it once and make up their own mind. I would go back again.
Was just here over the weekend for a late night snack. Food is yummy!

If you want IMPECCABLE service, GREAT wait staff, and AMAZING food....DON'T COME HERE.  Where do I begin to even comprehend to you the ATROCIOUS customer service this place has....not only were the people SARCASTIC but they have no idea what the proper etiquette is for greeting and welcoming people. YOU SAY HELLO NOT WAIT FOR US TO SAY HI CAN I HAVE A TABLE....OBVIOUSLY we were here to eat and not just stare at you while we WAIT for you to notice us...even though we WERE THE ONLY people in front of you. We had a friend waiting for us and he had stated that he was outside, well I informed the hostess since I didnt want to be rude and just walk in, that we were here to sit outside since a friend already had a table for us. Well, she pointed at the door and stated " its that way", then turned back to whatever she was doing....ok.....so we head out sit ourselves down.   With a name like Meat and Potatoes you would think MEAT and Potatoes would be the highlight...but nothing really AMAZING caught my eye in regards to that. I ordered steak BLUE along with some type of potato ( mashed) The plate LOOKED pretty but lacked flavor only salt. The apparent "bed of brussel sprouts" was just (I am guess 2 AT MOST). The waitress was no where to be seen, we even had to waive down another server for refills on drinks. Only other time she actually came was to give us the check....Note to servers, if you have people seated outside, check on them. When we wanted to pay, we waited an additional fifteen minutes until we GAVE UP and walked inside to pay....ONLY TO BE TOLD TO SIT DOWN AND OUR WAITRESS WAS GOING TO ASSIST US....Well GEE, if she showed up more than TWICE in our whole evening then maybe... JUST maybe we would have, but that was not the case.    I then went inside to buy some shirts and when I informed the woman at the front that I wanted to buy shirts she snickered at me and said," I have to go get the manager because I dont have the key for that" Ok, no problem....got my shirts and left....  I have had bad service, but honestly this place gives Pittsburgh a bad reputation, this is not a restaurant you would want to visit if you are looking for quality food, great service and a memorable experience.  Go ANYWHERE but here.
Wonderful brunch! Has a knack for being creative and serving tasty food with a nice presentation. Food is flavorful; loved the bloody mary bar, and at a reasonable price.

We visited Meat & Potatoes last Saturday for a pre-dinner drink.  Upon arrival at 5:30pm, the restaurant AND bar were packed.  After making a circle around the bar to find seats, we went out to the hostess station to ask about a table.  Unfortunately, Meat & Potatoes was completely booked for the evening.  We really wanted to try at least something while we were there, so we went back to the bar.  I sat down at the only empty seat while my fiancé stood next to me.    I asked the bartender (who looked amazing in the flannel shirt and cabby hat) for a drink suggestion.  Per my taste buds, he recommended the Vanilla Sky.  It tasted slightly tart with hints of anise and vanilla.  As a black licorice lover, I truly enjoyed this beverage!  My fiancé got the 21st Amendment Back in Black.  We both really enjoyed our drinks and plan on returning to Meat & Potatoes - on a night we have made reservations.
Excellent atmosphere. Visiting family from out of town. Appetizers were delicious. Ordered the flat iron steak. Beautifully presented.  Disappointed in the steak, as it was grisly.

I am not a fan of noise, too close for comfort seating, or tables that are too small to comfortably have drinks and entrees on the table.  The menu is not for the faint hearted ... brains pig ears etc.    The huge pork chop is very good and  definitely enough to share as a full entree ... the waiter knew we wanted to share the pork chop and order other sides didn't offer to have the double pork chop de-boned and cut in half in the kitchen ... not one of my finest culinary moments trying to make into 2 portions (on the tiny table)  Do not go there if you have theater tickets ... we had 5:45 reservations and ran over to the Benedum for a 7:30 show ...   There are much quieter better restaurants in the theater district.

Had a wonderful time. Very elegant atmosphere to eat juice lamb, steak and Bone marrow! Hard to get a reservation time we wanted over yelp. But no problem getting it after calling them around 6 a day before. We will be back!

It was very good, but coming from NY, still think Lugers is better.  We ordered the steak for two.  Was not aware that everything's a la cart, including the steak sauces.  One off my check list.  I would still go back if in Pittsburgh again.
I had the pub burger and my wife had the roasted chicken; best meal in a while according to my wife. The burger was pretty awesome as well!

the food was excellent ive had brunch and dinner/salmon flatbread,briscut,fried chicken were fantastic for brunch/the salmon was really nice/ for dinner the steak tartare ,bone marrow, and flat iron steak had alot of flavor and were made perfect/loved it/the waitress for brunch couldnt of been more helpful and was very nice/our waiter for dinner was also excellent and he made sure some special requests we had happened/excellent service/the only complaint is with the front desk/the girls arent very friendly /they dont try to make you feel welcome/they are very rude when you are on the phone with them and rude when your greeted at the door/when ever i asked a question as well as other people that came in all they could say is no/there was no  effort made to be of help/after the front of the restaurant meat and potatoes is wonderful/girls at front desk need to work on their people skills

We tried to eat here last year, but it was booked up.  Made a reservation when I got into town for the Steeler game.  It was fabulous!  The waiter was very knowledgeable and gave excellent service!  Food was fabulous!

Went for the brunch. Ordered shrimp & grits and chicken & waffles. This is hands down the worst brunch we've ever had. The shrimp itself is pretty good, but whatever that white goo stuff beneath it is not. As for the chicken, it tastes worse than KFC or McDonald, and the waffle is boring to a fault. The weird thing is, I had dinner here before, which was a great experience. Bottom line: avoid brunch here at all cost.

Terrific meal and delicious cocktail.  Fun atmosphere!  I tried the bone marrow as I'd heard so much about it, but it wasn't my cup of tea.  Their presentation was good and our dinners were really tasty.  Quick, attentive service.

First visit; tries too hard and misses on basics..my wife and I had lunch and she had fish and chips, I had pork sandwich. too many salty chips...why is salt have to be used at such high quantities? sandwich was very messy ...do chefs ever to try and eat their meals with business attire on? Fish was average and also made mushier  by the cole slaw bed. a great fish and chips is balanced and crisp...the basics need to be fixed before the "innovative gastromics" can be appreciated. oh and way too expensive for what u get now.
Best brunch in town! Everything I have tried here is amazing and I LOVE the Bloody Mary Bar!

I've been a handful of times over the past few years, and M&P never disappoints. From their outstanding Brunch offerings, particularly the finest Bloody Mary Bar I have ever come across, to their Burger and much discussed, unreal bone marrow appetizer, make this spot that is generally recognized as one of the best in PGH well deserved.

Make your reservation well in advance, or stop in for a weekday lunch! Everything on the menu that I've tried is thought out, crafted, and is true artistry, but in a wildly hearty meat and potatoes sort of way. Do yourself a favor and have a hot date night here; you won't be disappointed.

Took a chance on a Sunday morning and walked in. Seated at the bar within 5 minutes. Love the service and food. Recommend short rib hash and chicken with waffles. Make your own bloody Mary bar or enjoy Irish breakfast coffee with maple whip cream. Dj plays nice mix and although a little loud we could still hold a conversation. Highly recommended for an adults only morning.

Everyone was raving about the bone marrow so we ordered that first without even looking at the menu. It was definitely an experience but boy was it fatty! The texture was enough to gag at, and the taste did little to make up for it. I would not order this for an appetizer again, nor would I recommend eating lumps of fat on an empty stomach!  For my entree I got the flat iron steak. Most expensive entree on the menu and I knew why! It was delicious. The steak was a melt in your mouth experience and the wasabi potatoes and shittake mushrooms complimented it perfectly. Cheesecake for desert was a knock out also. Of course, we had to ask for extra berries and the manager obliged.   I wasnt absolutely amazed by meat and potatoes. It was a good restaurant and an experience to try, but the space was slightly crammed. 4 stars though bc good food and great service. I'd go back again to try the rest of the menu!
One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh by far. Reservations are hard to come by and the staff could be more friendly.

Amazing food! Bit on the pricey side but you get what you pay for. We shared a bone marrow appetizer, not something I'd order, but I tried it, not bad, but then I don't know what to compare it to. Everyone in my party got something different, and we all shared. My parpadelle was excellent! The pork shoulder ragu was so tender, the sauce not heavy, the wide noodles just right. The strip steak (rare) and the duck were the highlights though. Ooooh, melt in your mouth!!! The lamb meatballs we're very different, Greek/Mediterranean flavors.

Make a reservation, if you don't they will put you in their "secondary room". Service is slow back there and you'll find yourself feeling like a second class citizen. Prices were a little high but for a "fancy dinner" prices were decent. Not a huge fan of the service, but food made up for it. Probably would go somewhere else to eat.

This place has been hit or miss for us. And don't order the special without asking for a price (that's a $55 mistake I've made). I really thought with the name Meat and Potatoes that the meat and potatoes would be better than they were.

We came here for lunch based on all the rave reviews here on Yelp, and were seated at the bar as we didn't have a reservation. The place was packed to capacity on a Thursday afternoon around 1PM. There was one bartender on duty who was also acting as our server. While cordial enough, she was obviously overwhelmed. After a while she took our orders, and we sat at the bar being bumped up against by fellow patrons and wait staff. After waiting almost 30 minutes for a sandwich and a salad, we ran out of time and asked the bartender to make our order to go. She assured us twice that it would be right out. Another 10 minutes later and the order finally came out. Overall the food was nothing to rave about, and certainly not worth having to wait 40 minutes for. No utensils were included and a side was missing. We certainly didn't get what all the hype was about.

I live in Louisiana, and all I can say is that this place could definitely hang with the top places in New Orleans. I had the fried pickles (best I've ever had), along with the wild boar sloppy joe w/ bbq chips. Everything was awesome. The true star of the show, however, was the grilled bread, which only cost $3! It came with an amazing butter and homemade strawberry jam and was absolutely perfect. My buddy had the fried chicken which came with biscuits and a coffee-bacon jam. He gave me a biscuit with the jam and it was off-the-charts good. This truly was one of the best lunches of my entire life. I'll definitely be back, the next time I'm in town.

This place has been on my must-go-to list for a while now because of the reputation and the fact that steak is one of my favorite meals.  I had been traveling Asia for 3 weeks before coming here so I was craving some good red meat.  I came here on a Sunday and was seated pretty quickly.  I went straight for the wagyu flat iron, cooked rare.  Honestly, I was kinda underwhelmed.  Maybe my taste buds weren't adjusted back to the American palette yet but my steak was really salty.  It was very soft but I needed a few glasses of water to finish.  Overall, the place is really nice and I'd definitely give it another shot but it just wasn't worth the price on my first trip.  Wagyu flat iron: 7/10

It's a surprisingly small space and despite a number of bar seats it still appears impossible to get one.  Make a reservation, don't count calories, and enjoy.  Artisan cocktails are outstanding, definitely the best I've had in Pittsburgh and they easily measure up against my home town of New Orleans.  The wine and beer lists are also very well chosen so just about everyone will be happy (other than my colleague who always orders Bud Light, which they don't carry here).  On the appetizer menu, poutine is fantastic (and this is coming from someone who worked in Montreal for a year) if you like the combination of fries, cheese curds & brown gravy.  The lobster spring roll was really good, and the tartare was also excellent - let's just say there are very few places that I would ever order tartare but this is one.  The Fall Salad is also great and the sashimi was fine but didn't blow me away.  In terms of main courses the signature 34 ounce ribeye (which most restaurants would call a "Tomahawk" or "Cowboy" cut) was shared by my table on my initial visit and I have to say the meat was cooked perfectly and had great flavor but overall it just had way too much fat.  Of course, the accompanying fries and bone marrow gratin were also good.  The surprise hit of the meal however was the pasta - great homemade papardelle with a perfect short rib bolognese sauce and very good agnolotti with a brown butter sauce and some veggies although the shape & size of the pasta wasn't typical for agnolotti.  The short rib flatbread was also very good and the only real miss on 2 visits so far was a mushroom flatbread that had a strange ricotta spread for the cheese and just didn't have much flavor.  Nothing is perfect but everything from the decor to the service to the food are done well at Meat & Potatoes and I'll definitley be back - assuming I can get a reservation.

Personally I think this restaurant is overrated.  The seats are all very close together and I had people bumping into me as they were trying to pass by my seat and the bar.  Also, since its always busy, its very loud.  The cocktails are very good, but expensive and small.  I had a good meal and the service was prompt, but I just don't know if this place is as good as everyone is making it out to be.

Tried this place for dinner earlier this week on a biz trip to Pittsburgh.  I did not realize it was in the theater district of the city, which makes the location busier and more commercial than I was expecting.  I was hoping for something with more of a neighborhood feel, which this place definitely does not have.  It's right in the middle of a touristy part of downtown, so keep this in mind if you're trying to eat before a performance at one of the nearby theaters.... waits for a table seemed to be high, even on a weeknight.  Having said that, I found a seat at the very busy bar (just after 7:00pm on a Tues night), and proceeded to order one of the house specialties, the smoked pork chop, with baked beans and spicy apple slaw on the side.  This was probably the best damned pork chop I've had in my life, and was about 3" thick (two ribs worth of the loin)!  Very tender and flavorful.  My bartender/server warned me it wasn't the fastest item to come out of the kitchen, but it was not a long wait.  I had the summer salad before, which was just OK.  All of their beers are either served on tap or in cans, and they have a decent selection.  I finished off with their coconut flan, which was outstanding.  My bill was $56, with a nice tip.  Service was fairly quick considering how busy the place was, and very competent and friendly.  I would try it again, but probably with a reservation.
Stay away from the stuffed French toast.  They use county fair caramel and it turns hard as a rock while you eat.  Overpriced hipster joint.  Better places within walking distance.

This is a very busy place in the dinner/evening hours! I have visited on a few occasions, each time in the evening. Food is excellent with a great variety of things to choose from, and the dessert is amazing! It comes in cute glasses and it's a perfect portion size for one person. We have stopped post-CLO shows and had coffee on a couple of occasions as well. Always a good spot for coffee and dessert! The service was good, with the servers always attentive. The most challenging things about this location are its size and tight quarters. Tables are very close together and it can be difficult to not be sitting on top of other guests. The waiting area is also very limited. If you do not have a reservation, you will be waiting a while for a table due to lack of space inside, and there isn't much room to wait out in the lounge. I recommend checking it out with an advance reservation!

This place is super cool and has an industrial warehouse look to it. The place is a little small but has a very cozy atmosphere to it. The food is good and the portions are large so beware. The bar is unique because it offers a bloody mary bar (a.k.a. Sunday afternoon joint) for you to make your own bloody mary cocktail. Kasey was my server on the Sunday that I visited and she was very attentive and did a great job on picking out my food selection. I had a burger with an egg on top served with sweet potato fries.  If you are looking for a great place to "catch up" or just have a simple yet filling lunch with a friend this is the place to be. I wouldn't recommend this place to families with young children, it's kind of an adult establishment. Enjoy!

Excellent. Great drinks. Amazing pub burger and chicken sandwich. Awesome service. Note: does not discount parking ticket as stated on open table. They were apologetic but didn't do anything for us with regards to parking.

This restaurant is one of the things I will truly miss about Pittsburgh. I have gone several times for brunch, everything is amazing. The korean brisket is one of the best briskets I've ever had. Bloody mary bar is a must! Only went once for dinner and it was spectacular. Order a specialty cocktail even if you normally don't. Cheesecake is always good. My only complaint is seating is very tight at the cafe tables inside.

First time to Pittsburgh and this place has me falling in love...along with the PPG building because that thing is beautiful and kickass.  I took my sales rep and sales engineer out for a team-building dinner to this place after seeing it on the Travel Channel.  It is a small place but we were seated at a nice table in the corner by the windows.  Our server was fairly attentive but not great.  My cocktails were good but not memorable.  To start, we had devils on horseback, poutine, and the kobe corndog.  My favorite was the corndog with the chipotle sauce - just divine meaty and spicy.  The fries in the poutine were crispy and soaked up the savory gravy well, with the curds squeaking properly against the teeth.  Devils on horseback needed some cheese or the bacon needs to be crispier because there was a slight texture issue while the flavour was robust.  The fried brussel sprouts were nicely charred and I snuck a pieces of chicharrone and crispy pig ear from the caesar salads.  The three of us also shared the 34 oz bone-in ribeye with mushrooms, steak fries, and bone marrow gratin.  I was a little disappointed that the ribeye was not medium-rare but more medium and the quality wasn't the best.  However, it was impressive looking and the steak fries were incredibly tasty, along with God's butter (aka bone marrow).  The dessert was a huge disappointment, as I ordered the salted caramel pretzel brownie.  It came out parfait-style but was so incredibly dry and the mouthfeel was similar to soft gravel.  I would not recommend ordering dessert here.  TL;DR - fun smallish gastropub requiring reservations that mostly has great food but service needs to perk up with more personality and dessert needs a major overhaul.

The only reason I am giving this restaurant 4 stars is because of the ambiance.  This place is LOUD and cramped but the food and service make up for it in spades.  The hostess did go the extra mile to get us at a full-sized table when asked to be moved - we were initially at a cocktail table much to our dismay.  Two large people at a small round table isn't very comfortable. We did get attitude from our server when we asked to be moved to a larger table.  But, again, the food more than made up for the bad attitude from the server.  My husband and I went there on Friday, February 13th for an anniversary dinner.  The wild mushroom risotto was amazing!  We both had the flat iron steak and it was cooked to perfection.  The charred carrot salad that the meat was served with was phenomenal.  For dessert, we had a malted chocolate potted cream that was pretty much heaven.  If you go, ask for a full-sized table when you make your reservations or you might find yourself at a small cocktail table.  Reservations are an absolute must - you won't get a table on a Friday night without one.
Delicious menu (for dinner and brunch), great drinks, excellent service. Make a reservation.

House - Had a wonderful dinner Monday, January 2, 2017, having 8:00 p.m. reservations. Pittsburgh was quiet after the New Year celebrations and so was Meat and Potatoes - several open tables and places at the bar, which sits in the center of the large dining room. The room is circled by half booths in velvet with heavy 2-person white marble top tables that were nice and sturdy. I have mobility issues and there were no steps to get into the restaurant and our table was near the entrance so I had a very easy time getting to the table. The cushioned booth side I was sitting on was quite low and I was afraid I'd have trouble getting up as my leg strength is the problem, but I was able to make it up fine. There was a large still water bottle with a bale top stopper that the hostess poured our water out of. The glasses are plain and heavily weighted. The water was not chilled, which I would have preferred.  Cocktails & Appetizers - Our server was Crystal, a wonderfully cheerful and polite young lady, who happily shared her best information and advice on drink and food choices. I had a Mexican Honey Bee which was strong but good, and my husband had a Dark and Stormy, which was quite too strong for me. We ordered fried pickles with spicy ranch and an order of the poutine. We did not care for the fried pickles appetizer and did not eat more than a bite - the pickles were not like dill flavored. They were very strong and overpowered the ranch and breading. The poutine was a new dish for both of us and it was absolutely delicious with a lovely gravy with melted cheese curds and scallions that really made the flavor pop.  Salad - I ordered the Cobb salad and it was a very large oval plate with iceburg carpaccio / bacon lardons / tomatoes / maytag blue cheese / egg / avocado ranch dressing. The carpaccio is only indicative of the fact that the iceburg is sliced into thin flat rounds. Probably won't be able to tell this since it's piled up with condiments. This was a lovely salad with delicious bacon lardons that I wish were more plentiful, but the blue cheese and avocado ranch dressing simply clashed in a very distasteful way. I'd definitely get this salad again but just leave off the ranch and ask for blue cheese only. I can recommend this salad based on that stipulation.  Entrees - After consulting with our server Crystal about the specials, I decided to go with my original idea of the Wagyu Flat Iron - smoked fingerling potatoes / celery root / maitaki / soubise / pecorino compound butter - and after reading another Yelp review, I asked to substitute Confit potatoes instead of the fingerling potatoes, but Crystal said it would not be possible based on how the dish is put together (everything coming combined underneath the steak). The steak was absolutely the most delicious steak I have had in YEARS. It reminds me of the grass-fed beef from my childhood. It was so worth the $38. I ended up just getting a side order of the confit potatoes and they were fantastic - crunchy on the outside while fluffy, soft and delicious on the inside. My husband got the Pappardelle - bolognese sauce / pancetta / pork shoulder / garlic bread - this was a delicious dish as well and very economical at just $18. The bolognese was almost like stew meat and very plentiful in the dish  with fewer but very large flat noodles. The garlic bread would have been much better had it been grilled. It was quite chewy but definitely not a deal breaker. My husband was very happy with this dish and would definitely order it again. One last note about the evening's specials, Crystal was very nice to guide me about the extremely small portion of Octopus (3 oz) special available, which definitely helped me greatly in my entree decision making.    Desserts - My husband ordered the apple cheesecake which was in a jar with crumble topping and he said it was delicious and not overly sweet, which was very pleasing to him and he would order it again. I ordered the Pot de Creme chocolate with whipped cream topping and caramel popcorn topping which was absolutely delicious together.  The bill came to just under $150 and we ended up taking virtually all the dishes home with the exception of the fried pickles, which Crystal had taken off our bill. This was a very nice gesture and was not expected at all as there was nothing wrong with the dish except just the taste to us was not pleasant. This was one of the best dinners we've had in quite a while and it just makes me want to return as soon as my wallet rebounds.  Decor/Environment - Five Stars Food - Five Stars Service - Five Stars  We hope your experience is as pleasant as ours was. Enjoy!

I have so many mixed feelings about meat & potatoes. The food is excellent. The decor is beautiful. The seating is the most comfortable ever. the tables along the right hand side are very intimate..if you want to get to know your table neighbs. The deals on Monday night are fabulous--$5 gourmet burgers, $3 fries and many other options. The brunch and Bloody Mary bar are to die for. But the music and ambience, the patrons... all make me very uncomfortable. I'd rather listen to dinner music than listen to a dj spin techno over breakfast or while having a late night meal.

Really unique food! Had the bone marrow, pig ears, and dates for starters. They were all awesome! The bone marrow was rich and I loved the addition of garnishes. The pig ears were crispy with a super balanced thai chili sauce (wish I had ordered beer to pair with that dish!). The dates with chorizo were paired with a super fresh tomato sauce. All the cocktails were really well balanced and not overly sweet. We shared the pappardelle for an entree. The noodles were perfectly al dente and the rich sauce was stick to your ribs good. This was definitely more of a winter dish, but it was a cool evening so it worked out. All the food was very good- not knock my socks off, but definitely above average!  The service was so-so. We got to the restaurant early for our 8pm reservation (7:45). Although there were many tables visually available, we still had to wait a little for a table. In fact, a family of four without reservations came in while we were waiting and were seated before us... Our waiter was nice, but not super attentive. It was at least 15 minutes before he even took our drink order.... And 20-25 minutes before we received our drinks. He didn't really check in on us... Overall, I expect more when a meal is in this price point. The bus staff, however, was super attentive and great!   So overall, above average and unique, but not life altering.

The food, cocktails and beer selection is great. Most of the stuff on the main courses are very good especially the pork dish and the huge ribeye they have. I took one star off as they tend to lose orders in the kitchen on a frequent basis. Great lively atmosphere.

I've heard nothing but great things about this place and I was so excited to go.  I think I even made up a song about how excited I was to go.  Once I got there I was not disappointed.  The decor wasn't quite what I expected, but not bad.  The food was great.  We started with the kobe corn dog and fried brussel sprouts.  The corn dog wasn't really better than the best corn dog I've had before in my life but the fried brussel sprouts were something new and delicious.  They were crispy on the outside but still juicy on the inside.  My boyfriend got the pot roast and I got he pastrami crusted duck.  His pot roast was good, but I had to protect my duck from him after he tried a bite.  I have never tasted anything like it.  The combination of flavors made you keep searching for more.  It was rich without being too rich and the saurkraut pierogis that came with it was a great balance to the duck.  I highly reccomend this place to anyone who enjoys classic food in a way that you've never experienced it before.  I ordered some of their specialty drinks, two that were gin based.  I can't recall their names now but they were not my favorite thing on the menu.  Dessert was a "pot de creme" which was the perfect amount of sweetness after my meal.

Every other review will rave about the amazing bone marrow and extensive Bloody Mary bar -- I will agree, wholeheartedly.   HOWEVER, regarding the hostess(es):  Don't expect the hostesses to be accommodating or helpful when trying to make same-day call-ahead reservations.   I understand that such a successful establishment is not hurting for business, but the hostesses were rude and pretentious when simply asked about seating a party of 6. "We can't accommodate a party that large." Done. No further explanation, no attempt to resolve.   Um, ok? I'm a very patient person. "So then what do you recommend for a larger party (which I don't consider a party of 6 as "large" but I suppose it is a smaller restaurant)... "There are some other restaurants nearby." ---- WHAT? I'm sure management would love to hear how well-trained they are to handle *difficult* questions/situations from the hangry brunch crowd.   Fortunately we were able to make a reservation for 4 (two of our party decided it was not worth the hassle) through the app. Clearly I was hell-bent on dining at this establishment.  Final conclusions:  1) Make reservations far in advance. Fortunately you can do that through the Yelp! App.  2) If you plan to walk in and wait, you better not have over 4 people in your party. If so, just take your business elsewhere because they so obviously do not need yours. In fact, they'll gladly share with others.  3) While hostess service left a bad taste, every other aspect was worth the wait-time. Polite, knowledgable and attentive servers. Delicious food.
Best brunch I've ever had!  Great Bloody Mary bar, food unique and delicious! The best!  Worth the wait!

Had an enjoyable lunch here, with mostly positives.  I love the decor of the place walking in. The set up is interesting - oval shaped room with couches lining the edge. It feels really quaint without feeling stuffy. Huge bar in the middle.  We tried the fried "taters" which were truffle fries, and the devils on horseback, basically chorizo stuffed dates. The fries were great! A very generous portion for $5 and came with yummy truffle mayo. The dates however... the only thing I could taste was the dates, which overpowered the chorizo and the sauce and I would not order it again.  For entrees we got pappardelle and duck and both tried a bit of each. The duck was good overall and I did enjoy it, but the chimichurri really overpowered it, and I love love love the natural flavor of duck that was definitely not highlighted :( The pappardelle (why is this word so hard to say) tasted really really undercooked to me, but my friend refused to send it back...  Personally I liked the sauce, but the dish does taste kind of heavy to me, but I am someone who generally finds pasta dishes a bit heavy. For dessert, we split a vanilla creme brulee, and it was just average. Really really sweet, actually, so that can be good or bad depending on preferences. Acceptable.  I'd definitely come here again and try some other things on their menu. Good experience overall. It's so conveniently located right in the heart of the cultural district - no doubt lots of concert/playgoers take advantage of this.

Always a good choice. Must try the bone marrow. While their steaks are good, I recommend trying some of their other menu items as well- it's all excellent. Good service, great food, Pittsburgh staple.

It seems like everyone in Pittsburgh is ranting and raving about Meat and Potatoes. I have half a mind to join them. However I feel like M&P is like that girl you pick up at 2 AM when the boozer is letting out. Things look great right then and there but looming back the next morning you are left thinking "Weren't you prettier last night?" This is my morning after wake up call.   We will start with the decor.  I like it. It's a cool modern take on the kind of look one gets in a classic pub. While this should lend to a warm inviting atmosphere, M&P is somehow able to make is feel cold and pretentious. Secondly, the tables are crammed in so tight big guys like me can end up feeling very cramped. On that note I would like to apologize to the poor people seated next to me on my last visit. The layout forced my butt in your dinner. Sorry.   The service can mirror the feel from time to time. Sometimes I get warm and friendly, other times its cold and unapproachable. Just because you work in a hot downtown location doesn't me you get to be a boor to your guests.   The major saving graces to M&P are the food and the cocktails. The food is killer. My go to favorites are the fried chicken livers (trust me) and the signature Meat and Potatoes for Two (I don't share. Fat guy remember?). Steaks always come out hot and perfectly cooked, but rested enough so they don't bleed out all over your plate. The bar is stellar too. They seem to trend toward updates on classic prohibition era cocktail is but they are done well. The drinks are very well balanced and tasty. Too easy to have too many tipples here.   To wrap up I like M&P. it's pricey but I the k it is worth it. The major issues I have with the place stems from their pretentiousness. They label themselves a "gastropub" which to me is entirely redundant. The word supposedly means a bar with great food. Ok you just described a "pub". The attitude follows with the decor and the attitude of the workers. It's like meeting this great girl at last call and in the morning you find out she is kinda bitchy. But she's definitely hot enough to call again.
I really enjoyed the Root to Berry cocktail. It was well balanced and not too sweet. I'll have to come back and try the food!

We came to town to watch baseball and celebrate my buddy's birthday. We had eaten here on our previous trip here 2 years ago and it didn't fail to impress. We ordered a few house cocktails and starters while deciding on our dinner. After struggling to decide on the amazing choices I settled on the pub burger. It was probably the best burger I've ever had. The beef was amazing, chuck/short rib/ brisket house ground. Very good!  Crystal,our waitress was great. I'm a sides kinda guy, she brought me a plate of all their house made pickled veggies. Delicious. We will,definitely be back.

I have been both for brunch and dinner and both were fantastic. This place is always packed so you know it is good and must make a reservation well in advance. On my last visit which was my first time having dinner here we all started with canned beer! Funny for a more fancy place but they do not have a lot of drafts. Those in my party started with the muscles and had a few sauces to choose from. They went with a beer bacon sauce that you could not go wrong with. My only complaint is they charged you for bread for dipping. For my entree I got the burger with cheese and asked to substitute mashed potatoes with fries. The burger bun was homemade and cooked to my liking. They brought out the fries instead of mashed potatoes but quickly fixed this and took it off our bill. Others in my party ordered the duck, hanger steak and pork and were very happy with their choices. Be warned the pork is a huge serving that comes with baked beans and collard greens.
Sunday Brunch... OUT OF THIS WORLD.  I had the French Toast.. topped with Almond Brittle, Banana and Bacon.. Best I've ever had in Pittsburgh !

Lot of good things to say about M&P and a few less good too - so I'll do a pro and con, for a chance. But overall a very very good place downtown!  Pros: the restaurant is very nice, with a great oval bar at the center, and tables around. Very high ceiling, great rusty colors, a bit shadowy. I like it.   Cocktails! I tried a few that night, and I liked all of them (some more than others). In fact, these may be the best cocktails i have had in Pittsburgh so far.  Food! The bone marrows are as impressive as the other reviews say. Huge. No HUGE, and tasty. Not for the faint of hear though: that's not light on your belly. The duck was fantastic and so was the flat iron. The tartare was good, although I have had better in Pittsburgh (Salt's is often better for instance).   The portions are fit for Pittsburgh. Enormous. too much actually (do we need to have 3 enormous bones for the bone marrow?), but I suppose some would grumble on yelp if they were a tiny bit smaller. Yinzers have a big stomach.   The menu is not very large, and is fairly conservative (steaks, duck, salmon) with a few sandwiches. But it all seems very good.   Cons: the tables are really close to each other if you are dining in the section with tables for 2. You may hear your neighbors, and this may be less than exciting. At 8:30 a Tuesday, we did not have the problem. The tables emptied soon after we arrived. Good strategy.  The wine we tried (a malbec from argentina) was less than impressive. We did not finish it. Worth a star off? nope. The pros make up for it.   The coffee was god awful - what's wrong M&P? And there is no espresso. Really? Like in 2014, in a fancy restaurant?   Oh yeah and it's hard to get a table over the week end. Booking is required. The bar is also quite full over the week end.   We'll be back for sure.

Disappointed.   I've experienced M&P several times over the past year or so and my most recent trip did not live up to my expectations. My go-to dish is the pork chop...which has never let me down...until now The chop was seemingly undercooked (despite being ordered medium) and it's smoked flavor was definitely "off". In the past, the chop was akin to a deliciously smoked ham but not this time. I'm not sure if it was due to the amount of patrons ordering the dish that night and they were just pumping them out as quickly as possible, but I left there regretting my entree choice.   As for the rest of my experience that evening, I'd say it was average. The drinks were good and the service was as expected on a busy evening. However, with the main reason for going here being the food, I'll definitely think twice about returning any time soon.

My girlfriend and I went here for brunch. The service was outstanding and the food even better. We were told their would be a short wait which was to be expected, but the host came over and updated us which was much appreciated.   I ordered a bloody mary from the bloody mary bar. Wow, what a cool idea. They bring you infused vodka on ice and you take the glass up to the bar and create your own bloody mary. The bar had countless spices, hot sauces, vegetables and even had meats and cheeses you could add if you so desired.   The food was freaking incredible. My girlfriend got chicken and waffles, the waffles had jalapeño and cheddar in them, and it came with bacon syrup. The chicken was moist and tender.  My shrimp and grits were delicious. The shrimp were large and tasted so fresh, the grits were creamy and the sauce was succulent. The portion sizes of both meals were generous and that is a huge plus in my book.  Lastly, our server was a pro. He was quick, attentive, and knew the menu very well.   This was a slam dunk, 5 star experience all around. I will definitely be back and will bring visiting friends and family here when they are in town.   I give Meat and Potatoes my highest recommendation.

Was in town for a football game. Had only an hour to enjoy our last meal in Pittsburgh. Meat and Potatoes delivered! We started out with some drinks (bartenders are very creative) and the bone marrow - delicious! I had the pub burger - the most memorable burger in my life ... to date. It was cooked medium - juicy, flavorful, and the egg on top was creative and added to the overall experience. The fries on the side were, meh, but it didn't matter because the burger was beyond this world! The bun was soft and buttery, made in house. DH had the snapper topped with papaya salad. It was a light yet satisfying dish. We finished dinner with the cinnamon almond panna cotta (it was the special). It was just ok, but I'm sure that had we tried a different dessert, we would have been very pleased. We will definitely visit this place again the next time we're in town.

One of my go-to restaurants when I visit Pittsburgh! I definitely recommend a reservation if you can. The food is delicious. The service is always wonderful! When we go here before a concert, they always ask what time the concert is and make sure your food comes out at a timely manner. I'm in need of a concert to go to in Pittsburgh so I can come back here!
The pub burger is the best burger in Pittsburgh. The bone marrow is a must when dining here. Drinks and bartenders are fantastic as well.

After a run of terrible cocktails, Meat & Potatoes came through for our desperate group. Food was excellent - steak tartare with smoked egg was fresh just the right coarseness and temperature, wild mushroom risotto was decadent and perfect as an app, duck breast was perfectly seasoned and cooked. Good vibe, excellent service.

There is this weird thing here in Pittsburgh where a lot of people seem to not care about the quality of the food, as long as the price is right and they get a lot of it. Meat and Potatoes, IMO, blows that out of the water. The portions and the quality more than make up for what some have called pricey. Personally, I don't think this place is expensive, it all depends on what you get. Everything I've had here is on point, and even if you are stuffed, make sure you leave room for dessert, as their rotating lists of desserts are all so delicious. Most recently I went for my birthday dinner, which happened to be during Pittsburgh Restaurant Week. The chef's menu theme was Southern, and every single course was exceptional, particularly the Chicken Waffle Tacos and Pecan Bread Pudding. If I had been home, I would have licked those plates!
The El Diablo drink was great, also enjoyed the 3 little pigs sandwich
Best brunch in the city!  Their brunch punch never disappoints!

Not impressed. I just moved back to Pittsburgh from LA and everyone has been saying that I needed to try Meat and Potatoes, so I finally did. It's not that the food was terrible, but it just wasn't impressive. We got the ribeye steak for 2, which was ridiculously salty, to the point that it wasn't enjoyable. We would have sent it back, but it takes 35 minutes to cook and we had to head out to see a show. Totally not worth it. I did like the strawberry and goat butter appetizer and the drinks were good. The service was also good. Overall, it's not an awful place, but I'm definitely not dying to go back. There are so many better restaurants in Pittsburgh, in my opinion.

This is a very fun place to go to, and has nice petite, intimate tables. My boyfriend took me here for vday. We started with the pear salad and cheese board. We absolutely LOVED the cheese board because it had so many fun flavors that you could mix and match. We got the 34oz steak to share and wow was that an experience. We managed to finish the entire thing and my bf was in heaven the whole time. My favorite part of the board was the bone marrow. We would definitely recommend coming here for a fun night!

First time in Pittsburgh and this restaurant was the perfect introduction to the city! We had the charcuterie board, bone marrow and duck to share. I wasn't the biggest fan of the duck but everything was still amazing nonetheless. Our server was absolutely great but I've also got a give props to the runners and bussers as they were right on top of things. We're not generally fans of dimly lit restaurants but they nailed it because the ambiance was still inviting and embraced a neo-prohibition era feel. Wonderful experience!

What a menu!  The diverse food selection is like no other. I have dined at restaurants all over the world, and this place is tops on my list.   The service was fast and extremely friendly. The food was fresh and delicious.  The prices were not inflated. It is not cheap, but it shouldn't be cheap with the quality and type of entrées they serve.   I love this restaurant and I will be back the next time I am in town!
Was a bit disappointed. Ate at about 7 PM and all the steaks were gone. Seemed strange. Service also seemed to be a second thought. Would not go back.

Hadn't been here in a few years and glad we came back. Mussels were better than I remembered and the best we've had in a long time. I went for the meatloaf which did not disappoint.  It was hearty with enough fried onions to keep me happy. Will come back sooner

I was really looking forward to checking this place out. Especially since my sister really enjoyed this place before. I think my expectations were too high. Also, with it being a special occasion of her graduation-- I was hoping for a more memorable meal. Spending more at a restaurant does not ensure a great meal. I was left unsatisfied for the $200+ bill.  We ordered the: Poutine Bone marrow Pate Pub Burger Meat and Potatoes for two (we didn't get potatoes)  I felt much of the food was overdressed with too much salt. Not allowing the meat to shine.

Was in town for a business trip and heard from several people to try this restaurant out. Awesome atmosphere and amazing food! Hanger steak was so freakin good! Service was a bit slow but it wouldn't stop me from going again next time I am in Pittsburgh!

I'm not a big meat-lover, but went a couple of times because I enjoyed the night-time ambiance. Enjoyed sitting at the bar, had good service, but because the menu is so meat-heavy (naturally, not a complaint), I had decided not to go there again.   However, I had recently looked at the Brunch menu, and thought it looked really inviting. Friends from Boston were visiting, so I took them this past Sunday. The atmosphere is definitely sexy and lovely at night, but during the day, it was disappointingly loud and garish. We were sitting under some kind of woofer and the beat was so insistent and loud, we had to shout to be heard. We asked the server if the volume could be adjusted, but it was clear, from his response, and the fact that the music was coming from a DJ, that no one was going to do anything to lessen the noise. Most of the tables were filled with older people and you could tell we weren't the only ones wanting to escape the loud thumping.  Come on, it's Sunday morning in Pittsburgh, not Friday night in South Beach. The food was mostly delicious but the atmosphere was so bad, we all agreed we would never do brunch there again.
Wife and I always get the meant and potatoes for 2. We also get an additional serving of bone marrow. We never finish our steak because it's so huge. Totally awesome food tho!

Fantastic brunch choice! I had the grilled cheese w soup. It said tomato soup on the menu but it really wasn't. The soup it went w was celery or potato soup w pickles! It tasted wonderful! Cheese is good as always. I will try dinner this weekend! Also the libation choice is rich. I tried the lavender and I LOVED it.
Hands down one of the best restaurants in the city. I've been at least six times since I moved last summer. You cannot go wrong, and top notch cocktails as well.

Quick Review: Good food, but I think the hype made it impossible to live up to expectations.   It seemed like everyone was raving about Meat & Potatoes, but we never seemed to get there for one reason or another. Finally, after buying tickets for a show I was able to get reservations for dinner pre-show.   The space itself is smaller than I expected, to the point that I actually felt a bit cramped.   The staff was incredibly friendly and it became clear that a few diners around us were regulars (one couple told us they lived in a condo nearby).   The alcohol selection was quite nice. I went with an old fashioned, my wife had wine.   Anytime I see duck on a menu I am tempted to order it. This was good, but nothing mind blowing. My wife ordered the Salmon which was, again, good but nothing incredible.  Again, I don't know if all of the hype made it impossible to meet expectations, but we both left the meal with the sentiment "That was good, but not amazing."  I would be happy to go back and try again, but its not a high priority.

We went again over the summer on my birthday.   We started off with the Mac N Cheese appetizer (chorizo, pulled pork and loads of cheese!) So so good! A definite must try!  This time for our entree the wife and I shared the 34 oz rib eye for two. It comes with confit steak fries, house made steak sauce and bone marrow gratin. It is AMAZING and a bargain at $59 as we ate off of it for days!!  Our daughter had the Plain Jane burger with white cheddar cheese and loved it.   I'm glad I made reservations as the place was packed the whole time we were there.  Service was exceptional as our waitress Ashlee S was great and took good care of us.  I've said before and I'll say it again. THIS PLACE IS A MUST TRY!!!
Our waitress, Sara, was so rude and obnoxious. Chicken and sausage was so dry that it could have been a hockey puck. The only good thing about this place was potato gnocchi.

What an amazing dinner, one of my most memorable culinary experiences. The paté and bone marrow appetizers were such a decadent treat. But the crowning glory of the meal was the 45oz bone in rib eye - WOW. It was cooked to perfection and was amazingly tasteful. No matter how good the food is (and it was incredible) no dining experience can be 5 star without great service. Jessica, you were exceptional. Thank you for making our evening perfect! You really are wonderful. I can't wait until my next trip back to the 'burgh to have you be part of my next Meat & Potatoes adventure!

First time visiting Meat and Potatoes.  Great service. We sat at the bar and experienced bartenders with a passion. They took proud in their work and the creation of their drinks. The food was great. I ordered the mac n cheese with brisket appetizer and my husband got the catfish tacos and fries.   I wanted to kiss the chef that made the brisket. It was so tender and juicy. I didn't need a knife to cut it or my teeth to chew it. It just melted in my mouth. The french fries were perfectly seasoned as well.

After seeing this restaurant featured on a Chuck's Best Bite on the Cooking Channel, we knew we needed to come here. We are glad we did, and are considering coming back for brunch tomorrow on our way out of town. This place has great ambiance, friendly staff and AMAZING food. The seating was a little close (a long bench with chairs on the opposite sides for parties of 2) but that just meant we made some instant friends. Our server was professional and nice and our dinners arrived quickly and looked great. I had the pot roast w/whipped potatoes and my husband had the Papperdelle Pasta w rib tips. We shared and I have to say the Papperdelle wins. The sauce is delectable, the noodles cooked perfectly. I can't wait to come back for this! My pot roast was a smidgen dry but it was still extremely delicious. Overall our experience here was fantastic and I highly recommend come here for dinner (be sure to make reservations in advance, they fill up fast). BRAVO!
Interesting menu, crowded energetic bar and dining area.  Cool area.  Seemed over-hyped on here.

We ate here on a date night that was totally arranged by my wife.  Despite the fact that I was semi-annoyed we had to drive into town from the 'burbs' during a trifecta of parking-hell (Pirate game, Regatta and "Furry" convention), I couldn't have been more pleased with our meal.  $20 parking was excessive, but to no fault of the restaurant.  Started with a steak tartare appetizer which was the best thing I've eaten in recent memory.  Followed it with the "surf and turf" special that, although a little pricey, was simply wonderful.  Wish we could have saved room for dessert, they all sounded terrific, but will have to wait for our next visit.  If you are expecting a private dining experience, Meat and Potatoes isn't your place.  Tables are very close together...so much so you could eat off of strangers plates. My wife hit a grand slam with this one though, can't wait to go back.

Who can get mad about a steak as big as your head? We ordered the steak for two with potatoes and extra bread. The bone marrow was delicious (think beef flavored butter) and the first time I'd had this. Requested that the steak be cooked to medium and it was and was just delicious. They were excellent with fitting in my son, who is a toddler and the waiter was very friendly toward him. This restaurant isn't the largest, I do not think I would recommend it for a large crowd as it has open air and very little space between you and others. It wasn't especially loud or anything, but I wouldn't personally bring a big group here. Food was served up amazingly fast. HIGHLY recommend reservations because this place isn't large and there was a long wait if you didn't have reservations.

One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh!  Came here with a colleague for dinner and sat at the bar - ordered a number of courses and all the food was delicious.  I also have to say, from the host/hostess to the bartenders to the servers, everyone went out of their way to provide exceptional service.  Hands down one of the best dining experiences in Pittsburgh.  I will definitely be back often.

This was the first time I went to this restaurant. I saw it on a television show on the Travel Channel and thought I had to go, and I wasn't disappointed. It is a local restaurant in Pittsburgh and if you want a great steak and great atmosphere, do yourself a favor and definitely go to this place. I'm not a fan of chain restaurants and always look for locally owned, and this restaraunt is locally owned......thumbs up!

While searching for a place for dinner with the boyfriend and the pseudo-in-laws, I stumbled upon the website for M&P. Open for less than a year, the menu for this awesome gastropub made my mouth water. A stellar selection of craft beers, decent wine, and a cocktail list using fresh ingredients that could warrant the term "mixology" but without the "mixology" price tag? I'm in!  But while the casual-hip atmosphere and well-curated libations are definitely reason enough to go here, the food stands out as innovative yet familiar; filling, well-executed, and affordable. Our table started the meal off with an order of their mussels cooked in a white wine sauce and served with fried taters (fries) with a black truffle aioli. These mussels were fresh and quite flavorful with the addition of smokey chorizo, chili, and broccolini- it's broth soaking in great flavor and accentuated with a touch of cream.  The boyfriend's parentals ordered the salmon (pictured at the top of this post) and the roast chicken, respectively. The salmon had a beautiful presentation and was exotic and packed some heat with its Brussels sprout kim chi, pineapple, chili, and Korean BBQ flavors. The Pan Roasted Chicken had more south of the border flavors with black beans, yucca fries, salsa verde, and queso fresco.  Boyfriend went the route of their Hudson Valley Duck Breast which was cleverly crusted with pastrami seasonings and served with sauerkraut pierogies, ramp butter, dandelion greens, and chimichurri- we shared bites of this and I must say, that duck was served at a perfect medium-rare and had loads of flavor. For my entree, the Braised Lamb Shank. I surprised even myself when I made this my dinner of choice, but the description sounded too good to pass up (and it did not disappoint). A giant bone-in lamb shank was placed before me; perfectly fall-of-the-bone tender and covered in a glorious sauce and gremolata. This entree was served on a bed of creamy Tuscan white beans, broccolini, and a bitter braised kale that helped cut through the fatty, homey goodness of the lamb. If you can't tell, I was an absolute fan of this dish.  Completely stuffed from this rich and comforting dinner, we opted to skip dessert. But with Southern Tier's Creme Brulee stout on the menu, the boy and I couldn't resist. Do yourself a favor and head to Meat & Potatoes next time you're in downtown Pittsburgh.
A Pittsburgh staple! Great vibe in downtown Pittsburgh. Their brunch is simply amazing.
Top notch, interesting dishes.  Can't recommend it enough. Maybe not the best for vegan/vegetarian fare, but it is called MEAT & Potatoes. Carnivores only.

I had such a great time eating (and drinking here).  The atmosphere was wonderful, with casual picnic tables and lots of music.  We spent about two hours, slowly working through apps and beer then lunch/dinner.  The pretzels were good, the beer cheese made them great.  The brats were wonderful.  The red cabbage was a surprise hit as well.  I tried the beer in a flight to try each, but went back for more of the dunkel and hefeweizen.  The dunkel was a real treat.  I recommend to plan to spend a good amount of time here.  Also, very kid friendly.  Next time I am in Pittsburgh I will try again.

I REALLY wanted to like this place. It was an awful experience from start to finish. The food was eh. Service was eh. It took our food over an hour to come out from the kitchen. Totally unimpressed and I won't be back.

I've gone to Meat & Potatoes for both dinner and brunch and experiences were great! My favorite part were the portion sizes, they're huge and delicious.  The brunch was probably my favorite. I got the chicken and waffles, and it was superb. Couldn't recommend this place enough for brunch. Be sure to make a reservation well in advance, they always seemed to be full booked 3-4 days ahead of time.
Bruhhhh my favorite restaurant in the burgh amazing food excellent service great hospitality and the music was phenomenal make sure you ask for Samantha as your server

This place really outshined my expectations. I had heard a lot about it and read several reviews. It's tough to get into and you must make reservations but it's worth it. It's not really a family place but we did take our 3 boys (11, 13 & 15) here and their loved it. They are used to eating at more upscale restaurants and are try foodies so the thought it was fantastic. Or waitress was awesome and made us feel very welcome. I mention this because we have beenough to other upscale places with the kids that act like we don't belong because we have kids with us. Not here. The food was excellent! I had my first experience with Wagyu Beef and I'm ruined on steaks now. Holly mother of all... It's life changing. Great gastro pub in the Burgh. I highly recommend.

Great atmosphere with a younger clientele (30s-40s).   I had a Martini with some Chicken wings and fried brussels sprouts. It was all great! Downtown Pittsburgh can be hit or miss with some of its restaurants. This one's a hit!

I usuall. don't go out of my way to write reviews but created a yelp account after my experience here tonight. Upon entering my friend and I were greeted immediately by friendly faces at the host stand. We did not have a reservation but we stopped in anyway to see if we could be accommodated.  Thankfully,  the great host staff was able to get us a table. I can not say enough how impressed I was with the hosts tonight. They were able to fit us in and were so kind. One complimented my jacket and even offered to hang it up for me. I thought their style was impeccable as well. I was impressed. What I was not so impressed by was what seemed to be a manager or owner (shorter husky man with dark hair)  who seemed to be very unnecessarily harsh with the staff. That's something I always hate seeing while dining out. We enjoyed the food that came out of the kitchen but were completely unimpressed with our server Crystal. She came off as very cold and annoyed with having to be there. On the slim chance we return, we'll be trying the bar. Hopefully the bartenders will treat us better than Crystal.

It was great. Yep. That's the end of the review.   All right, I came out here for dinner and I was incredibly pleased at my decision, so much, in fact, that I skipped out on another place my second night and came here again, for reasons outlined later.   First night was mostly appetizers on my end. I made the mistake, if there ever was one, of ordering the famed bone marrow appetizer, which the waiter cautioned was more of a 'sharing' app. Whatever. It looked great in the pictures so I got it.. and yes. It was a delicious pile of bones with bone marrow to scoop out of with all of its super fatty greasy sweet goodness. Yes, it did start to get overwhelming at the end. Yes, it was a ton of food for a reasonable price. So my original intention was to order the pork chop (which in itself is enormous) but no, I had to stop with the steak tartare appetizer and close out with drinks.   Let's talk about drinks. I like fancy craft cocktails. I also like rare liquors that are hard to find in the States. Meat & Potatoes has both. Greta was my bartender for that evening and we started off conservatively with stuff on the menu but by oh, drink four, I was peeking through her bartender's black book for novelty's sake. She also alerted me to Fernet Branca Mentha, which is a super minty version of Fernet.   Second night was the pork chop that almost got away. Stuck to the basics, got it, and it was perfect. Beautiful presentation, just done right pork, and it was enormous amounts of food for reasonable prices (for a high end gastropub... bear in mind, I come from the DC area where stuff like this cost 2-10x more). Admittedly, it was less memorable and more basic than night one's debauchery of meat butter and raw meat. The fried brussel sprouts though. Get them. Those WERE incredibly memorable from the second night.   Get reservations. They're probably one of the most desired restaurants in town. Great service, great food, awesome experience.
Place has great food, but is a bit pricey. Plus the seating for tables is a bit uncomfortable.

The food was different and amazing!  I could have stopped at the Brussels sprouts!  THE BRUSSELS SPROUTS!!!  OMG!  But I kept going and if I could have I would have kept going and going and going!!!  Amazing food!  The only reason the 5th star is missing is because the server was a bit off putting- almost seemed annoyed to have customers.  She was lucky the food was incredible.

As of this date, December 2011, this is the best join in Pittsburgh.  There's only one kicker, you have to come 3 times to figure it out!  Visit 1. Fancy Dinner: Go, order the delicious "Manhattan" they've aged and pour into a cup for you.  Perhaps a bottle of wine with dinner.  Order the rib-eye FOR SURE (it comes with marrow so you can skip that at appetizer time, it's great, but use your "room" for the appy that delights you most.  Visit 2. Brunch: Bloody bar, check, bacon vodka suggested.  I got the hash (Meat and Potatoes right?!).  Wow, so good.  Visit 3: Casual Dinner: Burgers and Beers.  They've got a great selection of both.  Maybe start your meal with the "snacks."  Friend brussel sprouts anyone, yeah, I think so!

Visiting from San Diego we stumbled along the Meat & Potatoes website. The options sounded great and the other Yelp reviews made up our minds for us. We paid for parking, walked a couple of blocks and were NOT thrilled to hear there was a 4 hour wait - are you kidding me! We were told we could check the seating around the bar, we did. Squeezed into 2 end seats and were quickly greeted by the bartender complete with page-boy cap, suspenders, white t with sleeves rolled 3/4 of the way up - really added to the decor.  My hubby started with the Dunquesne Pilsner beer, and I started with an iced tea. The beer, in the words of my hubby, "it was a good drinking beer".   Our starter was the Artisanal Cheese Board, and it was super yummy! The local cheese was tasty, but my fav was the local strawberry preserves! Fresh dates, apple slices, candied pecans and toasted fresh bread were great accompaniments to the cheese.  Our entrees: Pappardelle for my hubby and the Brisket Sandwich. My mouth still waters when I think of my hubby's Pappardelle pasta! The pasta was fresh made, the short rib and pork shoulder were perfectly tender and tasty, the bolognese sauce was the perfect addition, not too overpowering, just right! My Brisket Sandwich was good, very big! The slaw was a little different than I expected, not in a bad way though. The overall taste was good, a solid 3 stars, but the Pappardelle deserved a solid 5 stars!  The overall place gets a solid 4 stars, but the pasta dish and our bartender service gets a 5!

So I'm a little in love with this place right now.  And damn, I forgot to steal a cool "cuts of cow" coaster again!  I've been here twice now, both times to the bar area.  Thursday night was packed, room in the dining area for reservations only.  So I wandered to the bar and found a seat.  The bartenders...these guys are the best.  Cecil (I think)...is the man.  Their cocktail list is short, but these guys know their stuff.  I opted for the Pimm's Blue Ribbon - which combines my two favorites, St. Germain and PBR.  This is a dangerously drinkable drink...I know, I had several.  The gentleman next to me had a Sazerac, which I hadn't experienced before.  This is where Cecil stepped in and gave us a vibrant and detailed history of the drink - which was awesome.  The Sazerac isn't on the cocktail list, but again these guys know their stuff, and I would recommend giving it a shot if you enjoy Rye.  Then, for food.  Well by this point I've noshed on the Brussel sprouts, and exquisite Ceasar salad, the Lobster Mac n Cheese and the Banana Pie.  Brussel spouts are very good, but the dipping sauce they come with is even better.  Not potent, but buttery and smooth.  The Cesear salad is creamy, and topped with real, homemade pork rinds.  Now, these have never appealed to me before - but the crunchy texture and saltiness in contrast to the salad (topped with an egg...yes) was spot on.  Lobster mac is as pure as it can be.  I stopped in last night for dessert and tried the banana pie.  What came out was a little jar of heaven.  It was a banana bread type deal, layered with whipped cream and caramel...and there was a hint of peanut butter.  It was good.  With the bartenders and solid food, I would definitely recommend this place.  The atmosphere is upscale but casual and in a great locale.

Finally got around to eating here, and the food lived up to the hype (at least my food).  I had the baked rigatoni - contained pork shoulder ragu.  This was a huge helping, with more meat than rigatoni! I didn't notice the pancetta in this dish, though listed in the ingredients.  It was fabulous, with a huge portion to take home (should reheat well, too). My lunch partner had the house smoked duck salad. It was a very small portion - the salad was the size of a side salad, with four smallish slices of duck on top. She felt that it was overdressed.  For the price, the size was disappointing. I will echo the other reviews that note that the seating is awkward and close together.  As the Washington Post dining critic, Tom Sietsema often notices, a proprietor should sit in every seat of the house to experience the customer's viewpoint before opening.  We were seated next to two large (tall, broad shouldered men) who had some difficulty and awkwardness in getting into their seats.  I had almost no leg room.  The 2 tops are just awkward. Service was fine, no problems. We were pretty low maintenance. My drink was refilled quickly and our seating and food service were prompt.  I look forward to dining here again, and my husband will be grateful for the leftovers tonight!

The service is fantastic. We got chatty with one of the bartenders and he was super helpful in telling us what we should or shouldn't get into during our time in Pittsburgh.  The food is bar none. I can't imagine there being too many other places in Pittsburgh as good as this place.  The brunch was one of the best I've ever been to in my life.   We didn't plan to come to this place, we stumbled upon it, and we will definitely be back.
Very very trendy. Small quaint place with a ton of options for specialty cocktails. Make sure that you get there early. Seats are limited.
the bone marrow was amazing!! I enjoyed everything that I ordered, and I'll definitely come back again!

I tag-teamed the 45 oz ribeye with a friend. It looked like something from the Flintstones and nearly defeated us. The presentation was incredible and I was really pleased with the service - we sat at the bar. I highly recommend this restaurant for a tasty and unique dinner that you won't soon forget.
