Recently I have been on a quest to find the perfect burger in the Burgh, so of course I opted for their Plain Jane burger.  I can say that this is one of the few places that can cook a burger to medium well and it tastes like it's cooked medium well.  Perfect portion of burger too, the patty was a little thicker in the middle but I wasn't worried about that.  Romaine lettuce, tomato, red onions and more house pickles to top the patty.  I also opted to add cheese, a nice white cheddar.  This time the pickles were sweet pickles and the mixture of taste with all the toppings was like a mouthgasm.  From the bun to the pickles I was very happy.  The burger was definitely an excellent decision to make that night.  More pomme frites were a side here and sadly, after all that great food, I could not finish them.  Definitely a return trip to this place, and definitely a bar seat again for me.

I dined here for the first time for dinner a few weeks ago! Very tough to get a reservation because the dining area is a bit small, but I was very impressed with the comfy seats at the table and ambience. I ordered the pot roast and the pb&j dessert. The only critique I have is that the menu is not very big but it is yummy!

A great find by my bride. A very unique "hipster" locale, with a prohibition themed menu but with a severe twist. For example, the steak Tartare is a very old school traditional, yet theirs has Thai red peppers & and a seaweed based accent. While it was  good, it I was a bit unexpected.   High marks to the brussel sprouts, smoked pork shop and the old fashioned.   We would certainly come back in the future.

Food is outstanding, service was great!!  The barrel aged Manhattans are they best drink you will ever have!!!  You will spend a little more at this restaurant but it is 1000% worth it!!  If you are in the cultural district and don't come to Meat & Potatoes, you're doing it wrong!

Very disappointed.  Based on reviews I took my wife and two 20 something sons to Meat and Potatoes.  The ambiance is fine and the bartenders were quick and attentive.  We were seated on time and ordered the Duck pate for the table.  It was very good.  Thats where it ended for three of the four of us.  My son and I shared the 45oz ribeye and ordered it medium rare.  My wife ordered the sirloin special medium rare and my other son the pot roast with truffle fries for the table.  The pot roast and fries were great.  However both steaks came out raw (actually cold in the middle). My wife sent hers back and it came back medium to medium well...typical BS kitchen response to undercooked steak...sent it back over cooked to prove they cooked it right the first time.  We gave up and didn't finish our meals.  Was surprised the waiter didn't say anything...we tipped him well as it wasn't his fault.  How this is number one is beyond comprehension.  Capital grill is 100 times better.
Terrible service. Went there today evening with friends and they forgot my order.  My friends got 15% off their order though!! Walked out hungry. Don't think I will be going there anymore.

Great food, drinks, and service. Everything was delicious and the meat was prepared perfectly. They lived up to the name! We had the lamb shank, mushroom risotto, beet salad, rosemary potatoes, and brussel sprouts. The lamb, salad, and sprouts were amazing. The risotto was flavorful, but was a little undercooked for my liking. The potatoes were well seasoned, but were huge. It was basically a bowl of baked potatoes. I think they would've been better if they had been cut into smaller pieces.   We got seated right away late on a Friday night, but it was still very busy. I would definitely recommend a reservation here.

I am staying at a hotel around the corner from this restaurant and called to see if there was a table for 2; I was told there was one available outside if I came right away.  I arrived 5 minutes later to be told the table was gone and it would be over an hour wait to get another table.  The 3 hostesses were curt and acted like they were guarding a castle.  We sat and ordered at the bar and were entertained by the head bartender named Cecil who could give the hostesses some lessons in diplomacy.  The entire time we sat at the bar and ate (and our food was good), there were 3 unoccupied tables.    I'd go again, but I plan to contact the manager about the cranky "keepers of the gate." They almost ruined the whole experience.

Love the restaurant except the music is Too Loud!  Table next to ours requested that volume be decreased in addition to our request.  We were advised that the DJ controls. H-mmmm. It is not a music venue.
Had the house salad and roasted chicken.   The dish was outstanding as it was the most moist piece of chicken I've had in a long time.  Paired it with a Helltown IPA.    Service was great.

Wonderful spot in the theater/cultural district of Pittsburgh. Spent a lovely evening on their porch drinking some really well-done and unique cocktails and eating a variety of appetizers. Everything was wonderful.
The buffalo chicken Mac and Cheese was  exceptional and the Bartenders were awesome. The can make every drink and there service was top notch.

I didn't want to like M&P going in, as I had read reviews about rude service.  Yes our waitress wasnt warm, but it was only because the place was so packed (8pm Wednesday) that the servers were scuttling just to stay above water.  Service was outstanding, crisp and polite.  Now the food.  Shad roe appetizer and tuna tartare appetizer were both perfect. I had the mussels with coconut lemongrass sauce which surpassed my prior favorite at Pointe Brugge by a mile.  Plus M&P grills their bread, which makes for better sauce dipping.  My guest had a steak, and said it was "better than Capital Grille."  Finally, the frites with truffle mayo and the fried Brussels sprouts were both phenomenal sides.  I intend to return to see if M&P remains a 5 star in my book.

ERMAHGAWD. Really, thats all I can say. This place was UNBELIEVABLE. To this day, I continue to say this is the best meal I have EVER had. I LOVE the atmosphere, is it upscale? Yes, is it a bar? Yes! Thats the best part, I would feel comfortable in jeans and a polo, just as much as I would in a full suit. No one here is discriminated from this dress code. The beer selection was great, but know whats even better is their drink selection. You know you've found a good place when you ask the bartender what you should get, and he asks what you're feeling. At that point you let him do his magic, and you sit back and relax. Is it a little pricier? Of course, but did I mention this is probably my favorite food I have ever had? Because it was, the best meal I have ever had. The fiance ordered the fried pickles, and the dipping sauce AND pickles were both incredible. I got conned into ordering their fried tatters (French fries, and he really had to force me to order them *not*) and I also ordered the mammoth pork thingy. I say thingy because calling it a pork chop does NOT do it justice. Think... Consistency of a steak, taste of heaven, with some BBQ flare in there as well. The collard greens were not something I enjoyed but thats because I am just not a fan of them. The pork was honestly just incredible. The french fries (I forgot to write about these earlier) were ALSO perfect. Truffle oil, and an incredible Garlic Aoli that I wanted to be buried in a vat of. With this being said, the service is ALSO incredible. Please go visit, and have the meal of a lifetime!

Went for lunch and ordered the Turkey Melt-it was laden with layers of dense, dry turkey and I couldn't even cut through the bottom layer of bread, never did find out whether it was burnt or otherwise. Left 3/4 of it on the plate.

I love this place!  I couldn't wait to try it when my boyfriend and I came to visit Pittsburgh one weekend because he is obviously, a meat & potatoes guy.  We were pretty hungry, yet wanted to save room for their 34 oz. Ribeye.  He started with a caesar salad.  It was different, but very delicious.  The crispy pig ears and chicarrones added a great crunch to the salad since it was sans crouton like the usual.  The boyfriend really enjoyed it.  Meanwhile, I had the fried pickles and devils on horseback lol.  The fried pickles were great, but I wasn't too into the devils on horseback.  I've had them differently at many other places, so a description with what's in it would've been nice.  But when the Ribeye for two came, we couldn't wait to dig in.  First off, we were seated at a tiny table, so the wood board basically took up the entire table.  But the seating was very comfortable because I had the booth side, which was similar to a comfy couch.  They gave us little plates.  Although there was a lot of fat on the steak, it was still a really good amount of meat as well.  It was cooked perfectly and the wait did not feel long at all.  We got the mushroom ragu on the side and they put it into a dish for us.  Steak fries were crispy and delicious, but we were pretty full from the steak.  We also added a side of mac & cheese to have with the steak.  All in all, we had a great experience and wish we lived closer so we can come back.  Meat & Potatoes was also located in a great area and the bar looked like it'd be a good spot to grab drinks before a night out.  The ambiance was great.

I came here for brunch on Sunday. The bar menu sounded fantastic with such unique options for bloody marys, I couldn't wait to arrive.   I ordered a dill pickle and jalapeño infused vodka bloody. The server came back with a glass of ice and vodka. I didn't realize it was a make your own, interactive thing. That was really fun and my garnishes were real out of control. The vodka on its own was really delicious, and so was the final drink.  My date ordered the morning mule which tasted fantastic with the fresh ginger and prosecco. This is officially my 2nd favorite mule of all time.  We then ordered the kimchi bloody which was good and the seelbach, which was fantastic and knocked me on my A.  To eat, I ordered the burger, sans bun.  I didn't want fries so I asked for salad mix or a vegetable and I was advised there was nothing like that on the brunch menu and no, I could not have it. Seriously, not a single vegetable to be had. Odd, and highly disappointing. The burger was ok, though the condiment choices did not make sense to me. One was ketchup and one was a pink mayo based chunky sauce of sorts. Neither enhanced my burger and in fact, both took away from the burger. Maybe a grainy mustard or an au jus or something more appropriate.  My date ordered chicken and waffles and literally it was a huge waffle with 5 boned chicken parts. Totally not what he expected, considering you basically had to eat the chicken with your hands and part of chice and waffles is covering the whole thing with maple syrup... It was a complete mess and very uncomfortable looking. He advised it tasted good, after I let him know it's not his fault if he left looking like a 2 year old with food all over himself.  All-in-all, the experience was ok. They def make one great cocktails. The food left a bit to be desired.

This is the best restaurant in Pittsburgh by far.  The food is great and the drinks are even better. The bartenders are very very nice. It's difficult to get in at times, so make a reservation in advance!!  Come on a weekend and get brunch! They have a 5$ Bloody Mary bar and it is so amazing. They infuse their own vodka, gin and tequila for the Bloody Mary bar and you won't be disappointed.  Best Bloody Mary in town.
Worst service ever and the bar service sets a new low for customer satisfaction. Wouldn't recommend this to any person

This is the start of my downtown food adventure and I'm very pleased with it. Been there for both lunch and dinner and I prefer dinner in this place. The famous  meat and potato dish is huge! and tasty. Their fries are soooo good. Bone marrow is decent but I've had better. As for appetizers we ordered several dishes, while they're fun in concept, I find these to be less impressive. Will def be back to this place b/c I wanna try their cocktails and hubby is constantly craving their steak.

Rather disappointed in their brunch. I joined a few friends at 11:30 on a Saturday for brunch. I was excited to try MNP since everyone raves about this place. We arrived on time and were taken to our table by the bar. The restaurant was busy but not packed. We ordered our drinks and then waited.  .  And waited. . .  And waited. It took our server 30 minutes to take our order. Having 7 years of restaurant experience I was dumbfounded that it took this long. I'm honestly still in shock. When our server finally made his way over to our table, I ordered the special pancakes- cornmeal with lemon and blueberry. Our food also took quite a long time so our waiter provided us with monkey bread to share as an appetizer on the house. The monkey bread aka glorified cinnamon roll was a sugar explosion in my mouth. Yummm. I liked it so much I took one to go with the intention of giving it to my husband but ate half of it myself later on. As far as my pancakes were concerned, I wasn't as impressed. They tasted like cornbread with blueberries. I wasn't able to find the lemon at all. Another disappointment, the syrup. I was given standard maple syrup. The dish could have easily become 4 stars with a warm blueberry sauce or lemon creme anglaise. I also ordered a side of the peppered bacon with my pancakes. The bacon was delicious and savory. It added another dimension of flavor to an otherwise bland meal. All in all, I would not return to MNP for brunch. But, I do want to give dinner a try for some (hopefully) delicious meats and potatoes.

The best place to eat in down town Pitt when you consider everything. We have been about 5 times.   Drinks: Good price. Amazing value. The make the best old fashions in town. Seriously. Just try theirs. For brunch, get the Bloody Mary bar option. You will thank me.   Speaking of brunch I have ordered the short rib hash and poached eggs twice and I will order again. Ridiculous. $12. They could charge more and it would pay.   The wife bought the fried chicken and waffles. Also ridiculous. Chicken was moist and flavorful. Some would say spicy but tame for us. The real hero was the syrup. The bourbon, bacon infused syrup was so unique and flavorful it almost goes unnoticed in its small dish they serve it in.   Pork belly tacos are great!  The only item we ordered that didn't stack up to every other item was the lamb burger. It was good but compared to everything else they serve this was at the bottom of the list.

Stopped in last weekend on Valentine's day. Great atmosphere and service. Took a tour of the menu starting with the fried pickles, taters, and bread. Got the dark n stormy off the cocktail list. Everything was fantastic - on par with it's sister restaurants.

I love Meat & Potatoes.  You'll love it, too. Make a reservation!  I've been there a few times now and it's been fricken awesome every. single. time.   The first time I went there, it was Pgh Restaurant Week and they offered a 5 course tasting menu. It was the first time I'd ever had marrow. And if you are thinking, "Ew! Marrow??" Believe me. I was the same...until I ate it. And it was delicious.  Everything else we ate that night was also delicious. Fried chicken and jalapeno waffles. Sweetbread tacos. Grilled bread w/ goat butter and rhubarb jam....  Sweet baby J. Can I tell you about that grilled bread??  GET IT.  It is offered as an app at brunch AND dinner, so no matter what time of day you are there, you can get it and you should. It's probably what God eats for breakfast.  Spare rib hash for brunch? DO IT.  So basically what I am saying is...The food is great. The service is also great - every time I've called to make a reservation (and I'm always last-minute b/c I'm a procrastinator), they've gone out of their way to fit us in.   If I could marry a restaurant, I'd marry this one.

We went here after work on a Tuesday; around 7:00 - I didn't think it would be busy, but they had no tables open until 9:00. We were directed to the bar and were delighted to see that two seats had just opened up.   We sat down, were greeted and given water and menus.   That was it.   Ten minutes later we got up and left because no one cared to take out drink order or answer questions about the menu.   It was busy, yes. But that is no excuse for rudeness. If you can't handle the crowds, pull back a bit on your profit motive and hire more wait staff or Leo something else.   We were very disappointed because of all the good reviews we saw on yelp. Maybe those reviews only pertained to table service.

Stellar all the way around.  Tends to be quite busy on theater weekends but other wise delightful atmosphere, killer food and killer drinks.  Awesome.  I recommend it constantly to friends and acquaintances.

Love everything from the decor to fried pickles to the hanger steak. The only thing I'm sad about is that I'm seven hours from Pittsburgh, but it's worth the trip. Oh, the drinks were amazing too. Not a lot to choose from for beer, but they do have a full bar.

My husband and I went for lunch with our 20 month old daughter.  We did not have a reservation which was not a problem.  They were accommodating with a high chair and very friendly from the start.   We ordered the pickle chips (which were good) and fried Brussels (which were fantastic). For the entree my husband had the burger.  It was delicious.  Cooked to perfection and the tomato jam was a tasty touch.  I had the mussels.  They were equally awesome. The coconut and spices were so complimentary.  Also, it was a hefty portion with some crusty bread to soak up the leftover juices.    We're hoping to get back there for date night some other time but it's nice we could try it for lunch since we had our daughter with us.

The first time we had been was for our anniversary on 9/24/16.  The food and service were both great.  We did have some issues though which is why there is only a 3 star rating.  If it hadn't been for the food and service being so good, probably would've given a 1 star due to the issues being listed below.  First off, the lighting, like so many other high end restaurants was horrible.  I will never understand putting out such stunning looking food and then having basically no lights in the dining room at all for the patrons to see how beautiful the food looks.  Secondly, the night we were there, the draft beer system was down.  While this most likely isn't an everyday occurrence, it still was an issue the night we were there.  Third, the tables are so crammed together, you're basically eating dinner with complete strangers sitting in your lap.  The tables are literally only about 18 inches apart.  It makes for a romantic evening not being romantic at all with having the feeling of complete strangers sitting at the table with you, but hey, anything to make more of the all mighty dollar I guess.  And lastly, my brother in law ordered a gift card online for us for Christmas 2015.  We brought in the printout and the server told us that we needed the actual card.  To date, neither my wife and I, nor my brother in law's family has ever received this card our server was talking about.  I don't see how it takes more than 10 months for a gift card to be mailed from Pittsburgh to Cranberry Township or to Lakewood, OH so it just seems like the restaurant took a $25 donation for absolutely nothing.  It's sad since the food and service were so good that I don't believe we will be returning.  As good as the food and service was, it does not outweigh the issues, especially just taking money from my brother in law and giving absolutely nothing in return.  Once again though, anything to make more of the all mighty dollar, including not honoring or sending gift cards even though money was exchanged for the gift card.  Definitely a way to make more money by charging for a gift card then not ever sending it.

Really wasn't my cup of tea here. However he staff and service was great they really have a great atmosphere. It was very crowded and the wait was very long. I was disappointed in the food, I expected much better than what I got but it's ok! There are many places to eat downtown
I will NEVER eat here! We were lied to and discriminated against today. A further explanation is in this video. We were basically turned away! https://youtu.be/ory51Myb_sw

Fried pickles, man. All I gotta say. My friend and I ate here for lunch one day and we were completely silenced after taking our first bite--an occurrence that has only happened here because we were in awe of how...insanely amazing everything tasted. Every bite is savory and they have great drinks available. 5 stars!

We really enjoy M&P. We've been several times since moving to Pittsburgh. What we like most is that we can pop in just before and show and stop at the bar or wait for a table. Though it can be more than 30 minutes they are always helpful with getting you in and out quickly. The food is awesome. I really enjoyed the large steak for two. The service is also very good -- we've never had a bad server and the bartenders are also very friendly.
If you want to eat marrow out of Bambi's leg bones, this is the place.
Pretty good place for dinner.  Went with a colleague after work as we were both from out of town.  It was busy and it was a weekday.

Such a lovely establishment! Oh Pittsburgh, you get better and better every visit. Even dahntahn is flourishing!  My friends and I went to Meat & Potatoes as a last stop on the latest Pittsburgh adventure. We decided on brunch, which apparently gets booked out for reservations, so you might want to plan ahead. Luckily the (very large) bar area remains unbooked and the bartenders do take good care of their customers.   While I very much liked all the food I tried - including the MASSIVE grilled cheese and tomato soup, and the truffled fried potatoes. The portion sizes seem to vary quite a bit from dish to dish, i.e. the steak and eggs is tiny.  The highlight for brunch was the Bloody Mary buffet bar. That's right a buffet for Bloody Marys. You order the Bloody Mary, so they pour you infused liquor (jalapeno-infused tequila, bacon-inflused vodka, etc.), and then you go up to the bar for allll the fixings. And there are A LOT of fixings, including all different types of hot sauces.  I look forward to trying dinner on a future visit!

Love this place. I was in Pittsburgh for a business trip and I really wanted to try a good place to dine downtown. Every body recommended the Primanti Bros, and no..I didn't want that. It didn't fit in my mouth. Then, someone I worked with recommended this place and Nola. I chose Meat and Potatoes as I didn't find it necessary to eat Cajun food in Pittsburgh. My coworker, Joe, and I had to wait about 30 minutes before we got sat. At first, they said 1 hour. But nice that they offered to call so we could at least walk around. So, I definitely recommend to make a reservation. It's definitely the happening place in town. When we were walking around, none of the nearby restaurants were half as crowded as Meat & Potatoes. The foods were awesome too, and I had a hard time ordering as I wanted to try several things. Joe was daring and ordered bone marrow for us to try for appetizer. He asked me if I had it - of course, I had. There aren't that many things I haven't tried. Well, it was his first time. He lost his bone marrow virginity that night. He liked it. I ordered one of my favorite meals ever, moules frites which were mussels and fries. It was tasty. Joe ordered gnocchi with short ribs. I loved my meal and if I were in town again, I'd come back in a heart beat.

I stumbled upon Meat & Potatoes after arriving in Pittsburgh. I decided to take my chances and walk in without a reservation. They had over and hour wait - which I expected. The hostess did let me know that they had bar seating with full service. Their bar was also super packed, but I let the bartender know I was looking to grab a seat and ordered a drink in the meanwhile. As soon as someone was paying their check the bartender gave me a heads up and I was able to settle in.   I ordered a Bloody Mary because that's what I'm into these days. They have a DIY BM bar - first you choose your liquor and you get handed a glass, with a decent pour of said liquor. I went with chipotle pepper vodka, cause who doesn't love an extra kick. Then you head over to this assembly line where you dress your BM with different meats, cheeses and vegetables and then top off your liquor with the BM mix. I wish I was better at this whole dressing thing, but it is clearly not a strong point of mine. However, it was an experience and I was slightly buzzed after just one glass. It was STRONG.   Since I was there for brunch, I ordered the Brisket Hash. Everything about it was to die for. The eggs were properly poached, it had the right amount of truffle oil, and the potatoes were delicious. I wish the serving size was slightly bigger but it was still everything I wished it would be.   I would definitely come back to try out some more of their menu. If you are in Pittsburgh - this is a must.

The food was exceptional and service equally noteworthy, but my wife & I were seated at a table that, at best, was a cocktail table which was dwarfed by the "Meat & Potatoes for Two" (34oz tomahawk ribeye with all the trimmings) we selected for dinner.  It came on a butcher block cutting board that took up the whole table - no room for plates, so when asked by the waiter on being served "is there anything else I can get you?" my response was "Yeah, a bigger table!"  We had reservations, made over two weeks in advance - next time, Mr DeShantz, seat us at a real table or if you don't have one, then don't take the reservation!!!

Friends kept telling us to have brunch here.  Finally got a chance to come today.  They were out of the chicken and waffles but the pork belly burrito was amazing.  The beer the selection is amazing.  Great staff and great atmosphere.  Can't wait to come back

Pioneering restaurant and an inspiration to all else that is trendy and delicious.  One of the first in the city to deliver such a strong mix of cocktail ingenuity and a menu of pure indulgence. Up to this point we have tried it all. Love this place. Don't miss brunch either with a tremendous Bloody Mary bar. Strong recommend the chicken and waffles. .

I generally do not like bloody marys but loved the bloody mary bar at Meat & Potatoes!!  They have a variety of infused vodkas to choose from and a huge spread of condiments to add - almost could be a meal in itself!  For brunch I had a hard time choosing what to order because everything on the menu sounded so good.  Ended up going with the housemade granola and huevos rancheros which were both delicious and big portions.  Cool, trendy place with great food & drinks!

Hands down, one of my absolute favorite spots to eat.  Last time we went there, the kitchen reduced the sauce on my pot roast too much, resulting in a very salty dinner.  The manager spotted my expression almost instantaneously, and came over to make it right.  It's apparent that they care very much about their clientele, that their staff pays attention to your first bite to make sure you're happy with their product.  I ordered the lamb steak and it was simply marvelous.  You will have to either come late (after 9pm) or put in a reservation well in advance.  They make old time cocktails and have a very speakeasy vibe.

Visited this spot 4 times over a 2 week visit to Pittsburgh. I've had dinner twice, and brunch twice. Every visit has been consistently tasty. Both dinners were after a show across the street, around 10:30pm. Sat outside with show mates and had a bit of everything-pappardelle pasta with short rib, Brussels sprouts, bone marrow (ridiculously huge portion for what you pay--ask for extra bread with it), fried pickles, the salty flatbread-just a lot of food. Everything was incredibly good, and not over seasoned. Came back on another beautiful night for a repeat of the pasta sitting at the bar-- my best meal of all. Drinks were stellar--including this bourbon/balsamic/basil treat that I repeated both nights. Brunch was also incredible. Chicken and waffles can easily be split--basically a half chicken worth of poultry on a big waffle. Chicken is different from other fried chicken--almost double fried, and tasty enough to eat the skin by itself--really memorable. I've had a lot of gastropub/contemporary american meals on the road this year, and this place, for many reasons, is by far the most memorable of the bunch.
The main course was just ok but that may have just been because of how full i was from appetizers which were incredible. The mac and cheese was especially amazing and a must try.
Best cocktails in Pittsburgh. The bone marrow, wings and Mac n Cheese are excellent. The only downside is trying to make a reservation between 5 and 10.

Meat & Potatoes is my favorite go to brunch spot in the city. It's mainly reservation only but you can always wait a 10-20 minutes and they'll seat you at the bar if nothing is available, which is delightful. I've tried the Irish Benedict and Short Rib Hash. Both amazing but I like the Benedict better for brunch. The short rib hash is unbelievably flavorful in a amazing way. The eggs are always poached to perfection and hollandaise on both is superb.

Awesome decor. Great food. Good service. Cheese on the cheese plate left something to be desired but the bread and jam was amazing. Fries pickles were delicious and the GIANT ribeye with marrow and fries was so amazing! We are every bite of the 36 oz portion.  Great prices too!!

I have been wanting to get to Meat & Potatoes since it opened a few years back. My interest was piqued recently when I read a Thrillist article that said they had the second best burger in Pittsburgh.   We arrived at 5:30PM on a Friday. I had made reservations earlier in the week. There were still a few tables open, but it was pretty busy. The seating was a little tight, but not bad.   We started off with the pigs ears and poutine appetizers. We devoured the poutine but left the pigs ears relatively untouched...not the taste for us. They were drenched in a tangy, asian-style sauce that you'll either love or hate. The poutine was amazing, the fries were great and hot, but it was very filling!  My husband and I both got the burgers. We both agreed that they were some of the best that we've had, especially considering the price point, only $11. The meat was great, they were cooked to order. Would absolutely order again.   We finished the meal with the chocolate pot dessert, which came highly recommended. It was smooth and delicious. Though, for my fellow chocoholics, I would be remiss if I didn't say it wasn't THAT chocolately and I still craved a little chocolate after I was done.   The service was impeccable. The waiter was attentive, informative, and patient. Some of the best service we've had in Pittsburgh to date. We will definitely be back to Meat & Potatoes.

We walked to meat and potatoes from our hotel. We didn't have a reservation but we asked if we could sit outside and were seated within 5 minutes. Our waitress was very nice and accomadting. We ordered two of the spring salads which were very good ( I thought they were a little over priced at $11) we shared the roasted chicken which was very well seasoned and we'll cooked. We're thinking about going back to try the brunch tomorrow. All in all it was a very nice place to eat in the theater district.

Oh my!  This was so flipping good!  I had the meatloaf and my sister had the pot roast, both so good.  Total comfort food.  The featured wine was an excellent cab and our server was really nice and helpful.

Good but not great. The restaurant and how the hostess acted felt weirdly bougie in a way that didn't match up with the restaurant...liked my food but not sure if I would come back. Cool on the inside though

I wish I could give 3.5 stars rather than 4, but I decided to give Meat & Potatoes 4 stars due to the service, drinks, and dessert. I would really only go back to M&P for their drinks and dessert, but not for their main courses. I fully recommend getting their special drinks and the Pot de crème. I would also recommend NOT getting the Meat & Potatoes for 2.   I ordered 2 drinks: Fig & Rye and Pimm's Blue Ribbon. Both drinks were perfectly balanced and excellent - perfect mix of sweet, sour, floral-y, and just enough to mask the bitter alcohol flavor. I'm a big fan of their drinks now.   I've heard so many people compliment the "Meat & Potatoes for 2," so obviously I had to try that, but really it was a disappointment. We ordered it to be medium, yet when we got our meal the first time, the steak was rare and too underdone. After we told the waiter, he sent our meal back and we waited to get a new one. We had already waited 45 minutes for our meal since we wanted it medium, and had to wait another 20 minutes to get a new one. When we got it the second time, we expected it to be perfectly cooked. Even though it was closer to medium than the first one, the middle of the steak was completely raw. We ate around the raw part since we didn't want to wait again.   I had told the waiter about this just to let them know that we weren't completely satisfied, and when the manager came over he told us that we should've told them again. I felt like he was lecturing me because I didn't request for a new meal again, but I wasn't prepared to wait another 20 minutes and get the same meal a third time...Instead, he comped our appetizer and our dessert. I thought this gesture was extremely kind, but to be honest, I just wanted to have a good steak. I would say that the flavor of the steak is nothing special, and for a place called "Meat & Potatoes" it does disappoint. I've had steaks that are way better. I wish I had ordered something else off their menu.   Other components of the "2," were bone marrow, mushroom ragu, and fries. The bone marrow was unpleasant....I'm not a big fan of gelatinous textures especially of savory foods, and really I felt like I was eating pure fat covered in salty parmesan. The mushroom ragu was standard. The fries were good because they were super crispy on the outside but soft in the inside.   I think what really made me give M&P 4 stars was the dessert. We ordered the Pot de Crème and S'mores. The s'mores was nothing special and I sort of regret ordering it. The pot de crème was AMAZING. It was a chocolate version, but it reminded me of toffee and nougat. I wish they had told us that there would be nuts on top of it since I am allergic to nuts, but luckily the nights only touched the top (whipped cream) and not the rest of the jar. It was super silky, creamy, and had the perfect amount of sweetness.   I would say that M&P is not worth raving about, but it is worth a try.
Awesome decor and really good food. Inside the theater arena and is open until late to grab a drink or some great people watching !!  Cocktails,vibes and people - best in Pittsburgh !!

So I ate at Meat & Potatoes for the first time last weekend and honestly I was so disappointed. After reading all the great reviews I had high hopes for this place but I was not impressed at all.  First off I love the decor and the atmosphere. They really did a great job with that.  Also the service we had was great. Our waitress was the best. I would say she was probably one of the best waitresses I've ever had at a restaurant. I give her 5 stars.  But unfortunately the food was just not that great. They have a great idea but just something was missing and not quite all there with each dish. Don't get me wrong the food isn't bad I just don't think it's worth going back for a second time. There's so many great restaurants in Pittsburgh I don't think I'll waste my time eating @ Meat & Potatoes again. I do have to give props to them for the dessert. We ordered the s'mores dessert which came out in a small cast iron dish that was warm, it was awesome! If you do decide to eat here definitely order the s'mores desert.

LOVED it Visiting from Los Angeles I was ready to be unimpressed, but I went for brunch and was immediately taken by the ambiance... the food. You can't go wrong with anything you order. Prepare to be wheeled out of there.

A great place for a family or romantic dinner (for meat lovers of course) with great food and beverages and magnificent service. I always try their bone marrow. It is simply delicious. My other favorite dish is their huge ribeye steak.  Weak point of my last visit that cost the place one star: the ribeye steak had too much fat, it was undercooked relative to my order And of course the prices are so high.  I will pay more visits to this place and won't hesitate to bring my loved ones.
It was fun!  Service was excellent and the food was really good.  The menu could've used a filet or NY strip steak, as the name is MEAT and potatoes

The appetizers, the entrees, the drinks, the ambiance, everything was AMAZING!!! I would go back here in a heartbeat!  For appetizers we tried out the fried brussel sprouts, poutine, bone marrow and steak tartare and the short rib flatbread and EVERYTHING was delicious.  I've never been a big fan of brussel sprouts, but with the crispyness on the outside and tangy dipping sauce, I'd get them every time at Meat & Potatoes.  I had the short rib bolognese for dinner. I highly recommend it! The chunks of short rib just melt in your mouth.  My boyfriend had the flat iron steak and he liked it as well.  The place was very nicely decorated.  You could meet up here for a drink after work around the center bar or a nice dinner date.  (the chairs are super comfy!)  I hope to make it back for brunch sometime!

The poutine is my go to snack/appetitizer if you're looking for a snack. This time I opted for the brisket mac & cheese rather than choosing a main course (Waygu flat iron is my favorite) and I was not disappointed. The brisket just pulled apart with just your fork and was amazing with the Mac & cheese! One of my favorite restaurants no doubt!

The menu is interesting i.e. bone marrow,  Fried Chicken livers, and sprouts.  I had hanger steak and finger potatos which was very tasty.  However, I was not blown away by the place.  Cool bar seen trendy with Edison style bulbs.  The seats were weird and had bad springs.  It's apparently THE place to be.

Was out doing the yearly visit to Pittsburgh and decided it was time to do some fine dining.  I came across Meat & Potatoes through Yelp, and secured a reservation.  Since there were only two of us, we decided to forego the main course and just stick with the mouthwatering appetizers.    In order of favorites (tartare and bone marrow may have been tied, to be honest):  *Tartare - perfectly boiled egg with solid protein, and runny yolk served on top of a heaping portion of steak tartare.  I don't know if it was the egg, the seaweed aioli, or the dry aged steak, but the flavors of this dish just worked!  Must have if we return! *Bone Marrow - not one, not two, but FOUR tyrannosaurus rex sized bones!  There was toasted bread and an assortment of toppers (sea salt, capers, etc) as well.  Needless to say, the two of us didn't finish all 4 bones. *Fried Pickles - thick, half-inch cut circles deep fried perfectly and with great side of spicy ranch.  We asked for an additional side of the truffle mayo ($1 charge) for dipping options.   *Poutine - probably our least favorite dish, and why this place can't get 5 stars in my book.  The flavors overall were good but the fries were overly salted, and the curds were almost non-existent, and the dish really didn't stand up in any way.  Overall, I'd definitely consider coming back to Meat & Potatoes next year!  If I lived in Pittsburgh, I would definitely become a regular.

My beau and I dined here two nights ago (yes, New Year's!) with an OpenTable reservation and coupons for two libations in tow. While I should've heeded the OpenTable warnings of limited menus and whatnot (being vegetarian and all), we head forth into the treacherous territory of carnivores.  I had heard great things from friends (...aka Yelp) and felt that I had to check it out. The sole vegetarian option was limited to brussel sprout salad, which seemed fairly unsexy compared to the other items on the menu. Jaren L. (my dining partner) ordered this, while I ventured away from my beloved legumes and ordered the carbonara pasta with pancetta. (I'm used to making concessions around my family and when traveling to foreign countries.) While I certainly would've preferred visiting on a day where they offered a more expansive menu, my dish was *quite* rich and tasty.  The highlight was definitely the cocktails we ordered. I had the Old Canadian - a concoction of bourbon, meringue, and maple, with a splash of vanilla and citrus. Absolutely divine! I wound up trading with my boyfriend midway through, who had gotten the Ronaldo (HOUSEMADE raspberry vodka, grenadine, and citrus), simply because both of our drinks were just so good.  I will definitely be back on another day to try their "normal" menu. Service was decent, but what really sold me was their aesthetic. I'm such a sucker for good marketing, design, and ambiance - all coupled with tasty drinks and food!
Lively place to get a goo meal. Service was great, and the food was even better.

Meat and Potatoes is a very good spot that comes with a fairly high price tag but delivers decently well for the price. The food is good and there are a great selection of cocktails.  That being said don't expect to have your socks blown off. Its good but not great. With a name like Meat and potatoes I would have liked to see more steak choices.   Give the place a shot.

It's like the chefs at Meat and Potatoes can read my thoughts, and know all my secret food fantasies.   Fried Chicken Livers-- Yes! Poutine-- More! Mac & Cheese with pork belly-- Gasp! Bone Marrow, and Kobe tartare, and Quail-- Oh My!  The space, the food, the drinks, they just all work together perfectly. The space and design is kind of "rustic hipster," if that's a thing. It works perfectly for a late dinner after the opera, or a casual meet up with friends. The menus are printed and presented in a black manila folder, and specials are written on a blackboard. The service is casual but competent. That is, you feel like your server is in on the whole concept of the place; they're invested, and they're not out of place. Everything was fresh, tasted homemade, and the portions were bigger than I anticipated. One of the best parts is that it's not expensive. We had 3 people, each with a drink, and each took home food, for ~$70 total.   And they've got a brunch?? I'm just too excited for words.
Loved it!!!   The food was really good and unique, the decor was beautiful and there's a great outdoor seating area!!!
Stopped in for a quick appetizer - had the Brussels and the Pork Wing  Awesome. Upper bar is right on the money. I could chill here til the next episode.   Get. The. Mule.  Hot sauce.

I absolutely love this place! We decided to go to Pittsburgh on a whim for some shopping so I didn't do any research or make reservations anywhere in advance. After some lurking around Yelp, I decided I had to come here due to the sheer amount of great reviews, and c'mon, who doesn't love some meat and potatoes?!   When we got there (without a reservation) we were told that the restaurant was booked solid until 10pm. Sadly, we were about to leave when a space opened up for 2 in about 45 minutes! I was overjoyed! There's a separate lobby from the restaurant right outside with some nice comfy couches so we sat there and waited. Also, there's a small bar that's in the same building as the restaurant that featured live music on a stage. Next time I will research more wisely so I can do both.   The table ended up being open a bit earlier than expected so we were seated promptly. The ambiance of the restaurant was dimly lit without too much noise so it was perfect for a romantic dinner for 2, as was the case when I looked around, there were lots of couples out for a nice dinner together.   Our waitress was very nice and gladly answered all the questions we had in addition to making some great recommendations in regards to drinks - she knew her stuff! We settled on getting the deep fried chicken liver and mac and cheese to start followed by the 34oz ribeye steak with potatoes and bone marrow as an entree. Let me tell you, BIG MISTAKE because the starters were so rich and filling that we were already nearly full when the big entree came. Our eyes were far too big for our stomachs.   The chicken liver was delicious. It was battered and deep fried a bit rare, as the waitress had warned us it would be a bit pink inside. I wouldn't recommend it if you're squeamish with the idea of anything coming from a chicken being a bit rare. The mac and cheese was SO RICH and super CHEESY. It came with pulled pork and chorizo. The cheesiness was definitely there however there was barely any meat that I could notice.   Now, onto the big one. The 34oz ribeye was perfection (called "meat & potatoes" on the menu). It came on a cutting board that took up most of our table so we just ate straight of the board (channeling our inner caveman). The ribeye was perfectly charred, cooked medium rare with the (HUGE) bone in, and seasoned just right. It came with 2 sauces on the side for the potatoes. The bone marrow gratin was also quite good however I wish that they had provided a few pieces of crusty bread to eat it with. I ended up just using the potato to spread it on (is that what I'm supposed to do?). The potatoes were very crispy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. Unfortunately we were barely able to finish half of it so we had to get it to go.   Next time (there WILL be a next time) I think we'll just get the ribeye alone as it's more than enough for 2 people. They also have daily specials as well. When we went they had mussels 3 different ways that was very popular. Nearly every table ordered them!  It's been a few weeks since we've returned to Toronto but I still think about this amazing meal! I'll be back!!

Came here to celebrate a new job and it lived up to its hype! As a person who loves vegetables and is not a big meat eater, I feel like I would eat meat more if it was prepared the way it is here. I had the duck entree and my boyfriend had the flat iron. Both were delicious and the meat melts in your mouth. I would definitely recommend coming here, but would also suggest making a reservation
We had a bad server who rarely came to our table and overcharged us, drinks were great. Music is kept so loud you have to scream to be heard

I'm pretty in love with this place.  Not a fan of the wait or the never-anything-available-at-the-time-I-want reservation system, but the food speaks for itself.      I have been to the bar once or twice and come for brunch, but most recently it was dinner.  Here's what we had:   - The 34 ounce ribeye.  So I didn't actually order this, but I was sitting at the bar waiting for my friends and the people got one.  Served on a big wooden cutting board, it screams "caveman" with a big bone sticking up off the side.  It was huge and meaty and looked divine.   My friend arrived and we were discussing what to order when I said "I'd love to order that steak, but a couple of us would have to share it."  The folks next to us *(perfect strangers) said "it's amazing - don't order it - have some of ours and then try something else from the menu".  They then proceeded to hack off a 6 ounce hunk and put it on my little bread plate with some mushrooms and a potato wedge (people are just awesome sometimes).   And they were right - it was amazing.  Tender and well-seasoned - cooked to perfection.  I will definitely be coming back for it with the boyfriend.     - The curry mussels.  Having had kind of an impromptu meal at the bar, I decided on the mussels as my entrée at the table.  The broth was the best mussel broth I have ever had.  I actually packed up the leftover broth in a to-go container and plan to pour it on some chicken and rice this evening for dinner.  The mussel portion was large and you can get some fries or bread on the side if you want round out the meal.      - The pot de crème.  I'm not a huge dessert person, but I was told I HAD to order this.  This was rich and chocolaty without being super heavy or overly sweet.  The perfect end to my meal and definitely a dessert I would recommend.    I also sampled the pot roast and some sort of lemon pie (in a mason jar) that were really great.   Everyone loved every bite and every cocktail (did I mention that they have all kinds of handmade goodies in that department?)   Brunch is just as amazing as dinner - I'll definitely be back.

The food and beer was amazing but the service of the bartenders was phenomenal. They both made sure to figure out how hungry I was so I could enjoy each plate. Bone marrow and chicken mac was amazing.
Never had a better brunch. Four starts becuase dinner is just OK. Great staff too

The food was awesome. Not cheep but we'll worth the money . I had the chili mussels as an appetizer and the were the best mussels I ever had. I should have stopped at that and just use the bread to dip into the juice. Their servers were awesome. They were fast and attentive and our waitress (Jeasica) made all of the recommendations and they were spot on. She was the best waitress i had . Ever......I am coming back latter in the year to Pittsburgh and I will come back. I would even do the 4 hour drive from Philadelphia for the mussels.  I highly recommend it.

Place is beyond delicious. Had the mushroom risotto and could have eaten a million more servings of it. Went with a group of people and no one left hungry or disappointed. If you are in Pittsburgh you must try!!

Caveat:  I ate neither meat nor potatoes, but I think I tried everything else on the menu.   The atmosphere is ...a little weird.  You have enter through the theater, but once inside the restaurant it's great.  Sort of French bistro meets bordello.  (That makes sense to me).  The chairs at the tables are realllllly comfortable, so much so that we were afraid we were going to fall asleep after eating and drinking too much.   We started with a bevy of appetizers - short ribs flatbread with arugula and gorgonzola was very tasty, as were the fried chicken livers.  The bone marrow, though, took the day.  It was a *huge* portion - easily three times what I've had in other restaurants.    For dinner I had the pappardelle, my second choice because they were out of veal shank.  It was excellent - and you can always rely upon me to get pasta no matter where I go.  The noodles were definitely homemade by someone, and the sauce had more flavor than most bologneses I've tried.  Lesley had the "Pig dip," which looked amazing.  Erin was less than thrilled with the Kobe beef, but Tim loved his hot dog.  Yes, a $12 hot dog.  Apparently it was worth the price.   The big hiccup was the service.  Our waitress was unfriendly and inattentive.  The place was not busy (it was a Tuesday), so I couldn't understand why it took so long to have plates cleared and drinks refilled.  That said, the food more than makes up for it.

My review in one word - disappointing. How about two words? Very disappointing. We were so excited to try this place after strong yelp reviews and friends' recommendations so we saved our first visit for my birthday. 6:15 Saturday night reservations started off great. Seated right away, asked if we had theater plans so they could make sure they tended us in a timely manner. Seemed like a great beginning. That was when it went downhill.   The two of us were seated along the wall where the " tables" for two are located. These tables are woefully small and completely inadequate for any dinner setting. And they are so close together!! They are essentially thigh width apart!! There should be a minimum state requirement of butt width for goodness sake! Even the skinny busboys couldn't wedge themselves in there. When your chair is wider than the table, you know it's bad. Makes for a very disruptive dining experience when your neighbor leaves. Plus, I think the fire marshall should have a look at this. Can't be safe. When I say close together, I mean the plates of the diners on either side of me were just as close to me as my wife's across the table! Everything was in arms reach. I wanted a table for two, not a party of six. I am not that interested in your life, trust me.   Beer served in cans is not my style but I did one anyway. Arrived warm. Wanted to try the smoked wings we'd heard about so we started with those and the curry mussels. Both came out together and we literally had to stack them on top of each other on the table since it was so tiny. Ridiculous. The wings were the best thing all night - good, not great. I'm a huge mussels fan and was excited when they arrived looking fresh and delish. They were large but not delish. There was NO flavor. Bland with a capital B. No curry flavor at all - I think the steaming liquid would have tasted better.  Did the spice cabinet turn out to be empty? Nice quantity though. Just not what I would have expected. Frankly I could have stopped eating here - and wish I had.   We had placed our entire order at one time. I ordered the brisket sandwich and my wife the short rib flatbread. Between appetizers and entree was at least 50 minutes. At one point I was finally able to grab our server ( where DOES she does disappear to?) and told her, if it's not out now, just cancel the order. She had stopped by 25 minutes prior and said they'd be out in one minute. Wrong.  Amazingly, mine came out but she dropped the flat bread in the kitchen.  Service disaster. Let's just say 2 1/2 hours is way too long for what we had. One hour waits between courses? Absurd. Service was among the worst I've ever experienced. And the brisket? After 3 bites I put my utensils down. Not good at all. Another flavorless serving. Flatbread? Awful. Short rib my eye. If there was more than an ounce of short rib on there I'll buy your next meal.   I feel bad giving it two stars but that was what my experience calls for. Oh, and the very limited draft beer menu? No Oktoberfest at all. Instead, a summer session ale? I mean, come on guys - this is October! There's no excuse for that. And at $7 and $10 each for our drafts, this is not a place I'd even want to drink.
This used to be my favorite place to eat, but the past couple times I've gone it hasn't been that great. I hope they revive themselves.

Met some friends from out of town and we were not disappointed.  Appetizer - Grilled Bread, Fried Pickles, and Wings.  Grilled Bread - served with freshly made preserve and butter - quite yummy to counteract the next appetizer.  Fried Pickles were approximately 1/2 inch thick.    The batter was thicker than I was used to at other establishments.   Very good to eat with my Porkslap Beer!  Wings were smoked (I honestly did not try).   My friends loved them and could not stop eating them before their entree came out.  I tried to the Pork (Fred Flinestone style) with baked beans and bacon served with a side of cole slaw.    The pork chop was approximately 2 inches thick and cooked perfectly.   The entire dish was awesome.  My friends ordered the Lamb Burger which received high marks.     Another ordered the Flank Steak which received a meh... due to seasoning.   Desert was followed by Rasberry - Oranged Cheese Cake and the ever decadent Chocolate Mousse Cake(?) Both were very good and a great contrast.   The only minus was the serving of the cheese cake (which seemed to be served in a shallow Jar.   It made it very hard for sharing.  If you want the experience but not the cost - sit at the bar.  Order a PBR for $3, split a flat bread or some wings (good portion) - You will have a good experience.    The bar is crowded but patience and PBR's go a long way :-)  Atmosphere - Crowded and Trendy.  Food - Very good - Cooked correctly.   I will be trying more of the appetizers and flatbreads in the future  Price - Snacks (Grilled Bread and Fried Picklets) - $5-$8 range, Appetizers - $12-16, Entrees $16-25 (average) besides the meal for two.  Enjoy!

I've been wanting to go here for a long time and this past Saturday we were finally able to make it. For a place with such a strong reputation, I was hoping for a bit more. If the prices were cheaper and/or the portions were a bit bigger this would be a solid 4, but these issues, followed with not meeting my expectations from the hype of the solid reptutation left me not super impressed.  We started off with the Lobster Mac and Yellowfin Ceviche. Both were good, but a bit pricey. I really did like the ceviche, but it was only maybe 10 small cubes of tuna. Then, most of us got a cobb salad and we all thought it was a nice size portion and pretty tasty. I thought the avocado ranch was a little too subdued in flavor though. Also, it could have used just a bit more bacon for the saltiness and it almost definitely requires an extra side of dressing. Good deal and flavor overall; worth the price for the most part in my opinion, but it would be nice if it was a bit cheaper when combined with an entree.  As for my entree, I ordeded the salmon, which was pretty good, but was a bit too salty I believe from the Korean hot sauce. I needed about 4-5 glasses of water to get through dinner. I thought the portion was a good size and the price wasn't too expensive at $22. I got to try a couple bites of the Pot Roast and the Pork Belly Tacos as well, which were order by others at my table. The Pot Roast was good for pot roast, but not something I would normally ever order at a restaurant. Pot roast, in my opinion, is a meal your mom makes you at home. Then, I tried one of the pork belly tacos. It was interesting for sure. The toppings were very pleasant; however, something about the very fatty pork belly was not my cup of tea. For the money, this dish is a good deal, but I don't think I'd ever order it.  Overall it was a nice restaurant, but it has room for improvement and I was just expecting more after seeing all the great reviews on Yelp. Also, we had reservations, which we had arrived promptly for, but it took another 25 minutes or so to be seated and only after I asked the hostess. She told me that she texted the person who made the reservation a few minutes prior, but failed to turnaround and ask the people in the lobby if we were the party ready to be seated (we were sitting right behind her)... Not that everyone needs to order an appetizer, salad, and an entree, but it added up to about $50 bucks after tip, which is just a bit too rich for me for one person.

Really, REALLY enjoyed my birthday brunch here. Meat & Potatoes didn't look like much was going on from the outside (it was raining) but as soon as we walked in we were pleasantly surprised. Reading about the bloody mary bar on Yelp is what attracted me to this place but the nice atmosphere and DJ really made it fun.   Our waitress was so pleasant and happily gave us recommendations for their house-infused vodkas and brunch entrees. My boyfriend and I both ordered the black pepper and garlic vodka for our bloody mary's and really enjoyed making our own versions at the bar. I honestly can't say what the vodka tasted like because I put so many other things in mine but I can say their bloody mary mix is amazing.  I had the brisket hash and it came with two eggs. It was so good but it was my birthday so I was more focused on my drink. My man got the fried chicken and he loved it so much that he ate every bite.  I'd love to come back and try dinner here, too. Next time I'm in Pittsburgh, Meat & Potatoes will definitely be first on my list.

Really good food!!!!! but my only critique is that the mushroom risotto should be in a meal size! I'm mostly vegetarian while my boyfriend is a huge meat lover so I found something I love but it's so tiny ): ... but the risotto is phenom, Mac n cheese really good, my family liked the salmon, poutine, burgers and the meat sandwich.  Basically everything is amazjnf

My husband and I have had dinner or brunch here about a dozen times in the past.  Each time we have had less than great service but we were always happy with our drinks and food so we let it slide.  However, today we showed up for our brunch reservation and waited ten minutes to be acknowledged by a server and then another twenty minutes with no drinks or explanation for why our drinks (a Bellini and vodka for the Bloody Mary bar) were taking so long. After thirty five minutes of waiting - we made a reservation at a neighboring restaurant and left.  There are too many great restaurants in Pittsburgh now to deal with the less than stellar service you will find at Meat and Potatoes.  Do yourself a favor and skip this one!

Very unusual menu- make sure to review it before going.   As others have stated, it is rather noisy and tables are right on top of each other.  Also the lighting is very dim, which makes it difficult to see the presentation of meals as they pass by to help you decide what to order.   The only thing I'd recommend, because it looked so good, was the 34 oz. Ribeye for 2 - it truly looked like something out of the Flintstones, and will leave you plenty of leftovers to take home.

I was excited to go to Meat and Potatoes for some meat and potatoes.  Unfortunately, I came on 'fish fry friday'.  The place was packed 5 minutes after it opened so I'm assuming their fish is amazing.  I went with the 'I'm not catholic' burger (real name) and it was outstanding.  I could barely finish half.

Just had their Brunch for the first time today, holy crap.  I went for with no reservation right at 1030 when they opened and was quickly seated at the bar.  If you want a brunch table you really need to call ahead.  We started with the make your own bloody Mary bar which blew my mind.  You get a choice of several different alcohols and a mass of options to throw in them.  The choices literally blew my mind.  The knowledgable bar tender warned me not to overpopulate my bloody Mary and I'm glad I took his advice.  They literally had 20 kinds of hot sauce to finish your drink with.  We started with the seared pork belly topped with an egg and kimchi.  It was phenomenal I'd go back just for this. The appetizer was last meal good.  I had the short rib hash and my guest had the Irish breakfast(forget the real name). Both were awesome.  The service was good and the place was bustling. The only downside is that it's really small, this wasn't a problem today but I can see how it would be.  Will definitely return

It doesn't get any better than this. Unless you could get a table without a reservation!  My favorite cocktail is the Moscow mule.  I can't start a meal there without one.  Then there are the chicken livers. That amazing crunch followed by the velvety middle!  Pulled pork chorizo Mac and cheese is comfort food at its best. Three little pigs sandwich is this foodie's guilty pleasure.  No one could finish this in one sitting. The muscles of the day are always an adventure.  House made corned beef...Bravo!
Amazing!  Brunch, lunch, dinner, and cocktails.  Meat & Potatoes never fails you.  Short rib hash, Chicken and waffles, and the Bronzino are particularly amazing

Never disappointed with the food.  However, the table "setting" system needs a fix.  My party was one of the first reservations for the day and despite having made the reservation a month prior, we were taken to a table next to the kitchen.  This move would have been acceptable except none of the other tables for four were even taken.  What happened to "first come, first served"?  Our request to be moved was granted, but interestingly enough, that 'kitchen' table was never occupied until two hours later.  Guess everyone else didn't want to sit in the clanky corner either when other tables were available.

So two years later, I'm back at Meat & Potatoes for brunch on a beautiful sunny Fall Sunday. My friend and I felt lucky to have been able to make a reservation at 12:00pm on a Sunday with such short notice. Somehow -- they had a table for two available in the next 15 minutes! Sweet!   The best part? When we sat down. Such comfortable seat cushions. We were seated next to the DJ, which for some people would have been less than ideal, but we enjoyed the music and were still able to have a fine conversation without yelling, so I think the volume levels are set just right.  The menu features Eggs Benedict, shrimp & grits ettouffee, chicken and waffles and a few other things. Those who don't prefer eggs for brunch may feel limited in scope for choices (as my friend), but mostly everything on the menu is incredibly delicious (I say with confidence), so how can you go wrong?  I ordered the Thanksgiving Benedict, despite already harfing down 3 soft boiled eggs for breakfast earlier that day. I could eat 12 eggs a day. This was eggactly the eggsperience I was looking for (shoot me now please), but in all honesty: the Benedict was INCREDIBLE. Stuffing - delicous cuts of turkey and perfectly poached eggs with house made cranberry sauce. It came together divinely and was the ultimate comfort food. I tried my friend's shrimp etouffee as well and it creamy, tangy and delightful.  For dessert, we shared something only God could whip up in heaven. The problem being is that I was so damn engrossed with eating it, that I sort of forgot what it called on the menu (dessert menu changes practically daily). All I can say is: if there's a mix of ice cream + a brownie with nuts type of biscotti -- go for it! Or really trust your servers recommendations (like we did). So. Divine.  The price was super reasonable as well. Definitely recommend M&P for brunch -- don't know about dinner/lunch, but I would imagine they can do no wrong!

Reminiscent of other bars I have seen. We were definitely overquoted for a table but sitting at the bar was nice. Bartenders were friendly and informative, and service was pretty quick. Obviously not the best place to go if you are vegan/vegetarian. But definitely a good starter spot for some cocktails and snacks.

My boyfriend & I were visiting Pittsburgh for the first time and were looking for a brunch spot on Saturday around 1. Thanks to the awesome Yelp community, I came across Meat & Potatoes & quickly landed on having brunch here. My boyfriend had the brisket & I had the omelette of the day; both were delicious! So glad we stumbled upon this super cute place (service was fast too--maybe it was the time of day?!).

The food was tasty.  The lighting was a bit dark for my taste, but the food made up for it.  We ordered the "meat and potatoes" dish for 2...and it should have come with a disclaimer.  A Flintstones sized steak came out that covered most of the table, accompanied by like 4 steak fries.  Next time I'll go with 4 people, order one of these and a few sides.   Yum,

I have to thank my son and his wife for turning me onto this gem of a restaurant. They have great service and great food. It's best to call and make a reservation in advance, especially on Fridays and weekends..I love their Muscles with curry sauce . The steaks are excellent and I haven't had anything there I didn't like. The menu is sophisticated but not overwhelming. The staff has always been accommodating and willing to help with selections or nutritional preferences. If you have a date this is the place to go for dinner then a movie. I think you'll like the Outcome. If not, he or she was not for you.

Had a reservation, which is a must. The place was packed and everything is cramped, which is the biggest down side to the restaurant. Cocktails were pricey, but delicious. Food was awesome, everything was delicious.

This one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh. The menu features a variety of interesting options and changes on a regular basis. Their brunch is also one of the best in town. The chicken and waffles is amazing and the breakfast cocktails are unique and different.

Such a big fan of Meat & Potatoes. Definitely get reservations or arrive early to reserve a spot at the bar. The food is wonderful. Service isn't the best, but the food is so great. I really need to try their brunch sometime...

Lots of locally sourced food in a busy setting. The tables are close together. Service was very good and the cocktails are not to be missed. The pouting was adequate and the pork belly tacos are delightful. Reminded us of Founding Farmers in DC and is about half the price. Great find in Pittsburg.

The wait was definitely worth it.  We've been meaning to come here for the longest time. You either need to walk-in and hope you can find an open table or make a reservation weeks and sometimes even months in advance. While I hate planning my dinner plans that long ahead - I craved and made my RSVP 3 weeks in advance for a date night thru Yelp.  They have an option of indoor and outdoor seating. But since it was somewhat of gloomy evening - we chose to sit inside. The seating area especially those for 2 are very close to each other but not too close to bother us. The place is dimly lit and it can be at times be pretty noisy. They have the regular menu and a special of the day menu that includes few starters, drinks, main course and desert that are specially priced for the day.  We started with a dark and stormy for the lady and a draft beer that was on special. For the starters, we went with their famous Bone Marrow and Fried Pig Ears. Since my lady doesn't eat Beef - I devoured the Bone Marrow on my own including some Fried Pig Ears. I must say, I was a bit disappointed with the Bone Marrow. Although delicious - it just wasn't as good as I had hoped for or perhaps my expectation was just too high. I would probably skip the Bone Marrow next time. The Fried Pig Ears dipped in sweet chili sauce was really good though.  For our main course, I went with the Hudson Valley Duck Breast and she got the Salmon. The medium rare duck breast was juicy and delicious and had a certain sweet flavor to it. Not something I would recommend pairing with the Bone Marrow. The salmon was however a different story. They are absolutely delicious and the combination with black rice, kimchi, korean hot sauce and fried egg was just perfect. I can't recommend the salmon high enough.  The service was just as good.  We will definitely be coming back.

The dinner menu is limited and, in my opinion, somewhat overpriced. Well known for its fancy cocktails. The name seems a misnomer because the dishes are prepared with some "creativity" which generally work but seem an end unto themselves by being different than standard.

First impression at the front door are the hostesses. Regretfully for this restaurant they must not have ever learned that first impressions are everything and these people at the front door are obnoxiously rude. Despite my better judgement I have eaten here three times despite this fact. Each time was about an average to below average experience. The food is good for the most part with exception to the poutine. It was very disappointing. They basically brought us french fries with cheese on top which is not poutine. The service is normally slow. One of our visits was on my birthday and the waiter spilled drinks all over myself and my wife. The manager did comp us a round of drinks, but in my opinion he should have comped us anything except the cheapest part of our bill. Unfortunately for this place they will be missing out on my business. Good food, bad service and not worth the wait. C-.

Was sitting there for more than 20 minutes while we had our reservation a week ealier. After seated was told the big ribeye was sold out?primary reason we came here?. Service was OK, food was delicious but not as good as expected

Meat & Potatoes is practically legendary in Pittsburgh.  This restaurant is within the Cultural Trust building that contains a parking garage, the backstage bar, and the Cabaret Theater.  It is usually crowded so definitely make a reservation if possible.  My friend and I came here as a celebration, and we ordered quite a bit of food.  We started with the Tartare ($16) and Short Rib Flatbread ($12).  We needed some instructions with the Tartare because we had no idea how to eat it.  We ended up ordering pita to it with it, but the server could have done a bit more explaining when asked.  The flatbread, however, was unique and delicious.  It had the rib meat, bleu cheese, and a sweetness to it.  For dinner, I ordered the Parpadelle ($18), which was FANTASTIC.  I eat very little meat in general, but the meat here is flawless.  It is so perfectly tender and amazing.  The pasta and sauce were delicious as well.  Absolutely recommend.  My friend ordered the duck breast ($18), which was also delicious!  I know most people come here and get the giant cow thing, but I am not into meat enough to order that.   We finished off our meal with some kind of Creme Brule dessert thing.  It was served in a mason jar and also had hints of chocolate.  It was just ok and really lacked any distinct flavor.  We did not even eat half of the dessert between two of us.  So why is this place not perfect?  The lovely ambiance is ruined by tables that are too close together.  You can barely move and forget having much of a conversation with anyone you are out to dinner with.  The worst part is that you are so close that the people next to you will try to jump into your conversation.  It's basically family style seating, which is so not my scene.  While the food is fantastic, I am unlikely to return unless I want to sit alone at the bar.

They seemed to have increased the brunch prices across the board (at least the last time I was there). One of the best things about this place was its affordability, and it's just a bit more expensive now. Still a solid menu, and still a relatively inexpensive brunch option in Pittsburgh.

We visited Meat and Potatoes while in Pittsburg, this place was awesome!!! Drinks were great, service was awesome and food was delish!   This restaurant has a really cool vibe, it is casual dress but still feels fancy. My husband always eats here when is is town for business and I was thrilled he brought me!   This is a must try when in the burg!

The 45 oz ribeye is about 20 oz of fat. Pretty much a disaster. The atmosphere is great, but the staff are about as aloof and condescending as anywhere in Pittsburgh. This is the prototypical place where they want you to thank them for allowing you to eat there. Great atmosphere, ok food, horrible people.

The food is so good here! The duck and salmon was delicious. The service was outstanding! Very friendly and helpful! I'd definitely come back! A great experience! The corpse reviver #2 was the drink for us but we went ahead and tried 3 different ones all pretty good!

Downtown Pittsburgh here I come to get me a little bit of meat potatoes! Great location awesome atmosphere, nice vibe, great Decour, great service and amazing food! Some very trippy presentations that are very pleasing to the eye when you see them at the table you just have to try them!

Our food was quite good, but the ambiance left a bit to be desired. The restaurant seemed like it couldn't decide what it was trying to be. The music was too loud, and the bar scene too overpowering for a cozy meal with friends.

Got the pleasure of going to Meat and Potatoes for brunch last Saturday.  You definitely want to make a reservation.  We got one at 1030 when they open, and by the time we left the place was packed!  We all had the bloody Mary bar, which was fabulous!  You can pick from an assortment of tequila, vodka or gins that are all house made with chills, bacon and all sorts of flavors.  Then they have a counter full of everything you could want to make a delicious bloody Mary.  Everyone ordered something different.  I had the Huevos Rancheros.  It was excellent!  I ate the whole thing!  Yummy tortilla layers with beans, salsa, eggs, and cheese!  Others at the table got breakfast sandwiches, that looks amazing and if you are really hungry, the chicken and waffles which was enough for 4 people!  We also got some fries to share that come with a yummy truffle mayo!  I highly recommend the Brunch!
Went there with a friend on my visit to Pittsburgh. Put it on my list of places to try after seeing it on Travel Channel. All I have to say is wow. Great food great place. Bone marrow is a must try.
Great service and food. It's like a speakeasy but not all douched up. The drinks are amazing and the bone marrow is delicious.

We did brunch here. It fills up quickly, so either get to the bar right when they open or have a reservation very far ahead of time. We got the Brisket Hash and Stuffed French Toast. Both were phenomenal and very (almost too!) generous portion sizes. Great flavors with unique twists on breakfast classics. Food came out quickly. Service was very pleasant. They also have a Bloody Mary bar that we can't wait to try next time.

Had heard rave reviews about Meat &  Potatoes, so decided to give it a try.  We went in on a Tuesday night without reservations.  While there seemed to be a few open tables, we were told it was an hour + wait if we didn't have reservations, but fortunately there were three open spots at the bar (went with two colleagues).  Food wise (both selection and quality) I'd say it was very good, worth visiting.  Service on the other hand was slow.  It took awhile for the bartender to take our order, and it was a bad sign when he returned to ask us for it again (and still didn't get it right...but to his credit, they comped the dish that he forgot and brought out late).    Some of the dishes...  -The Mac & Cheese with Chorizon and Pulled Pork was good (though I think Butcher and the Rye does it much better) -The Mushroom Risotto was also tasty.  As a side note, either of these "small plates" is a meal by itself -The fried brussel sprouts were amazing...a MUST! -The "fried tater tots" are french fries.  And a VERY generous portion.  We were expecting tater tots, so just want to make sure I mention it's really fries...and again, A LOT of fries -One colleague ordered a barbecue porkchop, which was bigger than him.  But he said it was good (though hard to finish after sharing the brussel sprouts and fries) -My other colleague ordered a caesar salad, which looked very unique...it had a fried egg, calamari and I think pork belly  Overall, good, will likely be back (though would give Butcher and the Rye the edge after a first visit to each)

I thought this was a fine place--the room is lovely, the food is well presented, there is a lot of energy while still not so noisy you can't have a good conversation, solid professional service.  One of my girls picked out Meat and Potatoes when I was visiting, and this was a great choice.  Six of us had a great table, round and good for conversation, in a corner of the room with a nice view of the restaurant; the bar looked like a nice place to sit for a casual meal.  The duck breast was outstanding and looked nice on the plate, others had the chicken and the meatloaf and a couple other things and everyone was very happy.
