Everything we had was delicious! We ordered some devils on horseback, which I actually have never had before, and they were perfect! The dates were stuffed with chorizo and I was really surprised that there were not greasy in the slightest. We also got and order of brussel sprouts and smoked wings, both of which were satisfying. Knowing how amazing the tartare is at Butcher, I had to try it out at M&P. I really did like it. However, it may have been my least favorite of the appetizers. The Asian inspiration was not for me. i felt like I was eating a tuna tartare instead of my beloved steak! While I love both of them, it isn't a love that is equal by any means. The drinks were good and the bartenders were very impressive with how attentive they were! I was extremely happy overall with out meal.

Went here for brunch on Sunday morning. Definitely need to make a reservation before coming as it was jam packed. I ordered the Nashville hot chicken and waffles and they we're amazing. 4-5 pieces of crispy fried chicken over a delicious waffle with hot sauce and maple syrup. One of the best renditions of this I've ever had. Wife had blueberry and lemon pancakes and she loved every bite. They also have one of the best Bloody Mary bars in town. We will be back in the future to try out other options that they have.

The words Brunch and Meat & Potatoes go hand-in-hand.  Think you'll stop in on a Sunday morning and just "grab a seat"? Think again! You better call well in advance for those seats and have a res, and you'll be glad you did.  I've only ever been to M&P for brunch, but have been there several times. Each time I've ended up getting one of the specials as my meal, and I've never been disappointed, but have enjoyed some more than others. The cinnamon bun-fantastic and sticky! The Benedict special-it rotates and you should always get it!  Now for the drinks. The coffee is always hot and almost constantly refilled by their staff who are very attentive. Now there is also a magnificent Bloody Mary bar as well. This thing has everything and more that you could ever hope for your Bloody Mary--bacon, shrimp, celery, and...grape leaves! It's basically a meal in itself.  If this place isn't on your list of places to go, then add it immediately.
This place is sooooo good omg!!!! I dream about the bone marrow. The meat is so tender it just falls off the bone. Can't wait to come back!!! Prob best steak I've had

So on this visit to Pittsburgh, I had two places on my "eat at" list - Cure + Meat and Potatoes. I ended up making reservations at Cure for Sunday Dinner and was lucky enough to arrive 20 mins after Meat and Potatoes opened for their Saturday night trade and since it was early enough, was fortunate and scored a lovely table on the patio.  I gotta say first up, my server was AWESOME!! I was a bit indecisive with the menu (there were so many good choices!) and he was really patient and listed options.  I ended up getting the chicken liver entree and the Crispy Pig ear sandwich which was on the daily specials list.   So thoughts on my liver - it was delicious and so so creamy, almost like pate... but...but for me, the accompanying sauce and breading was too aggressively seasoned. So let me explain - I wanted the liver to stand on it own, but because the breeding was so robust and spicy, I felt the lovely pate like taste and texture of the tender liver was lost. Similarly the accompanying sauce also had an assertive taste and when I dipped my liver into the chipotle remoulade, the delicacy of the liver was lost. I feel this dish could do with some more refinement- I almost wanted something more creamy as my accompanying sauce than the remoulade currently listed on the menu.  For my other dish, first I just want to list the ingredient list for my Crispy Pig Ear sandwich and #5 in particular had me most curious: 1) Grilled ramp BBQ  2) Apple slaw 3) Hazel nuts 4) Pecorino 5) Foie gras mayonnaise  6) Paprika Hot & Sour Fries 7) Ciabatta  So I grew to like this sandwich more as I progressively ate into it - my first bite wasn't all there and frankly the pig ear piece I got was a touch too crispy but as the apple slaw and the pecorino cheese mixed with the lusciousness of the foie gras mayonnaise, this sandwich really came into it's own. The accompanying string fries too were great and all together it was really quite good! Then the taste of the occasional hazelnut would pop up and it would turn very earthy.   So overall definitely an interesting meal and for sure I will come again to try some of the other menu items.  Yelp Review 49/2017
It was the pig ears on the salad that totally grossed me out... yuck.
A great meal - started with the bone marrow, enjoyed the pork chop and flat iron. Everything was perfectly seasoned and the root to berries cocktail was delicious! Definitely worth a wait.
If you go, you must get the bone marrow. Drinks are solid. As far as a date place, probably not the best choice as it's extremely loud and crowded.

My boyfriend and I went here for an impromptu dinner on his birthday. I was able to make reservations at 3PM for 8PM that night (Thursday).  It was really busy and I am glad I made the reservation. I also used OpenTable on my phone so that was also a huge plus for me.  The inside of the restaurant is great - a very high-end barn feel if that makes sense. My boyfriend had the bone marrow for an appetizer - I don't like bone marrow, but he said it was phenomenal.  The mac n' cheese was delicious! The drink menu was very interesting - I highly suggest you tell the bartender what kinds of flavors you like and he will make you an amazing drink that suits your taste.  The desserts were served (and baked) in small mason jars. Cute & practical. The key lime pie was to die for. It was very tart with a vanilla crumble bottom crust. Perfection.

I've never had a bad meal at this place.  They have so many different things to choose from, and the menu changes every so often which only adds to the variety.  The service is always excellent.  Definitely need to make a reservation though.  They have a comfortable waiting area outside the dining room, along with outdoor seating that's super cute during nice weather.  The pork belly tacos were unreal, and they had an eggnog pana cotta for the holiday's that was to die for.  Meat & Potatoes is probably my favorite place in downtown Pittsburgh.  I hear they have a killer brunch, but I haven't tried it yet!

I'm not sure what the hype is about. Ordered the pub burger to go and the lady on the phone couldn't even explain to me what is in it. She was friendly and nice but....I was confused. She said pork but not beef so I expected only pork. I'm glad that beef was in it but it was too cooked. Also, I noticed that ingredients were missing like the fried egg. And where was the horseradish cheddar? The fries were also extremely salty. I'm bummed cuz I really wanted an awesome burger but I think a fast food joint burger would have been SO much better.

Love it. My friend and I came on weekday evening and were welcomed very sweetly by the hostesses. The food along with the prices are pretty straight forward. We went for a bunch of snacks and one appetizer to split. We had the mac n cheese (amazingly decadent and would definitely order again), poutine (fries were a bit burnt BUT anything tastes good when it's smothered in gravy), bone marrow (largest portion I've come by), mussels in their beer sauce (huge portions and it's a MUST), and their soft shell crab tacos ( we could've done without this, it was way too sweet for my liking).     The staff was really helpful and pleasant and the ambiance was romantic minus the view. We sat outside on the patio and it would've been perfect except for the view of people waiting for the bus and the traffic line up. Not so romantic haha. If they could just put a nice wall of green shrubbery/bamboo to block that out, it would do wonders to the place.
Good food. Cocktails were good too. The Old fashion was a little watered. But overall really good. Would definitely come back to sample other food items.
This has easily become my new favorite restaurant for a fancy night out. Top of the line food and amazing service

Ooooh this place.  My husband and I went here for our anniversary. First off, the place is LOUD. It's not the place for a quiet candlelit dinner, be forewarned. It was a Tuesday night and it was packed, so have a reservation. The decor is very interesting and edgy.  So anyway, our server tells us the specials. He describes a steak that sounds good, I say I want that. The other steaks on the menu are $25-30 so I figure it's something around that. I get the steak, it's amazing, every bite melts in my mouth. The potatoes with it are also delicious (though I wish there had been more, there was basically a decorative amount of potatoes). Then we split a baked chocolate mousse for dessert which was equally delicious. Service was excellent and attentive throughout.  Then we got the bill. That damn amazing steak was $56. $56! $56!!! I had to laugh (to keep from crying). Now, I'm a frugal person, and I usually don't fall for well-known consumer trickery tactics like the "special with no price" but they caught me off guard on this particular night since my husband had encouraged me to "go with the flow" after I had lamented the $12 cocktails we ordered earlier at a nearby bar. Here I was trying to carpe the diem and I end up picking the most expensive dish in the world. HA!  I'm just glad it really was the best steak I ever had.

Got lucky and managed to get a reservation for 545 on a Saturday earlier in the week and the earlier dinner time was totally worth it. Interesting and diverse menu, food was excellent, and service was excellent.

Bob and I went here for their brunch a few days after we went for the first time. (I guesstimate some Sunday in November...just never got around to writing the review.)  Chicken and Waffles: Amazing, if not even a little intimidating. M&P takes a new twist on a Southern classic with three huge pieces of fried chicken, jalapeno/cheddar Belgian-style waffles and a bourbon-bacon maple syrup, which was still hot when it came to the table. It was so much food, I could not finish it at the table. Even better reheated the day after.  Huevos Rancheros: Now, Bob and I make this dish at home all the time. For those of you that are unfamiliar, it's a baked/grilled or fried corn or flour tortilla, top it with meat  (chorizo or in M&P's case...chunks of pork), top it with a sunny side up egg or two, a mound of cheese and some ranchero sauce. It's like a Mexican breakfast wrap on steroids. And it's damn good. M&P did not disappoint, and they made it prettier. It was an amazing tower of Mexican flavor explosion.  Ambiance/Atmosphere: We got there right when they opened. We were first in line, and while I'm bad a judging if you need reservations at any place, we were LUCKY we got in. We made a point to be there before they opened, just in case...and we were glad we did. The place filled up in about 15 minutes after we got seated. Service was amazing, and the waitstaff really took care of each other and made sure every aspect of the dining experience was covered. I dropped my spoon from my coffee (which was good!) by accident and 2 seconds later they'd replaced it. Even the owner of M&P was there, helping out and serving. I like that.  Things we didn't try but should have: Red Velvet Pancakes. They also had a Bloody Mary Bar, but considering I don't like tomato juice, it didn't impress me. Really wanted an Old Canadian, but considering it was early, I didn't feel proper doing it.  Will go there again, for realz.

Monday night around dinner time and the wait for a table for 2 was hours! Make a reservation. Luckily there were 2 spots open at the bar which ended up being a ton of fun. 3 men and 1 woman behind the bar, 2 guys ended up taking care of us most of the night. They not only served us well but were friendly and talkative, giving genuine recommendations and sharing funny stories.   Ordered a glass of Prosecco for myself and a whiskey drink for my boyfriend, very good. Started with the tartar, spicy but delicious. Then came pate -amazing- and then devils on horseback. Also a little hot but very good. The bone marrow was excellent and the toppings with it were great. Once we got halfway through the bone marrow the bar tender told us we had the option to do "luge shots"  of Jameson out of them once we finished. We happily complied and were given bibs to protect our shirts. Lots of fun. We got the tuna ceviche for dessert which was just the right combination of light and sweet and salty and savory and we finished the night off with a shot of Fernet Branca.   Not cheap and unless you want to risk finding a seat at the bar, plan ahead. But a wonderful place, gorgeous decor, friendly and knowledgeable staff, and amazing food.

We enjoyed the fantastic food and fun atmosphere while visiting Pittsburgh.  We didn't order the fried brussels at first but had to get an order when we saw them delivered to the table next to us.  We were glad we did...they were delicious!  My husband is on a no carb diet so he substituted collard greens for the carb that came with his dish and proclaimed them to be the best he's ever tasted.  I had the Wagyu flat iron which was perfectly prepared and the accompaniments were delicious.  Would love to try their brunch.  Wish we lived closer!

this place is hip and awesome. i am picky about what restaurants try to sell me and all they are selling is awesome. food took a little bit to come out but was worth the wait. polite and helpful bartenders and a spot-on atmosphere.

The steak was just perfect and delicious, juicy as it can be. The servers were so friendly and deserts were nothing but fantastic. The reservation is highly recommended if you have a party of 3 or more people.

It was a while ago that I was here, but I remember that the food was good, and the service was excellence. Went there before a show, was with a group, and they sat us in a room to ourselves. Overall a great experience would go back.

I was really excited to eat here and have heard good things from a few people. I took my boyfriend for his bday and we ordered fried pig ears, grilled bread, and the 45 oz ribeye.   First off, the fried pig ears came out in a red/white striped French fry basket you'd see at a fair. Not the presentation I was looking for. Also thought they were way overpriced. The bread was okay. Nothing too fancy about some toasted bread.   The steak on the other hand was huge! Great presentation. We ordered it topped with truffle butter which I loved, but my boyfriend wasn't a fan of. We also ordered a side of scalloped potatoes and they were bomb! The steak was extremely fatty though. Overall, I would say most of the weight in the steak came from the bone that was attached and the fat. There wasn't a whole lot of meat to it.   All in all, I would say that meal wasn't worth almost $150. The steak is more of a once in a lifetime thing just to say you ordered a 45 oz steak. We probably won't be going back, but it was a decent date night.

I've been here many times now, and I'm never let down.  The service is always great, love their beer selection, and the BF has vouched for their cocktails.  I've been trying endlessly to replicate their white truffle risotto - it's to die for!  I definitely prefer their dinner menu to their lunch menu, but I have never been disappointed here.  I came here with my family from Chicago recently, and they seemed to really enjoy it as well.

We were in the mood for PROTEIN tonight so headed to meat and potatoes to find it.  Definitely a bumping place at 7 pm on Friday.  A bit too noisy for me to eat dinner, this place is probably better as a happy hour joint.  The chairs = very comfortable.  BUT you have to lean forward in them to be heard in this place.      MUSSELS OF THE DAY- traditional type.  These were tasty BUT I KNEW these were gonna be salty when we ordered and I was right.  I am feeling dehydrated hours later as I write this.  I prefer my mussels cooked in sauce that is more drinkable so you can sop it up.      PUB BURGER- I suppose there was no living up to the fantastic burger I had earlier this week at Burgatory.  This burger was a sad burger in comparison.  Not really to my liking, a little too soggy and lacking in tomato.  The fries were good, crispy and hot.      WAGYU FLAT IRON- My companion claims this was not real wagyu.  Overall it won a rating of "OKAY" from him but for 28 dollars, an okay is pretty sad.  Probably will not be back.  Food didn't leave a great impression and neither did our waitress who seemed a little pissy!
One of my favorite restaurants. The ambience, the service, and the food are all perfect. I've never had a bad experience here. Always delicious, always consistent.

We come here for date nights and love the ambience. We always order the meat for two which is a 34oz slab of meat with a side of bone marrow and potato wedges, plus a glass of red wine and you have the best meat and potatoes in town.

I sat at the bar to have some dinner. Ordered the hanger steak which was about $26. It was cooked medium rare like i instructed. It was served over some potatoes Brussel sprouts. My disappointment was that it was cold. The cold steak made it crewy and difficult to eat. I took 2 bites and told the waiter that the steak was cold and i was  not happy. He told me well its really cold in here so you kinda have eat it quick... What? I wont come back here. I cant believe i was served a COLD steak
Amazing. The food was beyond expectation and the service is top notch. Nice beer selection and cocktail list.

This place is a must try when in Pittsburgh. The restaurant is little hard to find and do whatever in your power to find it and your pallet will thank you.   I showed up for dinner on Monday night around 7 pm and the place was packed. Grab a seat at the bar and grabbed few beers from the happy hour menu. Both beers very very interesting and I must admit I chose them based on their name (porkslap pale ale and raging bitch Belgium ale). The bartender working that night was very knowledgeable about the bar and food menu and helped me made my dinner selection.   Potato gnocchi with dirty duck ragu is what I have chosen and I couldn't been happier. The plate came out perfect, gnocchi were mixed with duck and braised in the most delicious and flavorful juices. The center of the plate was dressed with a soft boiled egg made perfectly. I  have enjoyed every single bite and if it was socially acceptable I would lick the plate.   Overall I always have great meals when I am in Pittsburgh but this one stood a mile above the rest including the bartender man who shows up with the most positive attitude.

My second trip and took my family for brunch on a weekend.  The food was terrific and very flavorful.  The had a DJ playing and it had a great vibe.  The only reason not 5 stars is it is very loud with really tight seating.  Overall great experience.

A nice place for datenight meeting  friends for happy hour or just mingle..the food is super good .. They have a dinner for 2 on the menu that you and ur boo can create .. Also you have to try there smoked wings OMG!!! Super yummy..  So check this place out my yelpers

Bloody Mary bar was much better than others I've been to.  We had the Bruscetta with wild mushroom ragu and a nouveau take on Eggs Benedict... poached egg over sweetbreads, with shrimp and pork cheeks. Very tasty.  The only problem was how close we sat to other guests. Didn't really want to be a part of their conversations.

Celebrated our annual girlfriend gift exchange here. We hot the private room in the front of the restaurant. Our server was excellent! We had a large group and we all needed separate checks. He was polite, friendly and attentive. I ordered the mushroom risotto to start, the flavor was delicious! Very creamy and full of mushroom flavor. I would have preferred the actual risotto to be softer it was firm but everyone seemed to enjoy it. For main entree I had the steak rare. It was cooked perfect, has great flavor and was melt in your mouth good. The prices here are on the high side but the food quality is high. The cocktails menu is great and they have a awesome brunch. I would give a 5 star if the menu was expanded a bit more with more fish options. But then again it is named meat and potatoes for a reason.

One of the best meals my wife and I ever had.  This is my first time in Pittsburgh and our taxi driver recommended the place. I wasn't sure whether to trust him and I had not seen any reviews or ratings.  Huge portions and a good variety.  I had tge salmon and my wife the pork chop, which was a double. We also ordered the hummus appetizer and fried Brussels.  We had drinks.  I had the Manhattan and it was terrific.  We'd come back again.
Excellent. Great food. I especially liked their ma and cheese. The wait staff was wonderful. One of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh

It was ok, alot of my friends talk about how good this place is, but I went it was packed. You sit so close to everyone very unfortable to be honest. The burgers were so dry. It was so disappointing. I always want to give this place a second chance but then I think about the seating and really don't care to come back. I don't like being packed into a resturant like a sardine.

Great food and atmosphere. I split the 34 oz ribeye, bone marrow and potatoes with my wife and it was amazing. Good quality steak that was a perfect medium rare, medium. Enjoyed a few beers and cocktails as well. This place is ideal for a business dinner, or date night. I hear their brunch is phenomenal as well. I'll be back!

The wagyu flat iron was indeed delicious. That alone can get 5 stars from me. the kobe corn dog was good but nothing outrageous. The fried taters were ok. You get a huge bowl if you order them...enough for two. Garlic all over them. Their selection is better at lunch vs. dinner it seems.

The name alone does it for me. I had high expectations and they delivered. My friend set up a brunch on a Saturday at noon and the place was bumping with people. We were promptly seated - there were 5 of us. I didn't even notice the portions other people had at their table, but I was about to be surprised.  I got the Lavender drink, which was pink and bubbly with a good combination of sweet/tart. Then I ordered fried taters with a truffle mayonnaise. We all shared those and they were gone in a split second. Super delicious! Someone else got house-made granola and I only tried a spoonful, but the dish was ginormous.  For the main dish I ordered chicken and waffles. Before I knew it, what looked like a whole freakin' chicken was in front of me with waffles and a bourbon bacon syrup...which I accidentally spilled all over the table. I was kind of mortified even though the waiter was like "Psh, you're fine!" and got me another side of syrup. Everything was really, really good. I need to go back and eat everything!

Disappointed.  I was so excited to finally try Meat & Potatoes and it failed to live up to what I hoped it would be.  First off the ambiance was fantastic, I  loved the decor and the feel of the restaurant.  I thought it was modern and inviting.  My table of 4 got a bad break to begin with being seated right by the patio door.  Normally I don't think this would've been a huge issue, but it was almost 100 degrees outside.  The door was constantly being open and shut and it really made the two of us closest to the door extremely hot (how did people eat outside!).    We started with some cocktails, and they were all fantastic.  The Corpse Reviver was the standout of the group and I recommend it highly.  After perusing the menu for a bit, myself and someone at our table decided to split the Meat & Potatoes for 2.  It is a 34 oz Ribeye, Steak Fries and Bone Marrow.  Doing the math we figured that this would be plenty of food for two people, thus we only got the Grilled Bread with Goat Butter and Jam to start, it was very good and the jam was fantastic.    We were very wrong when we thought it would be plenty of food for two people, especially two men.  It might have been a 34 oz ribeye if they count the 2 foot bone sticking out of the ribeye because it definitely wasn't enough for two people.  We ordered our ribeye medium and it came out really rare, we are talking barely warm in the middle rare.  I can usually understand not getting the steak completely correct, but I've almost never been served a piece of meat as off as this one was.  Instead of cooking us a new one, they cooked the pieces we had already cut off and what was left on the bone and brought it back out.  I understand this because it was an expensive piece of meat I'm assuming, but still was a little off putting.  The fries and bone marrow were nothing special in my mind.  Neither one was especially flavorful or memorable.    We then skipped desert because of the heat radiating from the constant open doorway next to us and called it a night.   Maybe I'll give Meat & Potatoes another chance, but it's definitely not somewhere I'll be running back to.  UPDATE:  After going back a couple more times and eating lunch there I'm upping my review to 4 stars.  Their lunch menu is fantastic, and I would recommend it highly.

Great atmosphere.  Meat&Potatoes has the best and the most interesting cocktails in town (and they are consistent at that!).  The food was superb - she had the agnoletti, and I the pappardelle (bolognese), which was much improved from the first them I had it.  On the downside, their facilities (washrooms shared with the cabaret club next door) are below par and simply do not go with the rest of this place.  The solution they used to have was much better.  So, one star less.

Pros: Food is excellent - we got a pub burger and a chicken sandwich and were really pleased with it.  Cons: short alcohol list/few beers on draft, the prices seemed a little ridiculous even for being an upscale downtown restaurant, the atmosphere was stuffy and not very warm or welcoming.

Meat & Potatoes has really yummy food.  My husband and I tried the specialty mushroom risotto, bone marrow flat bread, mushroom flatbread and the salmon.  They were all delicious.  This restaurant reminds of me a similar restaurant in Los Angeles that Iron Chef Mario Batali owns, called Mozza.  I must say, the server kept making mistakes with our food and brought out things that we didn't order, but that wasn't a big deal.  We loved this place and can't wait to go back.

I've been giving a lot of five star reviews lately, but truly on the driving vacation I was on, I managed to stumble on a bunch of really excellent stops...thanks to Yelp.  Truly innovative menu and perfect execution of the dishes.  Service was outstanding.  Recommended, the bone marrow appetizer, really special.  The "pork" on the main menu was a massive double cut, brined and smoked pork chop that was just amazing.

Oh Meat & Potatoes. You've done a fine job at luring me into your eclectic dining and bar space. I can't seem to stop myself from wandering back in. The dimmed lights and delicious mixed drinks are two of the reasons I'm cool with you. And the menu is as adventurous as my soul. There's always something new, different and borderline questionable on the menu so there's never a dull moment.   One big turnoff however is the tight quarters we diners and drinkers have to be in.  Although I put up with it, it's always awkward when I'm standing at the bar and my behind is bumping into the backs of diners' beautiful heads. Apologies are being given out as often as drinks are being poured.   With that being said, my favorite part is watching the show being performed behind the bar.  The bar tenders are true artists creating drinks worth writing home about. They are unique and delicious and I can never just get one. Well done!  So, Meat & Potatoes, although you're small inside and I have to endure more awkward moments in one night than anyone should in a year, I will be back.

Best Manhattan I have ever had! No joke!  This place is a great spot in downtown Pitt. The location is very well done in a modern gastropub format but in a old location. The service is really great.   Max and cheese- so cheesy and delicious- worth trying   Had the wagu + lobster & also grilled cheese.   Everything was spot on and the flavor was outrageous "! Only complaint is everything was not hot just luke warm. The flavors made up for it by a mile and the presentation was perfect. More than you expect for the price.

Absolutely love this place for brunch! Love the bloody Mary bar and all the ingredients and the infused vodkas!! My husband and I have tried so many of the brunch options. My personal two favorites are the bruschetta and the huevos rancheros! Its our top spot for brunch!!!! Highly recommend it!

This restaurant is over the top good.  We had a large party, celebrating a birthday, and each and every one of us talked about our meals over and over again for the last several days.  Personally, we decided to order a bunch of appetizers to munch on versus a full meal.  We started with the fried pickles and mussels with beer broth.  The fried pickles were possibly the best I ever had with thick cut pickles and a delicious dipping sauce.  The mussels were very good, not my favorite, but very fresh tasting.  If I went back, I would try the curry broth which we heard was fantastic.  We then ordered the watermelon salad, short rib flat bread, wings and mac n' cheese.  Every item we ordered was amazing.  My favorites were the short rib flat bread and wings.  The short rib was so smoky and cooked to perfection.  The combination on the flat bread was mouth watering.  The wings were spicy and smoky at the same time.  I'm not a huge wing lover, but I would order these again and again.  Lastly, the drinks were amazing.  My fiance ordered the Pimms Blue Ribbon and it was very refreshing.  I ordered the daquiri and agree that it was a very light drink.    Everyone else around us ordered the pork chop, poutine, and a number of other appetizers.  The one that stood out was the pork chop which was cooked to perfection and had a delightful pancetta topping.  We all tried a bite and it was to die for!  All in all, an amazing experience!

Beware, this review may not be butterflies and unicorns.  I gave this place two tries. The first time was a better experience then the second, but was not excellent. There is hot competition around meat and Potatoes right now, so if you are visiting the city you may want to compare the restaurants around this one. You walk into a lobby. The restaurant basically took over the lobby and made it where the hostess stand is and where you can sit and wait. The restaurant itself is very very tall, but there is not very many tables, so making a reservation may be a good idea. We visited on a Friday night around 90pm. It was not busy, there were plenty of open table. The person with me had never been. When we got to the restaurant we walked in first to see if it was busy before we put our name in. When we went back to the hostess to put our name in, my friend said that we wanted a table near the bar, but not in another room. The hostess snapped back at her and said, "there is NOT another room. This is it!" The attitude was very uncalled for, however my stare at the girl was not. I digress, and wait to be seated because we were starving and I still wanted my friend to try the food. We get seated after waiting only 3 minutes. The seats were comfortable. Very cushioned, like living room seating. The server came over to us with in a couple minutes, she was very attentive through out. Now to make my review shorter then it could be, I will recommend food items that I have tried, things I would not. This is what a non beef eater orders at a meat and potatoes restaurant! Don't judge!  The fried pickles, they are cut thick and you are given 5 or 6 pieces with a side of dipping sauce. Tasted good, but being an app, it was quite small. Served in a literary a small fair French fried basket. Wasn't sure if I was to laugh or be disappointed.  The poutine was good, however it was served a little cold. Being that gravy cools quickly, maybe having it served in a higher bowl to contain the heat better. Just a suggestion. The apps are very small portions as well, being you are intended on sharing them, having them a bit bigger would be fab. The buffalo chicken Mac n chz. This was very creamy, not so cheesy. I was overwhelmed by the buffalo sauce. The sauce, not the spice. My friend said it was spicy, but for someone that likes the spice kick, this was just too "buffaloie". Not very original in a good way. This was also a small portion. Not was served with it.  My overall opinion is that this place is given way too much credit. The food is eh (there are better around). The price is holy mackerel. The portions are no bigger the your hand (put your hand out. They are NOT any bigger then that, mostly smaller). Nothing is served with the meals (at least the non steak ones). The atmosphere is cute, the chairs comfortable, the "server service" great, the front staff- immature and need etiquette class. If the owners don't start listening to the "little things" that people are having issues with, I can almost guarantee this place will be closed within the next one to two years. The competition is on fire.

Everything was fine, but not necessarily worth a repeat visit. Two of us went on a Friday night around 10:15 PM and were seated outside with no wait -- but there were still plenty of people around eating and enjoying, which was pleasant.   The staff was friendly and accommodating, and I can be a pain in the butt sometimes (gluten) so it was nice to feel taken-care of.   We ordered:  Bone marrow appetizer: delicious.  Waldorf Salad: surprisingly boring and iceberg lettuce-y, given the description on the menu. Tartare: meat was fresh, they had to leave a few things out for me because they were not gluten-free so it was missing a bit of something. They brought a sauce out for my dining companion and he said it made a big difference.  Hanger Steak entree: nothing wrong with it, but it didn't taste as interesting as the menu made it seem like it would be.   For a "we're hungry, let's grab a bite" it was fine but overpriced. Had we gone for a celebration meal, I would have left feeling disappointed.

Wow. Can we talk about Meat and Potatoes for a second? I went here for the first time last night (finally, I know, stop judging me). I had a mouthgasm. Simple as that.  Absolutely love the ambiance of the place - dark colors, dim lighting, jazzy music... it was just what we were looking for. The feel of this place is classy, but not uptight. The service was friendly, expedient, and professional - to the level of a five star restaurant, while still putting out a casual, relaxed vibe.   I started off with a "Turn the Beet Around" ...yes the song kept popping into my head throughout dinner, and yes I did dance in my chair while sitting. I love anything spicy so it was already looking up. Reposado, lime, orange liqueur, jalapeño, and beet syrup. It was quite an unusual winning combination. Smash together, fruity/spicy/a bit of savory, add tequila - and it just popped.  Next was the duck liver pâté. At first the sweetness of the sauternes jelly on top cuts through the more savory flavor of the duck, but it rounds out as you eat it, and has a nice savory finish. Its perfectly paired with a simple grilled bread (to which they gladly brought a refill).  Shortly after, came out the wild mushroom risotto. It was definitely good, the mushrooms were tasty, but I'm having trouble remembering details because of what came next!.......   The roasted chicken! It definitely stole the show, and I'm not afraid to say, it's probably the best thing I've eaten this year.  Served beside their yukon gold potatoes, adorned with roasted tomatoes, olives, and pine nuts, laid on a saffron butter sauce, and topped with fennel. This dish was clearly crafted by a true culinary artist. Besides the chicken being perfectly cooked and juicy, the way the flavors came together was just something I had never tasted before, and we just kind of sat there in awe/bliss until it was all gone.   I couldn't believe that we had drinks, appetizers, and dinner for two, at this quality for only $77. Last week I paid almost $200 for worse service and mediocre food at another place downtown. I must get back here asap.... I need that brunch in my life. See you soon!

Long story short, this place doesn't live up to their price. The establishment is fancy enough but weirdly integrated in the building that it inhabits, which causes some issues with their welcoming of patrons, their restroom location and their general state of apparent confusing entrance.  The smell of alcohol (although quality one from what I can see) is pungent to the point of annoyance, and speaks to a questionable ventilation. The decor is fancy without being overstated, yet the place is a little crowded creating a packed atmosphere that detracts from the elegant dining ambiance. The food itself is equally divided between uninspiring (their staple truffled potatoes and their burgers) to the good but incredibly pricey(the tartare was literally a couple of spoons for 14$ or so, although I must give them props for the very well put together presentation). The (almost) saving grace was the Flatbread, reasonably priced, sizeable if not generous, and cleverly balancing the fat of the charcuterie with the crispy dryness of the base. Thumbs up for our attentive server, who was informative and fast to refill our drinks.
The setting is very nice.The drinks were great and the food is amazing

Went to dinner before a show. I've been there a good number of times since their opening, but it's been about a year since my last visit. I was pleased that it still stood up to my previous visits. We order the squid ink tagliatelle pasta dish, and it was honestly spectacular. Their Brussels and grilled bread were good starters and they salty pig flat bread was as good as always. The only negative was that we ordered two more beers towards the end of our meal as waters, and we never got them, even after we asked twice.

Now that I've tried M&P about 5 times, I'm happy to report that it's another great addition to the Pittsburgh food scene. I've had dinner here a few times and was never disappointed. I've also tried the brunch which is, after Tamari's amazing new Sunday brunch, one of the best in the city (don't forget to save room for the all you can drink Bloody Mary bar).   I would have given them 5 stars, but I actually don't really love the ambiance. M&P gets a lot of the downtown pre-theater crowd and it always feels a bit too full. If you like the over-filled loud scene, you won't object, but that's just not for me. Regardless, the food is top notch!
the marrow was absolutely amazing. Turned my hubby into a convert.  Go and get the "meat butter". It is totally worth it. The rest of dinner was great as well.
Their brunch is the best I've ever had. The Bloody Mary Bar is everything.

I had kept this place bookmarked for the longest time and I finally got a chance to go here!  So lets start off by saying that It was okay.   The more I think about the meal the more I realize that I don't think I enjoyed it as much as I thought. The place itself was really nice but parking was a bit tough downtown at night. The atmosphere was definitely something different but it was quite crowded and noisy.  I actually loved the "snacks" that they had, we ordered buttermilk fried chicken livers and fried brussels. The livers were perfectly soft and the dip that it came with was perfect.  The brussels also came with a dip that I was pretty happy with as well.    For the main course we ordered a lamb burger and a korean reuben.  I thought  that the fusion was a creative idea but the execution was nothing spectacular.  The burgers also came with a bowl of fries and as a huge french fry fan I was delighted.  I liked the fries better than the reuben but my boyfriend didn't have a taste for them because they were a bit on the salty side.  They definitely didn't skimp on the portions like a lot of other pricier restaurants do which was a huge plus for me because I was working up an appetite.  They didn't have a menu for desserts but the waitress listed them off to us and none of them sounded particularly appetizing. As we were leaving I caught someone ordering a bone marrow and that looked like it was definitely worth trying!   TLDR: Meh, I'd go again but not anytime soon.

Good not great. Did not meet expectations. First the fried Brussel sprouts were yummy with lots of cheese and a pretty ho hum mayo sauce. Then we split the huge pork chop which took quite a long time to arrive. It was wonderful and cooked perfectly. Plenty for two!  A healthy portion of collards and beans but the greens were way too sweet but were cooked perfectly with some "tooth."  The beans were less than tender definitely undercooked. So the two sides were not very good. Would try again maybe mussels?  They looked interesting.
Interesting food, the bone marrow is delicious, just ask for extra toast. I've been with groups that rave about the duck. I'm a huge fan of the pork and beans.

I had not been to M&P since shortly after it first opened so when I chose a random Friday night I knew my bf would be in town, I booked a 9:30 reservation for the two of us. Parking is so convenient due to the Theater Square garage being in the same building. I forget the cost, but I do remember it was quite reasonable. We arrived a little early and our table wasn't ready yet so we sat on one of the couches in the lobby for a few minutes until we were taken back. The tables when you first walk in are a very tight squeeze, however, we were seated on the opposite side of the dining room, and I did not find the tables to be too tight together. We were not privy to our table neighbors conversations so there was a decent amount of space between each table.   Our server was very efficient and attentive without being intrusive. She quickly got us water and let us peruse the drink menu a bit further. My bf decided not to have a drink, which meant I had to have two-one for him AND one for me ;) The drinks were expertly made-I had a bourbon drink and a whiskey drink. They were very tasty and very strong, but I wasn't the one driving so bring it on! We started out with the Lobster mac and cheese. It was so creamy and the doritos crust really added a unique touch to the dish. There were several chunks of lobster mixed uniformly throughout. This was easily the best lobster mac I have had in quite some time, possibly ever! I totally wish I didn't have to share because I could have downed that dish in a few scoops just by myself, it was that good! The portion was a nice size as well, perfect for two. My boyfriend had the duck which was cooked PERFECTLY to a medium rare. It was melt in your mouth juicy, and I will absolutely order that dish on my next visit! I went with the short rib flatbread after reading rave reviews on that dish on Yelp. I was impressed-the bleu cheese was not overpowering and the short rib was so very tender and juicy. I liked the arugula on top as well-VERY tasty! I wanted to save room for dessert so I left one small piece behind.  I was disappointed they ran out of the pot de creme and the chocolate smores dessert, however, they had a red velvet cookie cake that was TO DIE for! I'm not even a red velvet fan and I'd totally order this again, although I am hoping next time they don't run out of the chocolate pot de creme. This was a stellar dining experience, from service to food to ambience. I will ABSOLUTELY return (and hopefully it's for brunch!)

I've been to Meat & Potatoes numerous times but this past weekend it was all about that...  BRUNCH BRUNCH BRUNCH!   Highlights: -Grapeleaves included at the Bloody Mary bar! The hot sauce variety is the best I've ever seen. -The Strawberry or Peach Bellini. -Fried taters with truffle aioli. Shut the front door. I wish I could eat this dish every day.   The experience: We had a group of 12 so we reserved the side room. To be expected, it's a bit loud but a must-have if you are attending with a large group. Our service was excellent. The waiter knew each dish, made perfect recommendations and was quick to notice when our beverages got low. The food runners we're also speedy and professional. We had one small incident with a loose coffee lid and a bit of hot brew landing on the back of my date but it was handled well and certainly didn't ruin our time there.   Food: I ordered the Shrimp & Grits, most of the table ordered the short rib hash (it's the most popular brunch item) and the rest of the dishes included the Pub burger, Bi Bim Bap, Huevos Ranchero, Eggs in purgatory and Chicken and Waffles. The Chicken and Waffles portion size made everything else seem like an appetizer! I thought that seemed a little inconsistent but that's not a huge complaint, I needed a to-go box for my meal and it was half the size! No major issues with any of the food. A bit of hot sauce needed for a few of the dishes but that's more personal preference than a stab at the quality of the food. I found my dish to be very rich, part of the reason I had to take the rest home. The flavor was wonderful, I only mention how rich it is so my fellow yelpers are aware.   The dining experience at Meat & Potatoes for lunch and dinner has long held a superb reputation and I am happy to report that their brunch experience is no different! You will not be disappointed!

Best place to eat downtown/cultural district area. Make sure that you make reservations tho! The roast beef was mouth watering, the duck was surprisingly delicious as well. They also have vegan options on the menu. Good atmosphere.

I'm so glad Meat and Potatoes finally got to meet my belly. Ha ha, dad jokes aside--I've had this place bookmarked for quiet some time now and glad I came here for dinner today! To start, we shared the pig ears. If you are hesitant about trying this, don't be! They came in shredded crispy bacon like presentation and was seasoned very well.   For the main meal, I got the pot roast, and the beef was absolute perfection: the gravy mix, butter, and some jarred pepperoncini peppers came together to make one delicious & tender pot roast! It's served on a bed of creamy mashed potatoes and garnish game is off the hook. For dessert, try the chocolate mousse! You won't regret it! I would definitely go back, if not for a full meal then just to sit at the bar, order a drink and the chocolate mousse!

oh, downtown pittsburgh, why can't you have more restaurants like this. absolutely delicious with a strong selection of brown booze. from veggies to fish to steak, meat & potatoes wow'd me.   my work takes me out of bounds rather frequently, and while for the most part, i don't mind it, what i do mind is being away from all the amazing options that my city, more specifically, new york city, has to offer. meat & potatoes has become my saving grace. wings, fish tacos, salmon, steak, pork chop... i haven't made a misstep yet. meat & potatoes, and its sister restaurant, butcher & the rye, are bright & shiny stars in a rather dark area, hopefully serving as a guiding light to other chefs looking to open restaurants downtown.   but alas, for now, until those other chefs find their way, you'll find me settled in at the bar here or across the street at butcher & the rye, happy & grateful for these bright and shiny stars.

Meat & Potatoes. The moment I saw this pop up on my Yelp app I knew I was going here regardless of the rating.   We had brunch here and next time I'm in town I plan to get dinner here. We had the sourdough french toast, fried chicken and waffles with cheddar and jalapeno peppers and bourbon bacon syrup. Splooge. Everywhere. For the price, the quantity and quality of the food they serve is unreal. Too bad I do not have two stomachs, because if I did, I would have ordered more. Every item on the menu was something I would order.  I ordered a black IPA but the waitress brought a regular IPA. This wasn't a huge deal for me, but when I asked her about it she said she would check on it. She never came back or offer to change it to what I ordered. I let the beer sit assuming she would switch it out but it just got warm and I drank it after realizing she either forgot or blew me off. Again, not a big deal, but this place would have been 5 stars if it weren't for that.

In the neighborhood for a show. This place didn't disappoint. We sat at the bar. All bartenders were friendly and helpful. We got a beet salad, bone marrow, and wings. This was hands down one of the best places for bone marrow we have been.
Always excellent food, cocktails,  & service. Make a reservation though because the bar can get very crowded and there is a long wait.

I had eaten here before, so I booked an alumni event here for roughly 40 people. I could not have been happier with the result: amazing food, delicious drinks and a fun, private atmosphere (back room). They even created a custom drink for us based on an Ohio bar's recipe. The restaurant was extremely accommodating and flexible with what we wanted for the event. I highly recommend booking a smaller event here for something casual yet sophisticated.

Meat & Potatoes is my favorite brunch spot in Pittsburgh! I highly recommend making reservations, especially if there is a show or game in town.  The first time my husband and I visited, we did not have reservations--but we arrived right when they opened; we were able get get seats at the bar., however, within 15 minutes of sitting down, there was not one seat left at the bar.  My husband and I both had a blood orange and caramelized pineapple Bellini-- it wasn't on the menu, but the bartender recommended it--simply delicious!   My Husband ordered the bacon, egg, and cheese biscuit special-- scrambled eggs, thick cut bacon, and cheese served on a giant homemade biscuit, with truffle mayo and a side of frittes. I had the omelette special, which had blue cheese and mushrooms, served with a side of their au gratin potatoes. Both meals were phenomenal!   My mom came with me on my next visit to M&P for brunch before we headed over to the Benedum to see a show. I made reservations a few weeks in advance, and I'm glad I did-- I overheard the hostess tell the party in front of us there would be a 1.5 hour wait!   We were seated upon arrival, and our waiter Shane was at our table in no time! My mom and I both opted for the Bloody Mary bar--we both had the garlic and black pepper infused vodka, and proceeded to top our bloody's with the amazing variety of toppings available. It's hard to believe the Bloody Mary bar is only $5!   For our meal, I had the BPLT and my mom got the Quiche of the day. My sandwich was delicious; this version of a simple classic had arugula, pastrami belly, thick cut bacon, ripe tomatoes, and truffle mayo all wedged between two pieces of grilled bread. I don't remember exactly what was in the quiche, but I think it had pork, peppers and scallions. It is served room temperature, which I found a little odd, but the flavors were amazing. It was served along side a house salad, which really balanced the dish nicely. We finished our meals with a cup if coffee, which was also delicious!  The service is impeccable, the drinks are fantastic, the food is stellar, and the manager stops to talk to the tables (which is a nice touch). I highly recommend stopping in for brunch in the very near future!

This is a beautiful restaurant with wonderfully crafted drinks, in house infused liquors and good service.  The drink production is a mini show and takes 10 minutes to get a beverage. Good or bad that's up to the individual.  The service was ok our waiter Josh appeared in the weeds and forgot to bring several ordered items.  We ordered fried chicken livers which were super crisp but cold bloody livers inside, sent the back and they refried the same order only to burn them and reserve. We sent them back only to find they were left on our bill and our waiter did not return after running our credit cards. My pastrami crusted duck was served on whole wheat spätzle, the spätzle was fried and burnt to the point where it had the consistency of pistachio shells (inedible).  The 34oz ribeye was beautiful but be prepared for a wait 45 minutes for medium (with a cold rare center on the bone). Time for a new cook in the kitchen.

We returned for brunch and good lord am I happy we did! If you don't make reservations at least a month in advance, then I suggest you arrive a half hour before they open to get your name on a list for seats at the bar. And sitting at the bar is super convenient because it's right beside the Bloody Mary bar. There are tons of pictures on here of this bad boy, and I saw several people taking pictures to show friends and family, but let me say, none of them does this Bloody Mary bar justice. You could seriously just order the bar and make a meal out of all the amazing toppings that are on the bar. (Don't do this though, people will probably sneer at you). But seriously it's fantastic! My only issue is that the mix to make the actual drink was really lacking in any flavor. It may have truly been just tomato juice as the Worcestershire, Tabasco, etc were all available on the bar. I was a little disappointed. At least make me a delicious bass that I can add a little or a lot of spice to and then lots of toppings. I'm all for a little DIY but let's draw the line somewhere. Now a not about the chicken and waffles. They are delicious, no doubt about it, but it is HALF OF A CHICKEN. No lie. Half of the entire chicken. I burst out laughing when they brought the plate out. I had enough leftover for 4 more meals (but not enough of that delish syrup!) so be forewarned.

holy garlic.. it was good but I am still tasting it today and so is my wife. She had the risotto and I had the Korean Reuben. The meat on the Reuben was excellent but it could have done without the overwhelming garlic especially if you plan on talking to anyone in the next 24hrs

A native of western PA, I came back to celebrate my Mother's 76th birthday with her and told her to choose a restaurant she would not driver herself to. She picked Meat and Potatoes and I have heard of it so I was pleased to give it a try. Today, I live in the Phoenix area where a food revival has been occurring for the last decade. This prohibition themed area is comfortable and bright. The mixologists at the bar have an array of magic at their fingertips. We asked for a specialty martini for Mom that was tasty and not too strong. He whipped up a raspberry citrusy take on the cosmopolitan for her that was bright and sweet and pink and delicious. I opted for my classic Belvedere martini with bleu cheese stuffed olives. Mom chose the duck breast and I had the lamb neck cassoulet. Both were extraordinary and huge! Luckily we chose not to have an appetizer so we filled ourselves and sipped a delish pinot noir from our friendly server Adam. The atmosphere is light with 1970s pop music playing of Elton John, Billy Joel and James Taylor and diners were businessmen, families with kids, theater goers and young people. I recommend this meaty, comfortable take on amazing food without any reservations.
Great place! The food is priced as it should be and the portions are generously applied.

Yikes! That's one huge hunk of meat! (That's what she said!)  Try the fried Brussels, they are awesome. The Meat & Potatoes for two is more like Meat and Potatoes for four. We're not petite people, but this was more than we could handle. Still, the bone-in ribeye was cooked perfectly. The marrow was kinda weird. Guess we just weren't that into it. The two classic cocktails I ordered (Negroni and Manhattan) were well balanced. My one complaint would be the service. The girls at the reception seemed lost and flustered, and one even commented that the software they were using was "dumb" (because she didn't know how to use it?). The tables are tiny, and they really pack you in there. It's a small place, so I guess space is at a premium. The waitress seemed almost overwhelmed, like she needed to get to her next task in a hurry, and we were keeping her from someone else more important.   Some customer-service focused training on the waitstaff would dramatically improve the overall experience. Like everyone else says, the food is fantastic, but the service is a bit spotty.

We had the bone marrow for the appetizer and it was mouth watering. We then got the pork chop which was huge and was so juicy, had tons of flavor. I had the mushroom risotto which was cooked perfectly. The drinks were phenomenal. They know how to make awesome cocktails and the service was perfect!

I went here with a group of friends to socialize and catch up as one of them was visiting. Parking is easy enough as there's parking garages close by, but the location between a Cabaret theater and a music hall means it can get busy before or after shows. Inside is dim with atmosphere and small, but it has a nice feel to it, plus the seats are very comfortable.  Appetizers of flatbread pizza, fried pickles, and mussels were a great way to start. The pizza was very flavorful and I really liked it. The fried pickles were done in a way that the breading stuck with the pickles and didn't come apart when eaten. It wasn't that sour either, but just the right amount. The mussels by themselves could have served a meal. There were quite a bit as an appetizer and split nicely between the five of us. The soup base was an interesting mix of bacon and salmon roe, which worked extremely well with the mussels and bread on top.  For entrees, I ordered the salmon along with another friend while other people ordered a burger, lamb shank, and pork chops with apple coleslaw. The salmon they had was a fusion of sorts where they mixed the idea of Korean bibimbap with an egg on salmon cooked medium. The salmon was cooked nicely, but combined the rest, it was a bit of a miss. The kimchi under the fish and the sauce used for bibimbap completely overpowered the whole dish. The black rice they used is supposed to be soft and sticky when cooked traditionally, but they seemed to have pan fried it to give it a crunchy texture. It could have worked, but tasted more like uncooked rice. The cucumber was slightly sweet and went along with the dish, but the kimchi/sauce still overpowered everything.  Trying some of my friend's dishes, the lamb shank was soft and smooth, which I enjoyed. The pork was cooked well and my friend really enjoyed it. The serving size for both of these were large and filling. The salmon was a good size and filling as well. I didn't get a chance to try the hamburger, but my friend enjoyed it.  For dessert, I decided to try the tiramisu they had. The presentation in a jar wasn't what I was expecting as tiramisu is usually presented as a small block on a dish. Once I dug in, I realized why it was in a jar:  The texture of dessert was more like pudding than bread-like, most likely due to the alcoholic content in it. Other than that, it was normal tiramisu in a more pudding form. It was okay, nothing impressive, but nothing bad either.  Overall, with good service and good dishes for the most part, I would recommend people to try this place.

Trendy ad f**k lol. This place reminded me more of a philly spot than an NY...can't put my finger on it but that's just the vibe I got. My bartender made me some really sexy drinks while looking great with a super cool hair cut and outfit complete with vest. The bar staff knew their stuff I will say. I really felt like I benefited meal wise by sitting at the bar and not a table. I got to ask random questions about anything on the menu. I went with the steak tartare which was great but it had a lot going on. Brisket Mac n cheese was amazing and so filling. Just an app but it hit me like a brick. Great drinks, great food and a really sexy atmosphere. Parking was relatively easy too one street over (free after 6). Great place for a date or drink after work.

O man.... I love the dinner menu at Meat and Potatoes, I really do, but I think the brunch is overrated. It's not nearly close to one of the best brunches I've had. I recommend skipping brunch and just doing dinner here instead.

I think this might be the best restaurant in pittsburgh right now. It's outrageously good. I will give you an unnecessary cautionary note about ordering fish there: it's not nearly as good as the other stuff. The other stuff is so goddamned good though that I don't care. The bone in ribeye is epic and absolutely must be shared. The fried chicken is also really great. Oh and the barrel aged whiskey? Yeah, I love it.   Their brunch is also really goddamned good. The dishes are fantastic and they let you build your own bloody mary. I love that.

I came here for Easter brunch and had the pub burger. best. burger. of my LIFE.  It was a beef patty topped with pastrami belly (think...thick, pepper-y, DELICIOUS bacon), a fried egg, horseradish cheddar (where have you been all my life?!), and truffle mayo.  Holy.  The fries were delish as well.  Do yourself a favor and come here.  The bf ordered chicken & waffles, and while he enjoyed it, he didn't like it as much as my burger.  He also said the Irish breakfast (coffee, Jameson, maple whipped cream, orange) was good, as well.  5 stars.  Everything was perfect!  Looooooved the vibe, environment, decor, & music.  Our server Joe was the greatest - so detailed, attentive, and friendly!!  I can't wait to come back.

This is hands down the best brunch spot I have found so far in Pittsburgh. Based on 2 important things: the food and how impressive their Bloody Mary bar is. I ordered the huevos rancheros as my entree as this is my favorite breakfast dish. I expected just your average huevos rancheros but this was so much more. It was topped with pulled pork and picked onions which was excellent together.  The Bloody Mary bar is out of this world though. You can choose between multiple infused vodkas such as old bay, bacon, dill pickle, etc. They have a vast number of different toppings that will keep you wanting to make multiple trips.

Wow. The menu here was comparable with Les Halles in NYC, and the quality was on par if not even better. My mom and I came here with no reservations on a Sunday night and were given a seat in under 20 minutes-open table had no more reservations and I knew it was a long shot, and I am so thankful I got a table!  The cocktails were expertly crafted and delicious, the menu touched on something for every palate, and the service was impeccable. I have not had a meal this good in a very long time-I had the poutine and manchego/chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates to start, followed by pastrami crusted duck, and finished with the malted chocolate pot au crème. I then rolled home in a food drunk stupor, and laid on my bed asking God why the food was so good that I was forced to eat all of it.  Go here, it's worth the price-your eyes, mouth, nose and tummy will be so happy with you.
Went back for 45 oz ribeye and was blown away the second time around. Would definitely return again. First time may have been a fluke since they were relatively new. Highly recommend the Tartare.

I went to dinner at Meat and Potatoes expecting great things given all the reviews.  I was very disappointed.  The fried pickles were average at best.  The sauce container was so small, the pickles didn't fit inside to dip.  The fall salad wasn't bad if you ignore the abundance of radicchio lettuce and too much dressing and soggy pears. To cap off the night my flat iron steak came after waiting 1 hour.  The mushrooms and onions were a nice addition.  The steak was cooked perfectly at medium-rare but was definitely lacking flavor.  The french fries which the hostess raved about were small pieces of potatoes (nothing special - D+).    To charge $28 for a flat iron steak and a potato side dish is on the high side. It definitely needed a green vegetable.  I can get a nice strip steak for $30+ at McCormick and Schmick or Grand Concourse or even a basic ribeye for $28 at the Cheesecake factory.  For $40+ Morton's, Ruth Chris or Capital Grille is more appealing.  They offer a 28 ounce ribeye for 2 for $58.  Why not offer a smaller version for 1.    They need bread for the meals and ice cubes for the warm water.  Glasses for iced tea are too small.  I didn't bother asking about desert, I just wanted to get out of there!  The music had a loud repetitive beat.    I do have to say the burgers looked really good.  For some reason they don't open for lunch on Monday and Tuesdays.

Solid across the board. Mostly hits. As mentioned many times, the bone marrow is unique and very nice. Nothing like buttering your bread with some marrow. The pig ear app wasn't a favorite. Wasn't as crisp as I thought and a touch sweet. Regardless, still unique.  Drinks were very good, and the service was great. Entrees were all on point. No huge standouts from our party, but clean plates all around. Luckily room was saved for some shared desserts as well because they were all excellent. If staying downtown, make a reservation and give it a shot.

So, I came here while on a business trip. I didn't choose the place, a colleague of mine did. When I heard the name of the restaurant I cringed a bit inside. I am not the type who can eat a lot of meat or potatoes. He insisted it was good, and he was right.   I love the decor and ambiance of the place. Everyone was super nice and funky. Funky in a good way. Cute clothes, hairstyles, and style overall. I loved it. The seats were a little weird. We were seated in the main dining area near the fireplace. When I sat I did NOT expect to sink as hard as I did. As a shorty, the seating was brutal.   We ordered so much it is hard to list it all. Out of what we ordered, I like the charcuterie board, and some dates wrapped in bacon (can't remember the name) but it was something you could write home about. We also ordered some pork bellies, and some other random things that weren't as memorable. We were also going to get bone marrow, but since we also ordered the HUGE Meat & Potatoes for Two which comes WITH a huge thing of bone marrow we decided not too.   The meat was awesome! We ordered medium rare, I think they wanted rare (I was with two people from France), but I think that style is a bit too "blue" for me. It still took about 45 minutes to come out. But with all the other food we ordered it was a quick and easy wait. I was so full at the end of the meal, but we still did order dessert. I think if it weren't for being embarrassed in front of my colleagues, I would have totally bent over and slumped home. My stomach was that full.   If I were in pittsburgh, I'd love to come for brunch. :) Next time, I'll still try to make a pitstop here :D

This is one of my regular go-to brunch places in town.  It can sometimes be hard to get a reservations but sometimes I have luck walking in and getting a seat at the bar.  My favorite part is the bloody mary bar! They have a choice of several infused tequilas or vodkas and a wide range of accoutrements that you can add to create your own masterpiece (as you can see from some of my photos here).  I particularly love the shrimp and bacon options.  As far as entrees go, I love how they regularly change up their menu so there's always something new to try.  I've tried several items on their brunch menu and I haven't had a bad thing yet and the portions are always quite generous and the prices reasonable.  The service is also very attentive.  The only thing I don't like is the choice of music the dj plays at brunch which often sounds like late nigh club music rather than brunch music, though at least they keep the volume to a reasonable level so it's not too bothersome.

Excellent service! This place is pretty top notch in my eyes! Our waiter was so attentive and the atmosphere was very lovely! The bone marrow looked unique as well. I had the cobb salad and it was pretty big for me. I will be coming back and Thank you for such a great experience!!

Had a fantastic dinner here last week. One of the best cocktail bars in the city, bartenders were great. Overall service was excellent as well as the food.  Cost was well worth it. Will definitely be back.
Very mediocre brunch. I would give dinner 3 stars not two. I like the bar and the drinks are good, the food just doesn't quite do it for me.

Always been a decent place, not the cheapest place in town but relatively consistent. I have been in a few times and ordered a few items off the menu. My last visit I ordered their huge tomahawk steak a 45oz rib eye, Cooking time took longer then expected, however for a steak this size it is definitely understandable. It's hard to comment too much when people get it right! Here is a photo of said steak! It was larger than my head.   Only downside, there is normally a homeless man that bums around outside, sometimes has an unpleasant smell.
Very chill place to have a great brunch! Chicken and waffles were amazing!!! Sweet with a hit of spice! Juicy chicken! Big portion. Bread with rhubarb jam and goat butter was awesome!!! Great music!

Wandering down the street a few hours before our show, two friends of mine and I decide to try to get into this place on a Friday night with no reservations. Walking in carefully, my friend nervously goes up to the hostess stand and asks "how stupid is it to try and get a table for three with no reservation?". Smiling, the host said we could either sit outside on the patio (plenty of seats because there was a slight chill in the air) or he could find three seats at the bar for us. We took a chance and chose the table, and were seated promptly.   The service was a little slow to start with, but quickly learned that our server had a zillion other tables and was taking care of the whole patio, which filled quickly with other diners willing to take a chance in chilly air. She was very helpful with suggestions, and ultimately our group ended up with a few apps, some flatbreads and an entree. I'll break them all down by below.  Devils on horseback (on snack menu): A weird take on pigs in a blanket that involved what I think is spicy mayo and super sweet pulled pork wrapped in bacon. I didn't like it at all, but my friends were fans.   Mac and cheese (on appetizer menu): Very yummy cheese sauce with this Mac, although I do prefer mine to be baked and not just thrown together in a pot. The chorizo really added to it and the crumbly top was a nice texture addition too!  Bone marrow (on appetizer menu):  Three ginormous bones of garlicky fatty goodness. The fixings were what made this so great. The only thing that was unpleasant was that when it cooled it became not so good. Not enough bread to start with in the first place, and took forever to get more.   The salty pig (Flatbread): Salty as ever but good as hell. My friend let me try a piece and it definitely lived up to its name.   Short rib Flatbread: Very delicious and everything I wanted it to be. It was a bit messy to eat, but I didn't care and dove right in.  Wagyu Steak & Pickles: My friend really enjoyed this and his steak was cooked perfectly. It was served on a long wooden plank, which I think is a little ridiculous, but he liked the kimchi and all the picked veggies that came with it.   The service ended up being pretty great by the end, and the food was good, but I wouldn't say it was the best meal I've ever had. When I'm paying those prices, I expect it to blow me away. I'd go back to the the happy hour snack specials sometime, but get dinner elsewhere.
I really like this place however I am disappointed that they changed the menu a little. I loved the steak with avocado but now it is different and doesn't taste as good. Cocktails are also good

One of my favorite high end restaurants in town. It can be hard to get a reservation, but several times we were able to sit at the bar quite easily and enjoy dinner or drinks while watching the awesome bartenders create their complicated drinks!   Try the fried Brussels, a great bar snack even if you think you hate brussel sprouts!

M&P's newer sister restaurant, Butcher & Rye, had a wait so we walked right over and got seated after a really short wait. No worries, I enjoy original restaurants to get an idea of what this Pittsburg restaurant family has to offer.  I would give this restaurant a 3.8 if it were possible.   My dining partner isn't as adventurous of a diner as I am so I didn't order the fried chicken liver or the fried pig ears that I really wanted. We settled on the buffalo mac and cheese instead. Great creamy gooey texture but holy cow was it salty!  3.5.   I ordered the lamb shank with cous cous which was well made and tasty. No gamey flavor and the cous cous was cooked well. A solid 4.0.   My partner had the parpadelle bolognese which I had more than a few bites of. The sauce was hearty and delicious, there might have been a little too much meat in the sauce which I know I would've struggled with if I had ordered that dish but to each his own.  My partner loved the al dente texture of the pasta but to me, the texture seemed less like al dente but more like perhaps too much flour in the dough?  Something was off but I prefer this to overdone pasta. 3.5-4.0.   We tried two cocktails, can't recall the names of them but I wouldn't waste any money on cocktails there again. Perhaps I'm spoiled since I've had some really superior cocktails back home in NYC and internationally but the flavors just didn't mesh and they were not easy to drink.   The staff were friendly and unpretentious and decor was comfortable and inviting. Price wise, I'd say they were on point. Overall, M&P would be a place I'd visit again and try different dishes if I found myself in the neighborhood and hungry but I didn't like it as much as I had hoped.

This place is great! The cocktails are wonderful, and I am a huge fan of the bloody mary bar during brunch. The only thing that was weird is when I wanted to bring in a big party of 7 people for Sunday brunch (calling months in advance), they were unable to accommodate us and we had to go somewhere else.

was here for lunch and killing the time before going to the airport. staffs were all nice and very well-mannered. they were polite, yet chill. I was impressed by the songs they were playing during my stay. the music genre was alternative indie pop from 1990's, like Blur and garbage. several tracks were from garbage 2.0 which was beyond my expectation. this surprising music ambience actually is the reason inspires me to write this review.  decorations and interior design were obviously eclectic with a hint of hipstery. but I didn't see young customers at the age around 20's-30's at all. probably because of the price. nevertheless, I was seated next to a 60yr old couple, whom just met through online dating, presumably. being by myself and dropping my ears at their conversations was definitely enjoyable at its best.  oh, hm, about the food, I got horseback riding for snack and mussels for lunch. horseback riding was a bit too sweet in a weird way for my tongue. i left the dates untouched but ate the entire unknown stuffing (it tastes like pork) and bacons and sauce. hm yumm.  the mussels were incredible tasty. however, I got a plane to catch. thus, imma end my review, and it is also because I can. besides, a lot of people mentioned it already.  hope your experience at meat and potatoes is going great like mine.

When I heard that there was a place serving poutine in Pittsburgh, which I visit on a regular basis, I was all over it. My group came in late-ish on a Saturday night ready to ravage some of that Canadian delicacy, plus whatever else we could get our mitts on. Overall, the kitchen is sending out some pretty amazing food, but there are some kinks to iron out. Service seemed a little frazzled and slow; one friend's burger was underdone (not sure if that was the kitchen or our server's fault); and the crab banh mi was more like a crab po' boy, and a little light on the crab. Otherwise, we were really happy with our food. The poutine disappeared in a heartbeat, my ricotta gnocchi were the fluffiest and tastiest I've ever had, and another friend's chicken wings were very flavorful. Prices are right, and the French bistro atmosphere is proper. I am definitely willing to tack on a fifth star if they deal with the  hiccups.
If you ever need somewhere to go on a Monday night for a late night bite, an excellent hand-crafted drink and sweet tunes, Meat and Potatoes is the place to be.

Meat & Potatoes is the kinda place that has been popping up across the country. A cozy space where friends sit and rediscover classic dishes with a new twist. Fried pickles served with a creamy aoli and sweet bread tacos with a pickled cabbage show more of the breadth of menu. While the food is more of the style of comfort food it still is one of the better places to grab a bite in the city.
My favorite place in the city. I have been going there since it opened. I drive 2 hours just to eat there. Sometime just to eat and then drive back home.

Visited a month ago for anniversary. Food was amazing! Server was great. Host chewed large wad of gum throughout greeting and seating us. A little awkward I guess. Thought of this most of meal... Will go back. Like I said, AMAZING food!

TRUFFLE AIOLI FRIES - boom, review done.   These are sooooooooooo good. The entrees are, of course, delicious as well and the custom cocktails are wonderfully balanced and mixed, but hot damn, those are some good fries! This is a great place to take a date on a fancy (and expensive) dinner.  I keep trying to give it four stars in my head because I feel like I've been too liberal with my stars lately, but nope, I can't do it. As long as you're expecting to spend a lot on really good food, then this is perfect.  Endnote: one of the things on there is a GIGANTIC steak that two people can share. It's like the size of the table! It's crazy!

This place is hip and has some great offerings. I've been here a number of times and have to say the pub burger and three little pigs sandwich are my favs - not very health conscious but delicious.  Cocktails are a feature - love the vanilla sky. I tried an absinthe based drink once and though well crafted, it was a bit too sweet for my taste.  Don't expect to drink beer from a bottle here. Anything not in draft form uniquely comes in a can!

Good meat and appetizers. I love the drinks.  A good place to go after the theater.  I have been here twice now and they have not been able to make me give five stars. There is always something missing. The first time the meat was not as good as I expected and on a Monday this week just the service was missing something.  On both times the door people were too busy on the phone. The food was better the second time  since we picked from the specials.  Both times the drinks were good.  I may give it another try since I like the set up and the location.

Things are looking up in Pittsburgh with the addition of this creative and brilliantly thoughtful restaurant.  This place can be and most likely will be a diet buster but is well worth the splurge every now and again.  I really enjoyed the service and ambiance.
