Wow!  This place was amazing!  Had the mussels of the day, 1 with curry the other with bacon and salmon roe.  If i wasnt with ppl from work i would have drank the broth.  Also had the chicken livers and fried pickles and both were very tasty.  My personal favorite was the roasted bone marrow.  It came with parsley garlic, sea salt, capers and pickled onions.  It was so F-ing good!!! For our main courses i had the pub which had pork belly a fried egg and havarti cheese.  It was messy but so good.  After all the apps i couldnt eat the whole thing and didnt touch the moutain of fries it came with.  Other entrees were the wagu flat iron with wasabi mash.  Def the 2nd best thing on the menu besides the marrow. The pork shank was as big as a football and had great flavors.  It literally melted in your mouth.  At a place called meat and potatoes we did have someone order pasta!!  What a sucker!  The papperdelle was very very good tho.  Our server did a great job and drinks were great too.  They dont have bottled beer which while that seemed wierd didnt take anything away from the great time we had.  Atmosphere was awesome and ambiance matched.  We finished with coffee and choc mousse.  Winning!!!

Service was excellent.  Nice atmosphere, but can get loud.  Had a $200 dinner and was a bit irritated that when asked for another piece of bread for the stake tartar  (which only came with one slice) was charged more for the extra bread.   Seemed tacky to me!

Go somewhere else for good service.  I went in on a Tuesday night, 3 bartenders on  service and 1 barback, 8 minutes until anyone acknowledged I was at the bar. Bar was not busy, empty seats, the female bartender walked past me 4 times didn't even say hi.   I was sitting in front of the cash register, the male bartender never looked up to even say hi.   I have lived in Las Vegas for the past 20 years this place is a poor copy of herbs and rye in Las Vegas.  I have no idea of how their food or drinks taste, if the service is this bad I wasn't interested in finding out.   Too many choices to waste time in a place that isn't interested in my business.

Lives up to its name. Had great service at the door and inside. Had the spring salad, which was light and refreshing before getting the pot roast and mashed potatoes, which were terrific and tasty; just enough to be filling but not stuffed. Ambience and location is also great. I would hesitate to return and try something else when I'm next in town.

After searching Yelp for a good brunch spot in the area, we walked over to Meat & Potatoes.  This place is definitely worth checking out if visiting Pittsburgh and want some delicious food.  Make reservations and you'll be glad you didn't have to wait in line.  The interior is pretty I like how there's a mirror along the walls so the people facing the wall are able to people watch behind them (I like the people watching.  Creepy, I know).  Fighting a hangover, I asked for a coffee and liked it.  We asked for suggestions from our server who was really great in explaining the menu favorites to us.  Even the server for the table next to us gave us her choices too.  Everyone there is very friendly.  My friend had the short rib hash which looked amazing. Okay, I can speak for it since I stole a bite from her place.  It was damn good.  I chose the French toast and boy was I glad I did.  It was probably the best French toast I had ever had.  Those bananas!  Like bananas foster and what's that sauce? I'm not good at reviewing food other than telling you it was mad delicious.    Wish we had another night in the city to check this place out for dinner.  Seems to be a popular place with the locals and with good reason  I would definitely go back here if ever in Pittsburgh again.

This review is severely overdue. We were in Pittsburgh for the first game of the Steelers season last September and I had reviewed Yelp for recommendations to eat. My husband is Paleo so places like Italian or Mexican are always out. The offerings here seemed to match with our interests. We had the Caesar salad with pig cracklins, the special of the day meatloaf and the lemon angel food cake. These were all perfectly fine items. I am here to sing the praises of the steak tartare on the starters menu. We live in the San Francisco Bay Area, so we have a ton of high end restaurants to pick from. The steak tartare at Meat & Potatoes is the BEST I have ever eaten, and my husband the Paleo eater agreed. It was simply spectacularly executed, beautifully plated and delicious. Next time we're in Pittsburgh we'll be sure to be back!!

Me and the hubby went to a show at the Benedum.  We were intrigued and decided to get a brunch reservation.  Wow, so glad we did!  The banana and bacon sourdough french toast was devine!  It was more dessert than breakfast but oh so very worth it!  We got a side of their fried taters...some of the best fries we have ever had!  The hubby got one of their specials.  It was a crispy chicken bisquit.  It was good but not as good as the french toast!  They are on the list to try for dinner at some point!  We loved it and will definitly visit again!

This place got five stars because it's by far my favorite restaurant downtown. My best friend took me out to dinner here not long ago and I was actually blown away  by how beautifully, succulently cooked the meats were.  I'm not a huge carnivore - I only like meat when it's brilliantly prepared, and this place does it.  The only other restaurant I know of in town that does equally wonderful preparations of meat is Union Pig & Chicken in East Liberty.   As for the atmosphere - it's fun, lively, youthful - and usually packed fully with theater go-ers, so I suppose that reservations are a great idea.
Loved it.  As a first timer to Pittsburgh this was  great. Portion sizes were great. Love the atmosphere.   Great beer selection.

Man was I glad I was able to score the one remaining seat at the bar for dinner. If you'll excuse the NY-centric description, M&P represents the middle ground between Brooklyn and Midtown. It's spacious and people stop there before the game, but it has chalk menus and interesting light fixtures and fresh craft cocktails. I can't recommend reservations enough, especially if there's anything going on across the river.
Fabulous food, great service. The staff was very considerate of the table's tree nut and egg allergy requirements.

We went with a big group of people, and were a little late in getting our reservations, so we had to eat at 9:30 at night.  They had us in a small room off the bar which was nice, so we could talk easily to each other.  The decor was pretty amazing, I really liked the ambiance they were setting up. While, I did not order cocktails, most people in our group did.  The first person to get his drink, had a decent sized glass, which led everyone else to feel okay that theirs would be a decent size as well.  Unfortunately, that was not the case, the cocktails came in 3 different sized glasses, none of which were large.  I believe that was where most of the disappointment lied with our group for the evening.  Don't get me wrong though, everyone enjoyed the flavor of their drinks immensely, but they were overpriced for how much you got.     Just to say we did, we got the bone marrow appetizer, and while only half our table tried it, those that did seemed to enjoy it - I know I did.  I also ordered the waldorf salad, which was amaaazing.   As far as the meals went, they were fairly reasonably priced, but the portion sizes were pretty scattered.  I ordered the 3 little pigs sandwich and got a fat-heads sized sandwich, and my boyfriend ordered the pork - which was also massive.  No complaints on our end on flavor or size.  Unfortunately our friend ordered the salmon, and was disappointed in the size of his meal, and ended up finishing his wife's french fries (which were some of the best I've had in the city).  Everyone else got what I would deem, an appropriate sized meal, with no left overs, but also no hunger pains at the end.  Overall, a good meal was had by all

Found this place using Yelp for my birthday celebration, and I was so wow-ed!  Absolutely everything we ordered was delicious.    We started with the cheese plate, which was head and shoulders above every other cheese plate I've ever had.  It was full of new and interesting flavors, all of which paired perfectly.  Dinner was the duck - again, wonderful, complex flavors all of which played together in surprising and delightful ways.  Since the first two courses were so wonderful, dessert was a must - rich, decadent pot de creme.  Wow.  Since I'm expecting, I was sadly unable to sample the cocktail offerings, but there were a ton, and they all looked awesome.  The bar featured an absenthe fountain - seriously.  As other reviewers stated, seating is a little small and crowded.  This wasn't a problem for us, but we had no trouble chatting up our neighbor table in typical friendly Pittsburgh fashion.  If you're looking for a private and intimate setting, this is not it.  It is, however, fun and "casual upscale."  We will definitely be back.

I so wanted to like this place because I heard so many positive things about it; however, it failed on so many levels.  We were seated like a bunch of anchovies in a can and every time a server walked past me my chair was bumped.  The choice of music was horrible ('60s /'70s depressing stuff) and it was blaring so I could not speak to my girlfriend without screaming.   We sat there for 15 minutes before our server came over to us and he said "sorry but I just started here a month ago".  C'mon! let's figure it out dude.  Our easy-peasy short two-item order was somehow lost between our table and the kitchen (distance of 30 feet, no joke) Really? REALLY??? I can hardly think of anything worse than completely omitting an entire table's orders. So there we sat,  45 minutes later still waiting for our plates, being bullied (by our own hunger, not by M&P staff) into ordering dish after unsatisfying overpriced dish of their so-called "Meat & Potatoes".  I finally asked our server how much longer our plates would be.  He comes back and tells me nonchalantly "Your ticket was never put in, oops." No apology, not comps, nothing. WOW!  To boot, as we were paying our bill a huge centipede was crawling on the chair behind my girlfriend.  I killed it and told the server.  For some reason he giggled - I did not think it was funny.    Tell me, how can a restaurant overlook a ticket for a homonymous order? If that's not dropping the ball, I really don't know what is.

Came here for lunch. Seats weren't that hard to get if you come between 12:00-12:30pm. Any later then the place would get packed. Wish I came here for dinner so I can try their bone marrow. Let me skip to the chase and let you know what to order and what not to order.  - Roasted Brussels Sprouts: get it! Perfectly roasted, not bitter and covered with cheese - Fried Pickles: get this but keep in mind it's piping hot so don't burn your tongue like I did - Grilled Pork Chop: perfectly cooked- usually I'm skeptical of ordering pork chops because once you cook it too long, there's no saving it- you'll be stuck with dry tasteless pork...however! Meat & Potatoes does it just right. Paired with veggies and pork belly with a hint of Asian flavors, this is the dish to get  Definitely will be back when I'm around. I need to try their dinner menu!

OMG!  The food was freakishly Awesome.  I was in the Pitt for a trade show and joined several colleagues for dinner here.  Didn't have reservations so we (3 of us) sat at the bar.  Took forever to even be acknowledged as humans. By the bar staff... Not a big bar but they still had 4 people behind the bar.  Rude ... Rude....Rude....Rude.... Employees. Food was awesome.  Will Never go back.......

Was visiting Pittsburgh from out of town and my friend took me here for brunch. The food was amazing! I got the chicken and waffles and it was delicious- but everyone's food looked great as well. Loved the bloody mary bar- definitely a must. Overall, I really enjoyed brunch here and would return if I lived in the city!

"Wow, he's a lot better looking than the last guy you brought in here.  What a joker!"  Said the host to my husband.  Thanks, Charlie.  Thanks a lot.  However, since I haven't actually been to Pittsburgh for about 7 years, the innocent act worked this time and the night was saved.  Our waitress was very good, and helpful!!  We made our way through the non-mammalian portion of the menu in that really beautiful, but laid back space.  The duck liver pate was oralgasmic.  The lemongrass moules- frites were delightful.  I had to restrain myself from picking up the bowl and slurping the broth!!    The soft-shell crab tacos were perfect.  Eating"soft" shell crabs that have been allowed to live too long is like getting a mouth full of fingernails.  These, however, were light, crispy and delicious.  I feel sort of bad eating them at their most sensitive point, though.  there they are, little crabs who are all vulnerable, maybe thinking of writing poetry again and BAM, someone throws them in the deep fryer.  Better luck next life, little crabs.  You were delicious.   The only disappointment of the night were the fancy cocktails.  They were OK.  The Aviation was too gingery and the hot date was weak tasting.  So stick to beer and wine and your will have an utterly fantastic dinner.

Meat & Potatoes was a blast. Arrived w/o a reservation on a Saturday night and even though we were told we would not get a table for another 1.5-2 hours we could find seats at the bar. We found one for the two of us (of course) but decided to stake our territory anyway with the one chair and to grab another when one freed up, which took some waiting and work including dealing with a rude old man...  Aside from that I love the dark interior of M & P with the mirrors and gold trim surrounding the room. It adds a nice element of elegant coziness.   The bartenders greeted us and were kind enough to give us a sample of the beers we were interested in trying. Ordered the Oscar and my bf ordered the Kobe Flat Iron. Oscar had a cut of veal, a fried soft shell crab on top and a side of risotto. Delicious - kind of on the salty side but I like it that way. I ate every bite but I had a hard time cutting with the knives they gave me (first butter knife then was given a steak knife when realized I was cutting with a butter knife). And the service continued to be great - the bartenders checked in periodically, were friendly and didn't push you out of  M & P. They let you soak in the experience and we did.

My boyfriend and I have come to the conclusion that this is by far our favorite restaurant.   We made out reservation about a month in advance.  That was the only way we would ever get a 7 pm table for 2 on a Saturday night.  We got there a little bit early, so we had a drink at the bar.  The cocktail menu is adventurous and yummy.  You can always ask a bartender to surprise you, just give them some favorites of yours.    Once we sat down, we were presented with the menu and an explanation.  We settled on the pulled pork mac and cheese and the mussels.  The mac and cheese was to die for.  The mussels were also great; we chose a tomato based sauce, not our normal white wine sauce.  We decided to switch from cocktails to wine for the main course. The wine selection was expansive and the waiter was very knowledgeable.  I had the salmon, which was cooked just to my specifications.  I like my fish undercooked, which some restaurants don't seem to like.  He had the hanger steak which was also cooked to perfection.  The sides to both of our entrees were exciting, rare and complemented the meals well.    I forget what we had exactly for dessert, but I think it was some cookie dough type pudding.  We shared this as we were incredibly full, and it was scrumptious.   The only complaint I have is the the 2 person tables are a bit close together.  The couch that wraps around the wall (one of the seating for each 2 top), seems as if the springs have gone.  You sit down and sort of sink another 4 inches.    Overall, we are looking forward to our next visit, as this restaurant is amazing!

Not sure we could have had a better dining experience anywhere. We were seated promptly at the time of our reservation and found the decor to be very welcoming and the chairs very comfortable. We started with a drink and ordered some wine, then ordered a couple of appetizers. My wife's "Kobe corn dog" made her day and the curry mussels were the best thing I have eaten in a long time. The portion was huge and I would have gladly eaten the curry broth as a soup!  We got the meat and potatoes for two, which was cooked absolutely perfectly and we ate almost all of the gigantic portion. Although slightly under salted, it was a great presentation and a very nice cut of ribeye. Our dessert, some type of chocolate pot de creme, was delicious as well. The service was fantastic and I felt that, although expensive, the meal was a good value. Can't wait for our next trip!

I was visiting Pittsburgh for the first time and wasn't quite too sure how the food scene was like.  I'm so glad we found, Meat & Potatoes.  Atmosphere dimly lit  * casually refined  * Gastropub *  trendy   Apps $7--Chicken Livers- I'm not a big fan of liver but my table enjoyed it. The waiter was kind enough to bring us the truffle mayo (that came with fries) upon request. $16-- Mussel - I love mussels but never had I had mussels with salmon roe, bacon, balsamic vinegar pearls & dill in a tomato sauce. As odd as this all sounds, it was fantastic.    Entrees (we all kind of shared) $19 -- Hudson Valley Duck Breast /pastrami crusted duck / sauerkraut pierogies /  scallion butter / dandelion greens / chimichurri ***This was my entree.  The CRUST on this duck is ridiculously DELICIOUS. The duck was perfectly cooked- tender, juicy...and so... mmm.  The pickled onions, dandelion greens & chimichurri complimented the richness of the duck well. I wasn't a big fan of the perogies (dumplings filled with potatoes & sauerkraut).  I took a few bites but it's just not my thing. Overall, good portion size and value.  Definitely would order this dish again.   $20-- Pork/smoked chop / pastrami / baked beans / spicy collard greens  ***My friend got this and it was HUGE! It must of been a double/triple cut pork chop.  Even had some folks from surrounding tables starring out of curiosity.  Usually when I think of pork chops, I think about dry and chewy. Not so the case here.  It  was moist and the sauce was really flavorful.  Spicy collard greens were good. ORDER THIS!  $29-- Wagyu Flat Iron / charred carrots / queso fresco / cilantro / pepita / radish / chili sherry vinaigrette  ***  My BF ordered this and it was probably my least favorite of the three entrees-- not to say it was bad.  The meat was cooked well, but it was a little on the plain side for me and it was the most expensive out of the three. I wouldn't order this.    Food is excellent, and the service was great. I highly recommend it.

Cool hip ambiance comfortable seating  nice lighting  and great cocktails especially the old time refresher.  Started with the devils on horseback which were delicious.  Then continued with the flat iron steak and braised Brussels which were both ridiculously great! Highly recommend. Mike the bartender was very accomadating!

Had brunch twice. Great experience both times. Very talented staff. I ordered the chicken and waffles both times and it was delicious. The Bloody Mary bar is also fun and impressive. The ambience is also very inviting and relaxing.

This is by far some of the best food I have ever eaten!  It took us a very long time to get a reservation trying multiple times we were in the city and for my honeymoon weekend and my birthday.  But, my husband and mother decided to just make a reservation and go there for no occasion.     I was slightly worried it was going to be pertinacious, but I was wrong.   The food is fantastic for a foodie and familiar enough for someone who is not. We got the mac and cheese and grilled bread to start.  The goat butter was so good I wanted to ask if I could take what was left home.   For the entrees I got hanger steak, my mother got fish and chips, and my husband got the duck.  Everyone was satisfied and full.  We didn't get any alcoholic drinks, but the soda came in some very neat glasses.    We got a reservation for my next birthday :-)... Would definitely recommend, but there isn't much seating so a reservation a couple weeks ahead is necessary.

I really enjoyed my dinner here. We made reservations and we were seated very quickly as soon as we came.   The food was great, interesting but not too out there. The cocktails were quite tasty and visually appealing.   Ambience was extremely hipster but that's pretty common nowadays, was nice. Seats were comfortable.   My only thing is waitress sometimes took too long to come back to the table. There is a balance between hovering too much and not being able to be found.

The atmosphere here is so cool!  The drinks are excellent and the food is even better. I've ordered the black bass on one occasion and the agnolotti on another.  Both dishes were the perfect size and were loaded with flavor! My favorite appetizer is the bone marrow.  Before visiting meat & potatoes I had never tried bone marrow before, but since then I've tried it at several other restaurants around the country and none have measured up to meat & potatoes.  My only complaint is that the tables are very close together, so I felt like the neighboring tables were listening to my conversations and I felt like I was eavesdropping on theirs.  An excellent pre-show dinner option for sure!

UPDATED REVIEW: I have to start by saying that my girlfriend and I have eaten here at least twice a month since we moved to the area 5 months ago. And it's usually pretty stellar. Tonight was a major exception.  This was our go-to place to bring friends and family when they visit, but we have changed our minds for this Friday, when our family is coming to town.  We ordered the new ginger cocktail, which we have had a few times since our favorite Bramble has left the menu. This time, the drink left my mouth burning with straight fresh ginger. After getting an eye roll and a sigh from our server, we were able to exchange them for the Clover Club drink. We then ordered the Kobe Corndog, which is usually a great appetizer. This time, it was cold. Sigh. But the kitchen mistakes don't stop there. I ordered the bone marrow, which arrived RAW. I was then challenged to an argument by a server (Shane?) who told me that 'technically it is cooked through'. The nerve to tell me that my bleeding bone marrow is 'technically cooked'. He was then gracious enough to 'have the chef take a look at it for me' ?!? Are you kidding? I didn't come out to eat to have to argue over my date's shoulder and the loud music over something as simple as putting a bone back in the salamander. My girlfriend and I both work in jobs where customer service is a top priority, and it would be nice to think that we could expect the same when we come out to eat.   To top it all off, our server never once checked in on us, and was so timid she didn't even ask if we needed a dessert menu.  We are really dissapointed in our experience this evening, we will not be returning to this place for a while.

The food was probably worth at least 4 stars, but other aspects of our dining experience resulted in an overall lower rating. I second what others have said about the hostesses. I've tried to get a reservation in the past and received similar responses to other reviewers. This time we made the reservation 2-3 months in advance so there was no problem. We had to make a 7:30 show and requested a 5:30 reservation so that our meal would not be rushed. We were told that a 6:00 would be plenty.   Yes, they got us out of there in time to put leftovers in the car and still get to the theater, but........Our meal didn't hit the table until 6:55. The steak and frites were great, but I didn't eat a lot of it b/c I didn't want all of the heavy food sitting in my stomach throughout the show. Given how late the food came out of the kitchen I also didn't want to inhale my meal and be even more uncomfortable. They probably would have made more money on us if we got the earlier reservation too. I definitely would have ordered more wine, some before dinner and some during. Dessert was not even an option.  The steak was really thick and delicious. However, there were so many flavors on the plate that it was a bit over the top. Either one of the sauces or the frites were extremely salty, which then just took over the flavor. My husband had the flat iron steak and loved it. The mushrooms and sauce were divine.   All of this being said, I would definitely go back but not on a night when I had to be somewhere else at a certain time.

I've been to brunch here twice and I can't wait to go back. The Bloody Mary bar is a meal within itself, with a diverse selection of garnish. The infused vodkas are also a treat, but regular vodka bloodies were just as enjoyable. Everyone at our table, in both instances, loved their food. I've had the Eggs in Purgatory and the Short Rib Hash and would highly recommend for a hearty breakfast. I can't wait to see how this menu will change come spring/summer.  And I'm dying to try one of their Eggs Benedict specials.  Also, for making two trips to the Bloody Mary bar, each and ordering brunch entrees, my husband and I were surprised of how little our bill was compared to some other higher end brunch places we've been ot.

walk-in on Saturday, July 5. the hostess said it would be 30 min for an outside table, no biggie. we went to the bar and sat down, bartender walked us through the menu and bloody mary bar, only to tell us that bar seating is for breakfast only and that the hostess would need to seat us here also. seems like a detail you should mention from the beginning.   would not recommend this place, hostesses were cold and not helpful.

We had reservations after a hockey game. Having had a huge brunch we still weren't super hungry, but we wanted to give this place a try. We had the honey-glazed fried pork ears as an appetizer (GREAT!) a flatbread pizza, and the short rib bolognese pasta. Delicious meal!

We arrived 20 minutes earlier than our reservation, so we decided to indulge in a dirty martini before dinner. For $21 we got two less than 6 ounce martinis, excluding the tip. As a Miami Beach local, I am used to overpriced cocktails but was surprised by this in Pittsburgh.  Afterwards, we were seated at a very comfortable table for two closely nestled between two other tables. I tend to avoid seating situations like this, but it wasn't overwhelming. In fact, it gave us an opportunity to see what other diners were enjoying. To my surprise their signature appetizer is bone marrow, which is literally served in the cow bone, which is then spread across bread.   We weren't feeling adventurous enough for that and decided to try the fried pickles, risotto, and Mac n Cheese instead. We split our entree - a flat iron flap steak, which was perfectly cooked and jam packed with flavor.   The wine list was simple and in comparison to the cocktails, very affordable, I had a bottle of Malbec while my boyfriend went with a bottle of Pinot Grigio - both under $34.   Overall the staff was pretty attentive but we still had to hunt down our waitress every so often. I absolutely hated their choice of glassware. Wine served in tumbler glasses and martinis served in a weird sort of snifter. I'll pass on that.   I would recommend this place to friends.

Visiting from Orlando, FL. This place was recommended and through all of the hype, it wasn't as impressive as it was made out to be.  Appetizers-  Fried chicken livers (heavy batter and slightly salty) it came with a sauce on the side but I felt that the sauce was too overwhelming and tangy.  Poutin- French fries, it was cheesy and drenched in gravy, (just ok)  Bone Marrow- it came out with 3 large bones to scrape and eat with crispy bread. There wasn't much flavor to it as anticipated. It could've used some seasoning or even a dash of salt.   For the main dish we ordered the Ribeye for 2 (medium rare), with the sides of au gratin cheesy potatoes and cauliflower mixed with capers.  Overall it was just OK. Pricey place and it was good but not amazing like everyone made it out to be.  Also ordered 3 glasses of scotch and our total came out to be $250 before tip.
Did not disappoint! The mussels were amazing and watching people attempt to woof down the giant steak was worth the trip.
Thank god for these guys a bit of new York in the burgh  keep it up.

Got recommendation from local folks for this restaurant  and OMG! Everything is so delicious and fresh.  Each dish is perfect. Really recommend it if you are in Pittsburgh and have only one mean. I will be coming back for sure!

We usually dine at Meat and Potatoes a few times a year.  Mostly so my wife can satisfy her duck cravings.  I have to admit after reading some recent reviews about M&P I was a little nervous.  We have always had a good experience here and I didn't want that to end.  Well the jury is out and M&P is still one of our favorite restaurants.   I made reservations awhile ago for 515pm.  I could have made them for later in the night but I thought we were going to go to the baseball game right after so I made it this early.   We ended up not going to the baseball game this night and we were feeling rushed to get there by 515.  So my wife called to see if they were able to bump our reservation to a little later time.  She talked to a hostess and they were polite and changed our reservation until 645pm.  That was great and it worked out so perfect for us too.       When I made the reservation I requested that we could sit outside.  The girl on the phone said they couldn't guarantee it but she would put a note that we would like to sit outside.  We love M&P but sitting indoors can get squished.  That is probably the only thing that we don't like about M&P.  You sit so close to other tables that you can hear their conversation and they can hear yours just as easily.  So that's why we requested to go outside.   I dropped off my wife in the front and then I parked.  She asked them too sit outside and we got to!  If it's a nice day sit outside at M&P!  You have a lot more room and you can't hear your neighbors conversation.       So far so good!  I ordered a water and wifey got a Black Manhattan.   She ordered her Duck and I ordered the Pork.  The food came out at a good time and it looked great.  She liked her duck although she said it was better in prior times but she still liked it a lot.  I really liked my smoked pork shop.  It was huge and it came with pastrami pork belly, baked beans, and spicy collard greens.  The temperature on the pork was perfect.  Even my wife tried it and loved it she said.        Did we luck out?  Has the service and food gone down this past year? I don't know.   Maybe it has but for my personal experience it hasn't.  We will be back like usual in 6 months so she can her duck and I will try something new.

My friends and I made a reservation for Saturday night, the earliest they could take us was 10 so we had drinks downtown before dinner. When we arrived they sat us right away, luckily, because the bar there was completely packed.  So the lighting is very dim with dark walls and floor to ceiling windows. Wonderful for a 10 o'clock dinner. We started with cocktails. The Boyd & Blair sours cocktail was frothy and smooth and it tasted like fall. My friend had the Slow Gin Fizz which was also delightful.  We ordered the mussels in a lemongrass sauce that was reminiscent of a thai curry and they were spicy but not too hot. Definitely try this out!  For entrees we ordered the Salmon, the Pot Roast, Fried Pickles and Waldorf Salad. I loved the salmon, but after trying the pot roast I will order it next time. My friend said "this is the best pot roast I ever had... sorry mom..." The fried pickles were crispy and seasoned well.  For dessert we had the buttermilk panna cotta and the vanilla bean pot de creme. They were both amazing but I would definitely recommend the panna cotta if you must choose.   Service was prompt, we were never waiting long for anything, not even our waiter. I can't wait to go back!

Maybe we should have ordered the steak.  Had salmon. Lucky my husband likes siracha because it was covered in that sauce.  Also had the duck. Good but I've had better.  The bartender was entertaining but a bit arrogant.  Overall would not go back.

Excellent food, exceptional service we shared  the giant ribeye between 4 people and no one left hungry, the experience of having a full steer rib bone set upon your table is unique to say the least. This should be a must for any visit to pittsburg.

After hearing rave reviews and watching the Food Network special on this restaurant, my parents and I were looking forward to dining here.  The first time we stopped by, we learned that it is so busy most days that you need a reservation.  We promptly booked a reservation for the following week.  The first sign that the service is less than adequate was that I received a text message reminder that my reservation was for 15 minutes later than what I booked and it included an extra person.  I called, and although the hostess was apologetic, they were unable to change the time to what I originally booked.    I am gluten-intolerant.  Dining out at any restaurant is a risk that I assume, but I do expect a high quality restaurant to try to get it right.  After informing the waitress of my food sensitivities, I ordered the tartare.  It arrived on top of a piece of bread.  The waitress was apologetic, but I didn't have much confidence in the food service after that.  Also, what kind of a restaurant serves tartare on top of bread???  That's a great way to ruin a beautiful delicacy, ability to eat bread aside.    For the main meal, my mother and I ordered the meat and potatoes for two.  It was a novelty and we were both pleased with the presentation and the taste of the meal.  We had a lot of leftovers, and that brings me to another very disappointing experience.  We scraped all of the meat off the bone prior to having the waitress take it back to box it up.  When we opened the box the next day, we discovered that they only gave us half of the meat.  This is unacceptable for what we paid for the meal and the amount of meat that was leftover.  We were not otherwise impressed with the service, as it was difficult to get the attention of the waitress throughout the meal.         The atmosphere was not quite what we were expecting.  We were expecting more of a higher quality, upscale dining experience, but the music was too loud for conversation.  The decor was unique, although the chairs in the waiting area desperately need to be restored.    Overall, I don't feel that the meal was worth the money that we spent.  If you have food sensitivities, beware!

Well, this place was on the travel channel today and I decided we should head there for dinner.  Wow, the food was incredible. Very warm and cozy place that you will enjoy!!  The mussels app was incredible. We had three choices of broth to have our mussels in.  It was incredible. A huge bowl was served and I think I was pretty full after that app.    The main course was scrumdidilyumtious. Sorry, it was a word from willy wonka but I had a quagmire moment as well in my own head.    I ordered the pot roast which was server in a Le Creuset mini kettle with lid.  This was served with delicious veggies and mashed potatoes. The gravy was phenomenal.  This was a serious dish and I complemented it with a Sgt Peppers Old Fashioned. The drink was excellent. The service was fantastic. Everyone was very attentive to us and kept our table neat and tidy.  Fantastic teamwork and an amazing experience.  Nice job!!
Delicious food, great service and some good wine and drinks on offer.   The only snag is that it's too popular, so you need to me a reservation.

Nice Gastro-pub in the Cultural District of Pittsburgh: good decor, good selection of wines and beers, interesting menu resulting in tasty and well presented food, friendly service.  So the only thing that causes a miss of full marks is that music levels are OK for its -pub persona, but too loud for the Gastro- part ...

Had dinner here by myself while visiting Pittsburgh. Had the bone marrow and pot roast.  The marrow was heaven! It was well roasted, melted in your mouth. I don't think I've had better elsewhere.  I could have ended there but went on to ruin my night with the pot roast. It was bland and jello like in some bites.  The service was great and ambiance was dark.

I really love the food here. I've been here a couple of times. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They have the best fried pickles I've ever had and I used to live in the south.  I give it 4 stars because whoever is running the front desk/telephones is pretty rude. We made a reservation and they told my husband we could have it but we had to be out by 7:15. Okay...great. Then they called to confirm our reservation and told us the same thing. I think that's pretty rude and strange to say to a paying costumer.

I don't usually like fancy, hyped up brunch spots but Meat & Potatoes was actually very good. My girlfriend and I shared an assortment of dishes: short rib hash, Irish benedict, carbonara, and fried taters. Everything was delicious but my absolute favorite was the carbonara. You can't go wrong when you combine creamy pasta with eggs. Yum! We also shared dessert..a white chocolate pretzel cheesecake (?) which was really good as well. Total cost for all that food was about $50. Not bad considering how popular the restaurant is and the quality of the food.
This place is great! The risotto is very good ! It's a bit strong on the black pepper ! But i liked it very much!  Great atmosphere

My favorite restaurant in town.   The steak for two is one of those simple meals made elegant and perfect thronging preparation and top notch ingredients.   Excellent bar menu with expertly crafted cocktails. Prices are on the higher side for Pittsburgh but worth every penny.   And don't forget to stop in for Brunch some time, as good as dinner!
Amazing! Terrific food, great drink selection, great atmosphere, great service, my friends and I had a blast! This place is top flight and don't miss a chance to check it out.

Had Sunday brunch here and everything we had was delicious. Short rib hash, French toast, and the chicken and waffles. I enjoied the music , the only probelm we had was the the table was super small. It seemed cramped when eating.

I've heard many people rave about this place, but I will not be one of them.  Having LOVED the restaurant formerly in that space (Café Zao), this is quite a departure.  We ate there one Light-Up Night in Pittsburgh with reservations being made more than a month in advance.  For 4 people, they pulled together two very small round tables right near the bar.  It was obnoxious and so loud that we could not have a conversation.  The food was ok, nothing special.

I had always heard such great things about Meat and Potatoes, so I had very high expectations. However, I have tried it three times, and I definitely didn't love everything. The first time I tried the duck salad, which wasn't the best, but we started with the Devils on horseback, which I would highly recommend.   The second time was a hit. We ordered the fried pickles, and I ordered the pot roast, which were both great. However this past time, the service of wasn't great, and I wasn't super impressed by the duck entree. This restaurant is definitely hit or miss for me. I would like to be back to try the brunch, but I'm not so sure that I will return for dinner.

Being an IUP Alum from Philly; I have made MANY wknd trips to Pgh over the past 10 years to visit my college friends.  We usually frequent South Side for our dining pleasures but my friend took us to Meat & Potatoes for brunch after our marathon style Saint Patrick's Day rage-fest last year.  Not being a huge breakfast food person but still looking for something to "soak up the booze"; I opted for the five-cheese grilled cheese and tomato soup! It was HUGE and DELICIOUS! I'm pretty sure someone at the table had Chicken & Waffles and another had Huevos Rancheros which were also amazing!  I also remember diving into someone else's left over fried taters. Yum!  I needed a nap after this one.  It has been a while since I was at Meat & Potatoes but I remember a large make-your-own Bloody Mary bar.  Great for the Sunday Funday hangy cure.  Next time I am in Pgh, I may request a return visit to Meat & Potatoes!

I had my first Meat and Potatoes experience a few weeks ago as part of Pittsburgh Restaurant Week. My friend and I made reservations for a weekday and I basically spent that entire workday looking at the menu and salivating.  We decided to go with the prix fixe restaurant week menu, which had a fitting "meat and potatoes" theme for each course.  The first course was beef carpaccio with cute little crispy potato chips, arugula, quail yolk, and a taleggio foam. The carpaccio was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The portion was very generous, especially for an appetizer course. I would go back just to have this again.  Second course was grilled flank steak, potato gnocchi, and basil salsa verde. The meat was perfectly cooked--extremely tender and full of flavor. We loved the pillowy gnocchi, which were a delicious companion to the steak and the salsa verde. My friend and I both later agreed that this was our favorite course. The menu referred to this as a "stew" but I'm not sure I would use that word as I was picturing a hearty soup of some sort. Regardless, this dish was perfect and we loved it.  The third and final course consisted of crispy short ribs, pickled Swiss chard, baby carrots, and potato croquettes. Again, the meat was tender and packed with flavor. The crispiness of the fried croquettes added great texture, and it was nice to have the carrots and chard to add in some other flavors. This was served with a very rich gravy and overall had the feel of comfort food, elevated.   For an additional $20 or so, M&P offered a paired cocktail for each course. My friend and I had gone to happy hour prior to dinner so we decided against the three drinks (I wanted to actually remember the meal...) but we did each order a cocktail off the regular menu. We had a Clover Club and the Seven Year Itch, both of which were great. They had a nice selection of both classic and new craft drinks.  The restaurant itself has a nice, trendy vibe but doesn't go overboard. The staff was friendly and we didn't run into any service issues.  Overall this was a positive experience and I'm excited to go back. Based on other reviews, I think my next trip here will be for brunch. The words "Bloody Mary bar" are enough to draw me in!

I have been here a few times. It was one of the first places I went to since moving home from NYC. You will find creative and edgy cocktails and dishes here that made me feel like I was trying a new spot off the L train in Brooklyn. Sometimes the staff even has ironic bow ties and facial hair. Its great and I have not been disappointed by anything here.

Party of four, started with the Bone Marrow, Mushroom Risotto, Devils on Horseback, and Duck Confit Flatbread.  All were delicious, but the Marrow was a standout.  For entrees, two of us had the Hudson Valley Duck, one had the Wagyu Beef, and one had the Meatloaf Special.  Everything was fantastic.  Service was great, would definitely go again.
Meat and potatoes is always amazing. The appetizers are delicious, the food is on point, and the drinks are mouth watering. It's a must go.

I almost can't articulate how wonderful my brunch was at Meat and Potatoes this past weekend, but I will try.  I went with a friend who I was visiting in Pittsburgh and we both got the Irish Breakfast Coffee, which was Jameson, Maple Whipped Cream, and Orange Peel. It was really delicious, not too boozy, just enough to tingle a little bit with the citrus when you took a sip.  We also shared the grilled bread with goat butter and rhubarb, and honestly I would have been sold at just bringing me the jar of rhubarb. It was so, so so good. And the perfect portion to not fill you up before your main dish.  For my main, I had the PBLT. I love BLT's as they are, and I've had other iterations of them with avocado and what not, but I don't think I was prepared for this. Pork belly, bacon, arugula, tomato and truffled mayo... AND it came with delicious fries?  Everything was fantastic all around, if you don't give this place a shot you're doing yourself a disservice.

Skee-Lo was wrong.  I'll say it right now.  He said,   I wish I was little bit taller, I wish I was a baller I wish I had a girl who looked good, I would call her I wish I had a rabbit in a hat with a bat and a '64 Impala*  You know who would NOT say that?  The short ribs flat bread at Meat & Potatoes. They embrace their shortness.  The Short Ribs Flat Bread has blue cheese / cheddar / arugula / horseradish.  That's all you need to know to understand this is delicious and those ribs don't need to be any taller!  Very cool decor, interesting menu, pretty good beer selection (I had an IPA from 21st Amendment brewery) but the reason this is five stars is the service. I sat at the bar and the three guys behind there were awesome.  Made great recommendations, made sure I had everything I needed and provided by far the best service I've ever had in Pittsburgh.  They get bonus points because one guy noticed I was wearing an Archer t-shirt and asked if I knew the Bloody Mary prayer**, which of course I did.  He said a lot of the bartenders have been reciting that.  Nice.  I don't know how I got Skee-Lo and Archer references in the same review, but hey, it's Pittsburgh.  Anything can happen!  Do me a personal favor and give this place a try.  _____________________________________________  * here's the audio track for Skee-Lo's biggest hit http://youtu.be/2s7MmcDjwek **Bloody Mary prayer- http://youtu.be/szwbdSK12hw

Fantastic vibe, great drinks, good food.  Mussels were my favorite, tried the beer mussels and they were fresh, perfectly seasoned, and made me want to scoop up and drink all the broth.  Bone marrow was okay, and salad was okay.  I think that about sums it up - the space is very hip and cool, the drinks are amazing (especially for someone who normally doesn't drink), the food is pretty good - definitely 4 stars good, great portions as well.  Just expect to hover over the bar if you didn't make reservations - but definitely worth a shot.
Tartare, sardines, gnocchi and pork chop along with craft cocktails and great service from KC... This place is great!  I will return and bring friends and family.
My all-time favorite restaurant!! Making a reservation is a must because there's no a ton of seating. Great for date night and special occasions!

While out in PIT, I checked out this Gastro pub. I have food restrictions and the staff worked with me around my dietary needs. I had the ahi tuna taquitos, salmon, and for dessert.....the Oreo mud pie. The flavors and ingredient combinations were great!  The meal at Meat & Potatoes one of the best that I had in PIT.     The gastro pub itself was tastefully decorated with modern decor and upbeat vibe.   I highly recommend it!

This is my favorite restaurant/bar combination in Pittsburgh. I still remember the opening of this restaurant as almost a beginning of the Pittsburgh foodie scene.  My recommendation here is sitting at their amazing bar with a friend, getting their Steak for Two (a huge 45 oz bone-in tomahawk)  and their Barrel Aged Manhattan (with a couple extra amarena cherries).  The food menu is always rotating with some interesting specials, but their mainstays (mac & cheeses, pasta, bone marrow, risotto, etc.) are phenomenal and I feel like I've tried almost all of them at this point.   This is the type of place where you come to the bar for just a drink and end up ordering all kinds of food because of how good it is.

I love this place for food and service!  Always a great experience and the food is flavorful!  If you don't have a reservation, the wait can be ridiculous, but it is worth it.  you can also walk up to the bar and they serve the full menu there.  I like their decor and location.  They also have outside seating.  I feel like it's a speakeasy type place because they serve the types of drinks served at speakesies.  My husband, who is a whiskey drinker, likes their manhattan drink  He says they make it differently here.  I'm not a whiskey person, so I won't be the best judge in that matter.  Like in everyone's reviews, the bone marrow appetizer is a must.  It may sound steep to pay $18 for it, but they actually give you a lot of bone marrow.  I've been to places where they serve one bone marrow, but this appetizer can be shared with 4 adults.  I say adults bc we have big appetites. LOL.  You can eat it as an entree bc it is filling, but probably won't be good for you healthwise.  The flavor is amazing with the toast and condiments that come with it, and you can ask for more toast if you want.    Tonight, my husband and I had dinner here before a show at heinz hall.  My husband had the duck dish and I had the pork belly tacos.  The portion here is huge, so I really feel like the price is on point.  My husband really wanted a peanut butter oreo dirt dessert, but I had to be a downer bc I wanted to go to another bar for martinis.  they have yummy desserts here.  I think they rotate but I remember the cheesecake in a jar being delicious.  The brunch is also good.  I like the short rib hash and huevos rancheros.  I've had better chicken and waffles in other cities, but this is the only place I know so far in pittsburgh that has chicken and waffles.  What I didn't like was the waffles were tough like it was dry and needed more syrup than what was given.  We had our engagement brunch here a year or so ago.  We were a group of 14, and when I originally made the reservation, they could only give us 2 separate tables.  I ended up saying yes to it bc I really wanted my out of town fam and friends to try this place.  They were so accommodating and ended up giving us the private room in the back.  eventhough it was hidden past the kitchen, that did not bother us at all.  I like how they arranged the tables into a big square, so it was easy to talk to everyone.  At that time, I forgot what everyone got, but everyone was impressed with the quality of food and the decor.  I feel like that says a lot bc our fam and friends came from foodie cities like chicago, nyc, seattle, cali.  In general, I highly recommend this place.  Good place to take an out of towner.

Brunch here is awesome, and one of the best deals in the city. M&P is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh.  1.) $5 bloody mary bar with infused spirits (jerk, bacon, & jalapeno tequila, others)  OR, $15 all you can drink bloody marys.  !!  2.) Food is amazing.  Everything we tried we raved about.  Chicken & waffles, short rib hash, scratch-made everything.  Huevos Rancheros will make you want to live here.  3.) Brunch is affordable!  4.) Lots of interesting cocktails as well as daily specials.  If you like food, you should definitely go here.  Now.

Fourth visit and it just seems better every time. Finally tried their charcuterie with cheese. In addition to being on a different planet from store-bought cured meats, M&P's house-cured versions of traditional terrines, hams, forcemeat and garnishes put the carnivorous delicacies served in other major metros to shame. Combined with the kobe+marrow+capers appetizer and it was hard to believe we were in Pittsburgh and not at a coastal foodie mecca (and I've been to a few).  I had the Branzino, which I rarely order because it can be so generic, but I needed to stick with something low-fat for health reasons. Not disappointed in the least. Whole fish, including head, served in a lovely copper dish on top of a kind of ragu of vegetables and small potatoes. Skin on, head on but NO BONES. Stuffed with lemon and herbs. OMG (and I never say OMG) this was so flavorful and easy to eat compared to the usual "whole fish" experience.  Will definitely find an excuse to go back again. While service can be lacking on a busy night - the food quality and creativity are worth the wait and then some.
Service was tremendous.    Great drinks...Brussels sprouts were very very good and salmon was cooked perfectly!!!

We came here for dinner on a Saturday after hearing about their great reviews. We made reservations and were seated promptly without having to wait. For apps, we had the tartar and the bone marrow. I my was my first time having bone marrow and tartar so I did not have anything to compare it to. I did enjoy both dishes and thought they were very flavorful. For main entrees, we ordered the duck and one of their specials. I thought the duck was a bit chewy for my taste, I've definitely had better and would probably would not order it again. The other dish (forget the name) was great and would definitely order again. For dessert, we had the French toast dish. Definitely delicious but felt more like a breakfast option than a dinner dessert option. Their cocktails and service are also great. The portions are definitely large. We left dinner very full. Would come again for a night out/cocktails at their bar.

I have always wanted to try the food here. So when my brother came in to town. They were super busy so I do suggest that you make reservation, I had the ceasar salad, my brother had the brussel to start with then we decided to do the meat for 2, which is amazing. 34oz ribeye it was amazing. Highly recommended

I was in town for a week, and ate there three times! I had the roasted chicken, the pot roast, the pappardelle, and the fall salad. I ate at the bar, where the staff was friendly and made good drinks as well. Mention must be made of the hostesses at the front, who went out of their way to be helpful.

I'm going to give Meat and Potatoes 3.5 stars here.  Before I start my review, I just want to say that there was unusual event that happened while we were dining that I'll try not to affect this review.  There was an altercation at the bar area, which almost ended up in a fight.  It disrupted the whole restaurant and after the culprit was removed from the restaurant, it took someone in my party twice to ask the manager to call the police (the culprit was just standing outside the restaurant) because maybe the manager thought he was kidding the first time? Nonetheless, it didn't ruin the evening and our waiter said in his 2 years working there, nothing like that had ever happened.  Back to the actual review...  I've wanted to go to Meat and Potatoes for as long as I've known they had the 34 oz. ribeye.  The restaurant was somewhat dark and the bar takes up most of the space in the middle of the room, but I've never sat in a more comfortable chair while dining out.  There's an extensive drinks menu, so you'll definitely be able to find something that works for you.  To start, our table got the fried chicken livers, the lobster mac and cheese, and the pierogies.  It was my first time trying chicken livers and they were delicious, as was the mac and cheese (which had a doritos crust that was really surprisingly good).  The pierogies tasted fine, but were cold so we asked the waiter to heat them up and they came back cold again, which was the main negative of the meal and the reason why I didn't give a full 4 stars.  For the entrée, I split the ribeye for two with a party member.  It was exactly like how I envisioned it.  Cooked exactly like how we wanted and the flavor was unbelievable.  It came with potato wedges and bone marrow, which were delicious as well.  Just a heads up, though (which I didn't know until we ordered), that the ribeye for two takes up to an hour to cook.  We weren't in any rush, so that was fine and it obviously makes sense because it's a massive piece of meat.

Great Lunch in the Cultural District!! Had the Thai Steak Salad and it was amazing!! Perfect size for lunch, and tasted delicious! Service was great and quick. We made a reservation, and it was needed for lunch since the tables got filled fast. The bar area was still open however. The overall feel, look, and atmosphere of Meat and Potatoes is like none other in Pittsburgh!!!

A highly reputed restaurant in Pittsburgh, famous for their 45oz ribeye (recommend median-rare, it's more tender, even though the attached photo is cooked median), bone marrow is also another famous dish at Meat & potatoes. I also like their chicken liver, anyone who don't like innards can give it a try, they process the liver well, you won't get that gamey taste. And their desserts are awesome, above my expectations. Reservations highly recommended, and do it early!! it's impossible to get seated by walk-ins.

Thanks fellow Yelpers!!  After reading so many amazing reviews about this place, Ive been dying to try this place. So when work offered me and few coworkers to pick up our dinner tab, I told my coworkers I knew exactly where to take them in the 'burgh! As a side note, this was all their first time in Pittsburgh by the way :)  We were impressed from the very beginning when they brought us the water. I loved that they left a bottle of water on our table. I drink alot of water and am always annoyed when the waitstaff doesn't refill it fast enough at other restaurants. We ordered wings and mac n  cheese to start as appetizers. Both were delicious! The entrees didnt disappoint either. We all ordered something different just so we can try a bite of different dishes. Last but not least, we also ordered a chocolate mousse. Every bite of that dessert was heaven. It went much too fast.  I want to come back again and try more different dishes!

Finally got around to trying Meat & Potatoes! Overall, we had some great food and drinks, but it did not blow me away. I would probably choose to go somewhere else for a nice dinner, just based on my own preferences for fish and lighter fare, but we had a good experience overall. Service was friendly and attentive, but we were there for early dinner before it got hectic. The cocktails were tasty and strong, but I didn't see anything too unique. I would say that the drafts were a little disappointing as they only had two or three on tap that were not IPAs.  In more detail are the dishes we sampled:  **Special Shrimp and Shishito Pepper Appetizer** 3/5 This dish was okay, but the shrimp was very salty.   **Smoked Buffalo Wings** 4/5  Solid wings, with crispy exterior and moist, smoked flesh.   **Wagyu Flat Iron Steak** 4/5 The steak itself was phenomenal and cooked perfectly, but the accompanying potatoes and sauce were way too salty!  **Special Black Squid Ink Pasta** 3/5 Pasta was cooked a little too soft and the shrimp was over salted. The sauce was milder and less salty, which helped balance the dish, but overall was not too impressed.   **Pub Burger** 5/5  Get this! I heard only happy mumbles as my eating companions scarfed down this massive burger. I've heard great things about the burger and was not disappointed.   **Vanilla Panna Cotta** 4/5 I'm used to softer Panna cotta but I enjoyed this slightly firmer version with Apple butter and granola on top. It wasn't what I would expect on Panna cotta but it somehow worked.

I finally came here for the first time for my birthday. I ordered their salmon. Ooh it's so freaking delicious. I love how they cook their black rice so soft but yet not soggy. The salmon was cooked medium, just the way I like it. And the combination with the spicy Korean sauce and fried egg. It was perfect! I didn't order anything else unfortunately but I'm already excited for my next visit here. I've heard so many good things about this place. My boyfriend got their lamb meatball, he loves it except for he thinks it's too many mint leaves. We had such a great experience overall, except one little thing. The menu said the lamb meatball was $20 and they ended up charging us $22. They later on fixed it after we told them. Look carefully next time. I don't think this happens often, but it's strange! I know it's $2 but all the waiters and waitresses should know the price that's on the menu.

The food and atmosphere is rustic with a warm feel. The staff is helpful and a attentive..worth the wait .. Farm to table concept. Excellent drinks made fresh .. I should have made a reservation. Looking forward to something delicious

The service was great, but the food was even better.  I would go there in again in a heartbeat.  I have food allergies and they were great about handling them.  The atmosphere is nice as well.  I ordered the flat iron steak, hands down it was the best steak of my life.  It was cooked to perfection and seasoned perfectly.

I liked this trendy restaurant.  Some of the seating is a little close, with servers bumping into you every now and then and it can be loud with all the hard surfaces and very few soft ones.  It took quite a while for our server to show up but they were very busy.  The food was good prepared with a lot of imagination and the signature drinks were fun to try.  Great oasis in downtown Pittsburgh.

Meat & Potatoes was definitely the best meal I had while visiting Pittsburgh! Loved the ambiance of the restaurant, definitely a great place to go for date night or to celebrate a special occasion.  Cocktails (4/5): We all enjoyed our drinks and the prices weren't too bad either.  Caesar Salad (5/5): highly recommend ordering, it was amazing! The crunchy pork rinds and crispy pig ears complimented the salad perfectly and the addition of the egg was also unique.  Roasted Duck Breast (4/5): really enjoyed the duck, it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. However, I don't eat polenta so I asked to sub a side potato dish instead which the server said I could, but did not inform me that there would be an additional $4 charge for this. Would have been nice to know.  45 oz Ribeye for Two (3.5/5): the first ribeye they brought out was rare so we had to send it back. I found it odd that the bone marrow wasn't served with any toast or bread because it was really oily eating it by itself. Chimichurri and horse radish sauces were decent.   Truffle Fries (5/5): great fries, loved the aioli.  Overall a great spot for dinner downtown. Will be back the next time I come to Pittsburgh.
Lived in PGH when it opened. Moved away, and make sure I visit every time I come back. Great place

What an amazing dining experience.... ambience, service, food and beverage 5 stars across the board. Im guessing if you've rated this place poorly you probably own a competing restaurant down the block. Seriously, my only complaint, restrooms are in the lobby.    Meat & Potatoes, Pittsburgh..... Holy Mother of God hands down epicurean delight. If you find yourself in this lovely city it would be a heresy not to dine here.   Caesar Salad.... pickled green tomatoes, fried egg, chicharrones, crispy pig ear, Parmesan.  Hudson valley duck breast.... dandelion, almond purée and fried polenta.
Always a great meal, perfect drinks and relaxed atmosphere.

42oz cowboy steak is out of this world. Split it with a friend although we both agreed that of we go back we might each get one of our own.  Had it with the white truffle butter, which was a good touch, but not necessary. The truffle fries are above average; as a note I'm  usually not wild about truffle fries as they're somewhat over played and underwhelming.  Service was good too, cocktails were all well made and garnished. The wine options offer good variety.

Good service.  We were seated before our reservation time. Wait staff are friendly and helpful.  Now on to the food: seviche appetizer was delicious and fresh.  For main course, we had the flatiron steak and the pork--both perfectly prepared, flavorful, and copious.  About that wine list... If you are going to offer so many options of deliciously prepared meat, it is my opinion that you should have a wine list to go with it.  The regular wine list on the menu is quite limited. The "special" wine list that the server showed us after the meal was over (since I asked) was very pricey.  I understand that this establishment is a gastro pub, and focuses on beer and cocktails.  However, it is my opinion that an expanded wine list would greatly improve the quality of the meals, especially if it included options from Italy and France, and at reasonable prices.  There is no reason, in my mind, for a gastro  pub to ignore wine selection!  Otherwise, we have no complaints. I would be remiss if I did not mention that the desserts were delicious, both the lemon berry pie and the chocolate pot de crème.

What a dump!!! When we arrived here we were greeted by an indifferent, teenage hostess who was 100% absorbed in her smartphone... she actually had her feet on the hostess stand! Nice!!! When she deigned to put her petulant eyes on us, she actually scowled at me... Gee, I had the concierge at our 5 star hotel make this reservation (against his advice), as I had read positive yelp reviews about the place. But this individual was truly pissed that we were there, and before long, so was I... The "restaurant" was understandably 3/4 empty but the "hostess" insisted on seating us on top of another table... Our gracious neighbors insisted that it was "OK", if we sat down (practically in their laps) but I explained that we were from out of town and weren't comfortable with banquet seating. Our little snot of a hostess then said we that we "could sit there or nowhere", even though there were a ton of empty tables! What? Really??? That was when I noticed the smell in this "eatery"! It was an unholy cross between disinfectant, manure and offal...Usually when Satan manifests in the flesh he is accompanied by a strong fecal odor, so I instantly knew that we were in the wrong place and urgently needed to flee... I made the sign of the cross at this vile little creature as we slowly backed up and headed for the door. After running for our lives down the street, we ended up at a wonderful little Italian place where we enjoyed a magnificent meal. Like I said, we're from out of town and should have listened to our concierge who had warned us to avoid, "Meat and Potatoes like the plague"! I should have listened... My bad!!!

Meat & potatoes for two. So SO yum.  Bf and I were here about a month ago for dinner and libations. We ordered the "build your own" meat & potatoes for 2 for $75. This sounds like a bit of a hefty price tag but it is so so so worth it. An order includes a 45oz rib eye served next to their signature bone marrow gratin. So tender. So savory. I'm making myself drool just thinking about it. For $2 extra we also got chimchurri sauce (other sauces are available though, depending on your taste) as well as a side of truffle fries and mushroom ragu for an addition $8 apiece. While all that added up pretty quickly, the truffle fries were seasoned to perfection: evenly but not too heavy handedly and definitely some of the best I have had in a long long time. The entire meal was so good and the portions generous enough that we had enough to take home for lunch the next day.  The drinks, however, did not impress me so much. I am far from a connoisseur of craft cocktails, and since I am aware I know nothing, I always ask the experts (aka the bartender). Our bartender that night wasn't super helpful. Based on my preferences, he recommended the dark & stormy but bf was already planning to get that so I asked for another recommendation. He had none. This baffled me because.. I mean, he's the one that makes the drinks right??  I picked something else but didn't care for it and ended up not ordering a second because I was a little put off by that point (and also super stuffed from all the meat & potatoes).  All in all, would definitely recommend giving this place a try. The ambiance is nice. Dark and romantic enough for a nice date or boisterous enough for a girls' night for drinks and chat.

I have now been back numerous times sitting both at tables and at the bar and I am convinced that this is one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh.   Returned with my husband, my sister and her boyfriend for dinner. We were seated at a large table by the kitchen which would usually annoy me from the noise, but the chairs were so comfortable, and it really wasn't that loud!  We couldn't decide what to order, so I suggested we order a bunch of appetizers and small plates and share (a genius call according to my sisters boyfriend) and a few cocktails.    The cocktails that were ordered:  First Word: my new favorite and have ordered each subsequent visit to the restaurant!  Desperado: delicious tequila cocktail, but a definite punch!   The Food:  Fried Pickles (these were good, but my husband has had better)  Fried Brussels (a must order.  Delicious!) Bone Marrow (absolutely amazing!) Tartare (I wasn't a huge fan of the peanuts featured in it, but the beef was delicious)  Risotto (delicious, but more toothsome than other versions I have had)  Caesar Salad (absolutely delicious with a perfectly cooked fried egg and delicious pig ears!) Mussels (delicious and huge!)   Went again last night and had:  First Word cocktail (I can't say enough about this delicious drink!)  Caesar Salad (awesome)  Meat and Potatoes for two (ordered rare and it was spot on!  The bone marrow, mushrooms, and confit potatoes were great accompaniments!)  We will be back over and over again!

Went here to celebrate my son receiving his 'white coat' at Pitt's pharmacy school. Nice decor and ambience. I think our waiter was new, but that won't impact my impression of this place. Loved the food. Easy to find. A little surprised they don't offer valet parking, but there is an indoor parking lot up the street. I had to try their iconic bone marrow I heard so much about(Travel Channel). It was delicious. Like meat butter, but very fatty if you're health conscious. I was disappointed to hear the 'Tomahawk' steak I'd seen on the Travel Channel was no longer on the menu. I had the Bronzino(head on) as my entrée. I've had this dish many places and some places will filet it for you and remove the head. While the dish was filleted, the head remained on, which adds to the experience. Doesn't bother me. My son had the lamb cassoulet. Very tender and flavorful. I'll definitely get that when I come back.

Loved, loved, loved it here!!! I ate maybe the best sandwich in my life! We started off with smoked wings which were delicious and I got the three little pigs sandwich! I did have to take it off of the bread because the bread was a little bulky for me but the pork was perfect, the bacon pork belly was delicious, the ham was nice, and the egg was just the perfect topping to make everything just right! I was in Pittsburgh for work and I am mad I don't live closer to the sandwich although it's probably better for my health that i'm not!! I will be back though!!

I know what you're thinking... Seriously, another 5 star review? Why so? Here's the deal folks. This place has consistently been awesome. Dinner: awesome! Brunch: awesome! And drumroll please... Lunch: AWESOME!  There's not many places I can say that about, but they find a way to be creative and deliscious with every meal. I do hope you read all my other reviews on this place for tips on what I thought were gear choice (poutine, cough cough) but for lunch I probably had thee best fish sandwich I've ever had!   They just opened for lunch today and are running a special Lentin menu with fish, fish and more fish... And one burger (seriously, if you don't like fish or a burger you might be screwed till Easter.).   I had the Parmesan fish sammie, which was a generous portion of perfectly battered fish, a VERY generous portion of provolone and tomato sauce. But the crown jewel was the smoked potato salad side dish. Again, generous portion of some of the most delectable and inventive potato salad I've ever had! The smoked taste stayed with me for a while after, but rather than garlic breathe, it was actual a reminder how, oh. My. Gawd. Amazing it was! To be continued....

This was a fun place with good drinks and people generally having fun.  The food?  It was OK.  The idea is apparently to reclaim old classics, with things on the menu like chicken pot pie and devils on horseback.  The pot pie was fine, although it seemed overpriced at $20.  The sweetbreads were OK, but lacked the silky delicacy you expect from them.  The fries that accompanied the burger were limp and uninteresting.  It's really not bad, and it was fun -- everyone in the restaurant seemed to be enjoying themselves, and there was a great friendly vibe.  The service was attentive if not particularly effusive.

Never thought we would be able to eat at Meat & Potatoes with the rave reviews we are reading on Yelp. Stopped in late Saturday night and was able to sit at the bar. Wow were we lucky, Top notch atmosphere, Great libations, first class service and the food couldn't be better. Being late we went with a few small items. The César salad was the best we ever had.  the chicharrones and crispy pig ear really sets it apart from other César's. Then off the bartenders recommendation we went with the pork dish, very enjoyable. Wow what a great place, wish we were closer!

I must say....I adore this place!!! The food is always great...staff fantastic. I went 2x's in one week...that's how much I enjoy this place. The fried pickles and brussel sprouts.....yuuuuummm!!!! The drinks fun...strong...and delish. I cant rave anymore about this place. I took friends last night and they want to go back.....they drank the kook aid.

This is a very trendy restaurant - Gastropub.  The food we enjoyed was quite tasty.  We sat at the bar because it was a busy evening with post college graduation diners filling the place.  The mixologist provided much entertainment.  My only complaint is that they did not have non-alcoholic beer.

We definitely waited too long to try this place. It was marvelous. Great atmosphere, delicious food. I have no complaints whatsoever! Great spot for a date night, and had a fun crowd too. Waiters were attentive and polite. We will definitely return.

Expected a typical steak place, in fact, just one steak item on the menu. Started with a fantastic punch from the bowl right on the bar, drinks are unique & very good selection of microbrews. Fried Brussel sprouts were excellent as was mushroom risotto. Hubby's steak was good but lukewarm. Lose a star for hipper-than-thou staff - which I think is the concept but unfortunately came with the  attitude to match. Tables were tiny & jammed up against each other. We gave up our table, moved to the bar, and had a very good experience.
I want to go back again and again and again. Everything was so delicious! It was a flavorful feast! Manhattan, fried Brussels, bone marrow, Hudson Valley Duck, and chocolate mousse dessert. Wow.

Damn, can this place do brunch! I've been to a number of brunch places around the Pittsburgh area and this one might well be my favorite.  Let's start with the ambiance. Perfect lighting, not too bright and not too dim. Great for those coming to eat to cure themselves of their hangovers. The music playing were those AWESOME 90s jams we all love and keep near and dear to our hearts (you know that Lifehouse, Matchbox 20, and Third Eye Blind!).  I went with 3 other friends and was seated at the bar and greeted by friendly bartenders. We ordered the following: shrimp and grits, 2 orders of chicken and waffles, and scrambled eggs with potato gratin. Oh and of course some mimosas and bloody Marys (because, duh, it's brunch).   I did not have the fortune of tasting the shrimp and grits but the friend who ordered it said, and I quote, "I wish that never had to end". So, I'm guessing it was pretty freaking good. The friend who received the scrambled eggs said they were the best he had ever had.  Now, onto the chicken and waffles. WOOWEE. These chicken and waffles gave meaning to my life. I had a reason to live. To love. To write this review. First, the chicken...the amount they gave us, you would've thought they gave us the whole damn farm! Like 4 HUGE pieces of chicken topped on a giant Jalapeño waffle (jalapeño in a waffle?! The future is now, people) with a side of bourbon-bacon maple syrup. This entire thing lasted me for at least another 2 meals. Talk about getting your money's worth!  Onwards to service! So friendly and nice. When they took our plates, you would've thought we were doing THEM a favor by having our plates removed. Bartenders were great, they talked to us, but not in a forced way and kept us entertained with their mixology while we waited patiently for our food.   Bottom line, this place is wonderful. All the hype Meat and Potatoes gets is honestly all true. What an excellent dining experience and quite affordable too (at least brunch was)! Highly recommend this place, whether or not you need a pick-me-up from an all night bender or just want a nice casual, but classy brunch. Definitely looking forward to returning here again!

I had heard a lot about this place so we tried it out for the first time on a Saturday. We made reservations about 2 weeks in advance and they only had a 5:15 and 7:30 at that point so I would def. make reservations if you plan on eating here.   Pros: -Really cool interior design- industrial/glamorous feel to it. -The food- the food is Delicious. The combined flavors on everything is just awesome. I had the roasted chicken, my husband at the pot roast, and we split the cheese plate as an appetizer. It was all awesome. The cheese plate came with 2 different cheeses (I believe blue cheese was one of them with a sea salt on it), some delicious walnuts, fig? , and a spread with toast. It really hit the spot!   Cons: -Very tight seating. You will be about 1 foot away from other tables on both sides of you and when a waiter is at that other table, their behind will be in your face. Not a big deal but if your someone that is bothered by tight spaces and like your privacy, you will want to skip this place. -Bloody Mary- I was excited to see they had a bloody mary bar but found out it was only for brunch. I decided to order one anyway because I figured it would still be awesome. I mean, they have all the toppings for it still! Wrong- the drink was weak, not spicy, and was served with a lemon wedge and a tiny green olive. No cucumber, pepper ring, nothing. I thought they would at least throw a few things on a toothpick in the drink  Overall, I would come back here again for dinner, however I would skip the drinks or maybe try a drink they specialize in on their menu rather than ordering something off the menu.

Stopped by here a few times on our weekend visit. Fell in love with the bone marrow/meat butter.  It's insanely good.  Atmosphere is great and service was wonderful!  Also, had the best drink ever - smoked honey bee!  Get it.

Never a bad experience here. We tend to get the pork chop and scallops if offered. But you can't go wrong with any dish! The Brussels sprouts and risotto are staple too! Drinks are delicious and the atmosphere is perfect
